story:
The Story

Set in the brush of South Texas, Chupaboer is the tale of Herbie Boer, who's just your average, run-of-the-mill goat. In order to come to terms with the loss of his mother, he practices yoga daily with his best friend, Precious Pygmy. At least, he tries to practice, but Bub, the herd leader, takes pleasure in disturbing Herbie just to remind our hero that he's a bottle baby and will never be capable of taking care of the does, particularly Nancy.

One night, Bub is snatched up by a creature many goats have heard of but none have seen: The Breath. Herbie is all set to say, "Good riddance," to Bub's teasing, but when Nancy asks him to go Breath-hunting for the good of the herd, and maybe even rescue Bub in the process, Herbie just can't say no. This request puts him on a journey that'll test his inner strength, and maybe, just maybe, help him get the girl.

What We Need & What You Get

Chris of Abyssopus Studios is pencilling, inking, and coloring the pages, while Ed Brisson is lettering. Chris and I have worked on character sketches and the logo, and he's finished the first page, so the project is going full-force ahead. As this is going to be an independently published comic, though, we're going to need your help to get it to the printers in time for a spring 2012 release.

That means everything raised in this campaign will go towards the artists and printing costs.

Take a look at the incentives to donate. From t-shirts to goat soap, there's something for everyone. Remember, anything and everything moves us closer to our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't back right now but you still are stoked by the concept? Tell your friends! Share on Facebook, tweet about it on Twitter, send up smoke signals. Any and all talk helps! *Looks Down* By the way, this is the tee shirt design!

story:
About Me

My name is Owen Ratliff, President of Ratti Entertainment LLC and creator of a martial arts transmedia franchise, entitled “Black Salt”. We have been working to help as many kids as we can through our sales of Black Salt products and are working hard to complete another product line with our graphic novel. Through our sales we are able to help kids who have lost their programs due to school budget cuts and replace them. We attempted to finish the comic book/graphic novel project a year ago, but my brother took ill with diabetes, so I put the project on hold to take care of him. Since his recent passing, I have been dealing with this terrible loss in my life and have only now just found the strength to finish the project, which will be dedicated to my big brother, Hubert Ross. It is interesting how, after a tragic event such as this, we find the need to prioritize that which was once important to us. So, I am turning to our fans and the public for the strength and support to see this project through to completion and help us help "Save Our Kids"!

Project Summary

The comic book story is adapted from the original screenplay. This 6 issue comic book series is entitled “Black Salt; The Last Heroes Left”. The story is an epic thriller, merging the world of modern-day espionage and political intrigue, with the world of ancient martial arts. Samuel Tharpe is the top counter terrorism agent in the world. For years, he has hunted down and foiled the twisted plans of the world’s most dangerous criminal organizations, crime lords, warmongers and anarchists. But Sam is no ordinary agent. He was trained secretly, outside the temple walls, one of the lost arts of Shaolin by the legendary Master Yu Bai Shek. He is a master of many weapons and is able to do incredible athletic feats that border on superhuman. He is even able to generate extremely high levels of chi energy that he uses in offensive attacks.

The Team

1) President: Owen Ratliff

2) Producer/ Creator: Aries Carmona

3) Producers: John Newkirk & Brian David Robinson

4) Editor-in-Chief: Owen Ratliff & Brian David Robinson  

5) Writer: Chad Boudreau

6) Pencils/Inks/Cover: J.C. Grande

7) Color: Santosh Kumar Rath/ MAI

8) Letters: Ed Brisson

9) Marketing: Tammy Moorehead & Heather Taskovics

10) Website & Video: Jessica Williams  & John Valera

 

What We Need (and why)

The first 4 issues are completed and the 5th issue is ready for coloring. The script and cover art are completed for the last issue. We need to raise $5,500 to color issue five, do pencils/inks/color for issue 6 and create the graphic novel cover.

This amount of money will cover:

1) Coloring Issue #5
2) Lettering Issue #5
3) Pre-Press Issue #5
4) Pencil/Inks Issue #6
5) Coloring Issue #6
6) Lettering Issue #6
7) Pre-Press Issue #6
8) Pencil/Inks/Color Graphic Novel Cover
9) Pre-Press Graphic Novel (all six issues combined)
10) Printing comic book copies

Funding above our goal in this campaign will go toward marketing, promotions and printing cost. 

We have some very interested publishers, but we have to turn in a fully completed series. Our strategy is to start by distributing the single issues through all the digital platforms, and then release single issues through print (after the third issue is released). We will be releasing the graphic novel after the 6th issue is completed, (all 6 issues combined), to cover the book market as well as the comic book market. Ratti’s main goal is to release the comic book series and the apparel line to build the brand and establish the Intellectual property as a bankable IP.

There are several small factors that set Black Salt apart from other comics. First, there is still a big demand for the action martial arts genre. This genre is a niche target market of over 100 million martial artists and enthusiasts worldwide. Secondly, our grass roots marketing campaign has already generated a buzz of more than 1.5 million hits on the website www.blacksaltfilm.com. Thirdly, Black Salt has a fully developed feature film project that could go into pre-production immediately.

What You Get (Perks!)

We have a number of pledges and rewards listed to the right. Please review the options and consider extending your support. Anything you give is appreciated - as every dollar pushes us closer towards our goal. 

To show our appreciation we have added a page in the comic book "A Special Thanks To" section, to list the full names of all those who supported with ANY level of donation (upon completion of the comic book).

You can find visual examples of these product rewards below!
 


#1 The Origin
#2 The Return To Shoalin 
#3 The Forbidden Past

#4 The Enemy Within
#5 The Deadly Escape
#6 The Showdown


Graphic Tee / Beanie
Logo Tee 
Baseball Cap

      

  An example of a shadow box awarded to "Kathy Long" to reflect the quality and size of and not the exact Shadow Box with issue #6, certificate with your name on it listed as Executive Producer.

      

An excerpt from issue #4. Click here to enlarge. (Opens in a new tab or window)

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

You can help us reach this most exciting of destinations by; upgrading your perks, liking us on Facebook, Twitter , and sharing our YouTube posts to get your friends, colleagues and families involved in our journey together. Also by the purchase of Black Salt Products we'll be broadening our reach as we all pull together as a team, then we can all arrive there together to celebrate the difference we all made!

I wish to thank you again for taking the time to consider joining this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Hello all! My name is Mary Bruhand and I've loved cartoons since I was a child. For a large portion of my life, I've wanted to be a voice actor and a writer but sadly, circumstances have made it hard for me to do either professionally. I hope to finally introduce one of my stories to the world via the power of the internet and I need your help! I've been paying a very close friend of mine to design graphics for a website (due to go up December 12th) out-of-pocket and another close friend of mine who is also passionate about the project has helped me to program it. I've already reserved the domain with 1and1 Internet and I'm really excited to see this become a reality! Unfortunately, I'm not made of money and I'd love to see support for my project from people who are as passionate as I am!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I've got high ambitions and high ambitions require lots of moolah. However, I'm also choosing to be humble and not ask for anymore than the bare minimum. I've already paid out just over $300 for my artist and would love to pay my programmer if I raise more than that! Any extra I raise will go to paying for the website and the more money I get, the more I'll be able to pay my artist and the more often we'll be able to pump out strips!

 

My current, highly ambitious goal would be around $10,000. That would cover the website, the programming, the campaign perks and my artist for the first 100 strips.

 

This won't be easy but I like a challenge!

 

What do you get in return? If this campaign succeeds then you will have a solid webcomic. Unfortunately, the creator and the artist are both busy so the schedule will start at one page per month. Once they settle into the routine, they'll be able to bump up the schedule to twice a month and maybe someday soon, we'll see once every single week!

 

You'll also get all sorts of OTHER neat little nik naks as listed on the side of the page!

 

The Impact

Making dreams come true feels pretty good! Especially when you get to share in the experience!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, YouTube, DeviantArt or anywhere else you can think of! Not super techno-savvy? Get on the phone with some friends, leave messages and paper notes for people to find. Hang posters around your neighbourhood! Every little bit helps!

Find Mary Bruhand on DeviantArt here:

http://tinker-jet.deviantart.com/

Find Elizabeth Domanico on DeviantArt here:

http://leaffox.deviantart.com/

Follow this cause and show your support on Twitter here:

https://twitter.com/tinker_jet

Follow Troidzone on DeviantArt here:

http://troidzone.deviantart.com

 

When You Can Expect Your Perks

Unfortunately, Mary Bruhand works full time (while providing care for a handicapped boy) so once the campaign ends, it might take a little while to get around to everyone but please don't worry! There's no way that we'll be able to forget someone who helped to make my dreams come true!

Please note: Since some of the perks will be coming from different sources, you may end up receiving certain perks later than others. Don't be alarmed. We haven't ripped you off. The rest is in the mail.

 

Disclaimer

For those of you choosing the $1,000 mark with the intention of getting a character named after you, please understand that you are just buying a name. (First name only. If you try to submit a vulgar name, I will simply go ahead and use the first name provided by your Paypal.) You are not buying the chance to have your favourite character or a character created by you featured in my comic. Yes, I am responsible for the type of character I assign your name to however, I am not responsible for whether or not the character is somehow offensive or not to your liking. Also keep in mind that just because you paid for the character name does not mean that your character has 'life insurance'. They may or may not live to see the end of the story. And even if they do manage to stick around, they may not get much more than a small cameo.

 

On the day the comic is released with your name on it, I will be sure to give a shout-out with your full name available to the public... so don't worry too much. Everyone will know how awesome you are.

story:
What is this?

The Prince of Trinita is a webcomic series that you can read here.  It's about two ordinary fishergirls, Raina and Fiume, and their quest to save the Prince of Trinita from an evil warlord.

It also features robots, and legendary swords.  More on those in a moment.

Tell Me More.

The Prince of Trinita is about two fishergirls, Raina and Fiume, on their quest to save the Prince of Trinita from the evil Warlord Devionos, who has turned him to stone using his fearsome StoneSword, and taken him to the far-off kingdom of Inferno.

The girls decide to take up the case once Raina finds a strange sword of her own, the legendary Aquasword, a weapon that can cut through anything and hide itself when not in use.

.
The first action-packed issue features an army of evil robots attacking a city of friendly robots called Clinks.  Our heroines must fight them off in order to save the city and get help for their quest.


Okay, so How Can I Help Out?

I would like to get as many people reading this comic as possible, which means marketing, printing, and going to comic cons and shows to help bring this comic to discerning readers like you. 

This all is costly, so I will need your help to get an awesome webcomic out into the real world!

I'm also offering lots of neat stuff for people who help out monetarily, for starters, you'll be among the first to get comics off the press, plus you can get pins, posters, and original sketches!

What, So You Just Want Money?

Oh no.  Actually, it's just as helpful if you spread the word to your friends!  Share the original webcomic on twitter, facebook, google+, Tumblr, any site you like using, really.  As long as people are interested in this comic, I can promise it will be great!

Also, if you'd like interviews, blog spots, or anything really, I'm on board, just keep in touch.

If you want to link it to your friends, just copy and paste the links below!

http://www.trinitacomics.com
http://igg.me/p/64048?a=359797

Thankyou very much!

story:
We have all had someone in our life ...

We have all had someone in our life whom we have been forced to watch addiction destroy slowly.  They made one bad decision and spent the rest of their life suffering at it's mercy.  I feel they may have only went down that path because they didn't see themself as equipped to make any other choice, especially saying "no" to their peers and going against the grain in a rough environment.  I am passionate about this project because I often felt alone in making the "right" choice while my peers got involved in negative and/or destructive activities and I think more children would not get started on the wrong path (that they don't want to start on) if they had support, even if it comes in larger than life heroes and heroines in familiar situations.  After all positive role models have to out number the bad in our fight for our souls and shouldn't we all  be the hero in our life stories?

  • Although this is my first time illustrating and coloring my own independent release, I have written comic books and published short stories for over 10 years.  They kids who have read it so far LOVE it!

  • When I reach the goal of $1850 I can put this awesome full color glossy paged comic in the hands of 1000 children, some of whom may bloom into artists themselves (I am also releasing a DVD detailing the creation process so they can be inspired to be creative and learn how the professional technical specifications are achieved.)  Good looking comic books get cherished for years!

Your contribution -no matter what amount- will make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute money, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please put the word out and make some noise about this campaign!  I need you!

  • If you know anyone that drugs have hurt and/or killed the potential of please POST A LINK to this ON FACEBOOK PAGES of friends who may be interested, TWEET A LINK to this campaign and TALK ABOUT IT with your friends IN PERSON!   Every bit helps and may be the "read" that saves a life!   Thanks!

story:
Exclusive Founder's Edition Bundle

Three teams of creators have poured their passion into exciting new adventures. These exclusive Founder's Edition debut comics are nearing COMPLETION and READY TO PRINT! Each book is 24-25 pages of action-packed adventure, 73 pages in total! Time is limited, preorder yours TODAY. Saying "YES!" to these incredible stories will help put a new era of heroes into the hands of a new generation of fans.

Your support gives you a sneak peek at the creative process and exclusive insights into each book through regular campaign updates. Upgrade your order at checkout with a host of great add-ons like t-shirts, posters, and digital comics. ALL backers receive an Allegiance Sticker and a Founder’s Edition Bookmark, so you'll never get lost on your adventure.

 

*By the end of the campaign. Race to the finish with us in campaign updates.

 

Discover a Hero in Every One.

THE FUTURISTS

1866. Stricken by an insidious curse, three outrageous egos race to unearth the mythical lost city of Shambhala. In their way is Teddy, a treasure-hunting rogue with a dark secret who must save the family he left behind. To rescue his daughter, Hannah, from dark magic, Teddy must forge an unlikely alliance with Harij, a beguiling young shaman who is much more than he seems. Together, they will navigate a war-torn landscape and face terrifying monsters, murderous cults, macabre plots, and the exotic mysteries of ancient India.

24 story pages. 32 pages total.

Script: Patrick Stiles Art: Butch Guice Ink Assist: Rick Magyar Color: Mitch & Elizabeth Breitweiser Letters: Eric Weathers

...

 

U.S. MARSHAL BASS REEVES

"There is no law west of St. Louis, and no God west of Fort Smith.” So says Judge Isaac Parker. But "The Hanging Judge" will need a new breed of lawman to tame the badlands of the Oklahoma territories, a man who would walk into Hell to bring the law to the Devil himself.

He needs Bass Reeves.

Slave. Lawman. Legend.

This is the true story of how the West was won.

25 story pages. 32 pages total.

Script: Kevin Grevioux Art: David Williams Color: Kelsey Shannon Letters: Eric Weathers

...

 

NORAH'S SAGA

New school. New World, literally.

Sassy, book-smart Norah Karlsson's quest to fit in becomes an epic tale of survival when she crashes through the mists of time and into a realm of ice and Norse legend.

The high school’s mean girls had nothing on the god of mischief, and at least they never tied her to a stake. Bullies? Try trolls, and not the Internet variety.

Forget sharing a table with the cool kids in the cafeteria; Norah would be just as happy if she didn’t have to slay her lunch!

24 story pages. 32 pages total.

Script: Blake Northcott Art and Color: Kelsey Shannon Letters: Eric Weathers

...

 

PREMIER CREATORS.

Celebrate these incredible talents!

From left to right: Blake Northcott, Butch Guice, David Williams, Elizabeth Breitweiser, Eric Weathers, Kelsey Shannon, Kevin Grevioux, Mitch Breitweiser, Patrick Stiles

 

...


TANTALIZING PERKS & ADD-ONS!

There are dozens of ways to customize your adventure! Start with these

Exclusive Founder's Edition Comics.

 

 

Add a +2 to your charisma.

Hero T-shirts by Designer Chris Kindrick.

 

 

 

We’ve got you covered!

13x19 Hero Posters

 

art by David Williams, Kelsey Shannon, and Mitch Breitweiser

 

Signature Bookplates

3 Custom Bookplates. 12 creator signatures.

 

 

 

LIMITED EDITION PRINTS!

SIGNED & NUMBERED, these lithographs are manufactured with the highest quality archival inks and papers. *Available as an Add-On at checkout.

 

Our gift to you:

Founder's Edition Bookmark and Allegiance Sticker

 

Celebrate campaign milestones.

UNLOCK NEW STRETCH GOALS!

 

 

$90k – 9 lettered preview pages (3 from each book)  leaked to ALL BACKERS in a campaign update.

$110K –Gold foil Founder's Edition Bookplates for the SIGNATURE TIER.

$150K –???

World-class art and great stories are the heart and soul of Allegiance Arts & Entertainment. We’re incredibly proud of what this team has accomplished, and we hope you’ll join us for the adventure ahead.

This is only the beginning

...

 

 

...

 

MITCH BREITWEISER - Founder / Chairman / CCO
ELIZABETH BREITWEISER - Founder / President / Publisher
DAVID F. MARTIN - Founder / CEO
PATRICK STILES - Editor-in-Chief
TERRY JOHNSON - Vice-President of Sales
CHRISTEN SHAW - Campaign & Fulfillment Manager
CHRIS KINDRICK - Marketing Director / Design

Time is limited, preorder yours TODAY. Saying "YES!" to these incredible stories will help put a new era of heroes into the hands of a new generation of fans.Your support gives you a sneak peek at the creative process and exclusive insights into each book through regular campaign updates. Upgrade your order at checkout with a host of great add-ons like t-shirts, posters, and digital comics. ALL backers receive an Allegiance Sticker and a Founder’s Edition Bookmark, so you'll never get lost on your adventure. *By the end of the campaign. story:
Short Summary

"An Art of Intervals" is an upcoming art show that features the work of four young female comic artists, Abigael Puritz, and Grace Passerotti.  Showing at the Brooklyn, New York arts space, Tarot Society, from February 26th through February 28th, we hope to raise the funds to cover the cost of shipping the work to the gallery as well taking care of the expenses of opening night.   

Additionally, we are in the process of making new work specifically for this show to be released on our opening night.  The majority of the funding will go toward collecting and publishing all of this new work in a zine that will be available both through this fundraiser and at Tarot Society for the duration of the show.  

Expenses

500- printing the zine

140- shipping original work to and from the Tarot Society, sending completed zines to Grace .

100- Various Show expenses, transportation, ect

50- Promotional materials, postcards, fliers, ect.

Any remaining funds will be dispersed between the artists to cover the costs of materials.  

ABOUT THE ARTISTS! 

Grace Passerotti


Grace Passerotti is a bodacious babe freelancing art from portland, oregon. Made in 1989, Grace is inspired by bright colors, intense emotions and fleshmeats. She is currently working on a graphic novel which can be found at dearskincomic.com ! you can feast on delicious art at etsy.com/shop/CUTEMEATS and follow creepy updates on her instagram @ gracepasserotti





Abigael Puritz

Abigael Puritz is a graphic novelist/painter/printmaker/enthusiastic dancer currently residing in Brooklyn NY, originally from Oneonta NY. A graduate of Purchase college School of art and design, she has shown her work several times at the NY Book Fair at MOMA PS1, Paper Jam at The Silent Barn, and is a regular contributor to Circus of Dreams at Bizarre in Bushwick Brooklyn. Her work is collections such as Columbia and Stanford University Libraries. She is inspired by the likes of Satoshi Kon, Rumiko Takahashi, Katsuhiro Otomo, Lynd Ward, and Frans Masereel. She is also inspired by Queer culture of all forms. 

Check it---

www.abigaelpuritz.com

https://www.instagram.com/whatitbeabbyp/

http://whatitbeabbyp.tumblr.com/

https://www.facebook.com/Abigael-Puritz-658531180921347/

http://booklyn.org/archive/index.php/Detail/Entity/Show/entity_id/4390

story:
What are you getting yourself into?

Hey everyone! My name is Vonnell Young and Delta Dogs is an on-going series that takes place in Virginia and the Millennial Comics Universe! 

A chance encounter results in seven cousins gaining what every child hopes for... Superpowers! Unfortunately, they discover that being superpowered teens leads to hard, complicated lives. Bad decisions are made, and the cousins get trapped between a gang war, a mad scientist, and studying for their next test. Their future now relies on creating the very thing that jeopardizes their livelihood... a gang, but one where they fight for justice (Or so they hope!). To survive they must decide to use their powers for a greater purpose, but they soon realize that not everyone feels the same.
 

 

Our Resolve

We wanted to come up with a tall tale of teens gaining superpowers and having the time of their lives fighting bad guys but writing this story, it just didn't turn out that way. It became something more. Family, friends, getting through hard times, trying and getting knocked down mystery, etc. It became an anomaly. 

 

Not every hero starts off as one. This story isn't about the destination of a hero but the journey of becoming one.

Our Goal

We hope to not just inspire our youth but also adults too! To do this we need to get these books in your hands so you will be ready for Delta Dogs season 2. We are working on season 2 now and we just need a few more dollars to get it off the ground and running and of course a few more readers to push us forward. Everything is done and printed for season 1. We just need YOUR help to get to the next phase of this amazing series!

 

Why This Story?

We don't see too many black representations that not only LOOK black but FEEL black as well. Not all of us are from the street nor do we want to be. These cousins are GOOD kids that are trying to find their way in all this craziness that the world has to bring and EVERYONE can relate to that.   

 

 

 

Let's put the hero cape to the side for a sec. How far would you go for family? 

Early Bird Reward

For every one that backs this project within the first week will get their cover upgraded to a Variant Cover of Delta Dogs! (Ends 5/29/2020)

 

Stretch GOAL!

 

$1,000

All backers will receive exclusive Ink art of the Delta Dogs series in pdf format! (10 pages)

 

$2,000

Everyone will get the next PDF Issue copy of their donation! So if you are getting Delta Dogs Issues 1-5? You will get a pdf of issue 6 for FREE! As far as my issue 1-10 backers, yes you are correct.., We will send you a pdf file of DELTA DOGS ISSUE #11! The first episode of season 2!!

 

Variant Cover

 

Time of Shipment

We already have the shipping supplies, the pdf files ready, all 1-10 issues printed, and our local printing company on standby waiting for us to send the payment to get the variant covers printed. Everything else depends on how fast we can package your orders and ship them to you. This could take a month or two depending on how many backers but we will be working hard every day, all day to get this to you SOONER! We plan on sending the pdfs within the first week or so. You guys are our number 1 priority and we take your time and hard-earned money VERY SERIOUSLY.

 

What we NEED!

We honestly need your help getting the word out to the world that we are here and that this series is worth your time. We have successfully released 1 issue a month for 10 months to complete our season 1 run. We can do it again and better! All we need is you guys' support and love to keep pushing us forward! If you can't contribute, share with someone who would like this. One of the number one thing that hurts us is silent supporters. 

 

Our Struggle

We were signed up for over a dozen comic cons and events but everything was put on hold because of the pandemic. The only thing we have to do on our part is printing the the variant covers for you guys and ship them off. We will use this funding to get season 2 drawn up and completed for the next ride! No matter the struggle, we WILL find a way and do you guys justice for your time and support!   

 

Millennial Comics Team

Written/Creator by Vonnell Young

Drawn /Lettered by Mark Marvida

Colored by Marvin Marvida

Video/Music by Charles Alexander

Issue 1 Drawn by Felix Morales

Issue 2-10 Drawn by Mark Marvida 

Issue 1-10 and Variant Colored by Marvin Marvida 

 

Vonnell Young

Writer/Creator of Delta Dogs

Founder of Millennial Comics

 

Thank You!

Thank you for every share, every backer, and all my returning supporters! This is our passion and for someone to support it makes them our hero in the end. We appreciate and acknowledge that and we will NOT let you guys down!!   THANK YOU!

story: The Ronin and The Shisa takes place on a mutated and desolate version of earth. Our story takes place in the Ryukyu Islands where our self taught samurai, Tori, must face off against warlords and monsters to save the royal family and bring peace to his home. The Ronin and The Shisa is a 64+ page, black and white manga sized comic by artist and writer, Ryan Cody (Doc Unknown, The Phantom, Adventure Van) and features a cover by DC and Image Comics artist, Scott Godlewski.

Our story takes place in the Ryukyu Islands where our self taught samurai, Tori, must face off against warlords and monsters to save the royal family and bring peace to his home. The Ronin and The Shisa is a 64+ page, black and white manga sized comic by artist and writer, Ryan Cody (Doc Unknown, The Phantom, Adventure Van) and features a cover by DC and Image Comics artist, Scott Godlewski.

story:
SKETCHAPALOOZA IS HERE!

Tonight (6/17/21) on Michael Bancroft's YouTube channel at 10:00 PM CST, we will be doing what can only be described as SKETCHAPALOOZA!

Earlier on in the campaign we had sketch cards available as an add-on for $50. Normally sketch cards ar trading card sized and not very detailed. We sold 19 of them. I commissioned Lucas Meyer, the interior artist for Sovereign Wolf, to do a total of 30 of them. These are no MERE sketch cards! Sketches of this size and quality can go for 2-4 times the price of these.

Here's a look: (SOVEREIGN WOLF Graphic Novel just for Scale) 

Tonight (6/17/21) I will be adding a new tier. It will be a Sovereign Wolf book with the cover of your choice and one of these sketch cards chosen at RANDOM. It will be a $75 tier keeping it exactly the same price as before in order to not make previous backers upset. So YES, there will be a limit of 10 on this tier.

$75 too rich? NO PROBLEM

If you back the the project at any level before the campaign closes on Sunday, you will be in the running to win the 11th and final sketch, as well as one (1) of everything I've produced for this Clan Destiny Campaign. This will include some very exclusive things so you'll want to tune in to the show for details. We will be live (I'll be there too) at 10 PM CST, but you can always watch the replay for info you may have missed.

Subscribe to Michael's channel and hit the bell for notifications so that you don't miss out.

The sad news: SOVEREIGN WOLF: Clan Destiny will be closing down on Sunday night at 11:59 PST. There will be a 2nd chance campaign that will be explained in an upcoming update, but Sunday will be the last day to get you copy in it's original form. (I'll explain in the next update)

Thank You All Once Again!

 

Hello! Welcome to the world of Sovereign Wolf!

What's it about?

John Sovereign is an intern for NEO-C.R.O.M., the largest and most successful genetic engineering company in the world - but when he witnesses a gruesome event, he'll discover a secret world where Shapeshifting Heroes battle Experimental Monstrosities, Interdimensional Demons, Genetically Enhanced Military Repo Men and Ancient Gods for the fate of humanity. Will he fall to these newly discovered evils? Or will he embrace the beast within and become the hero he was destined to be?

FIND OUT in SOVEREIGN WOLF: Clan Destiny, the first installment of  an ONGOING SERIES of graphic novels to be published by DOSE OF ACTION COMICS GROUP INC. (D.O.A. COMICS for short.)

What's inside?

Over 100 pages of beautiful content including:

A 50-page Main Story by Lucas Meyer and Giuliano Peratelli

 

  

 

An 18-page Prequel Story by Gabriel Caitano and Michael Woods

 

An 8-page Side Story By Renan Shody and Angel Rd

 

10 Pages of Pinups - Line art and colored versions of 5 images

 

8 Pages of Character Files (Not Final)

 

And much more!

  • Behind the scenes/Making-Of Content
  • Cover Gallery
  • Tiny Glimpse of Things to Come
  • The Filler (Thank You Page, Creative Team Info, etc.)

So what's available?

BAD MOON RISING variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Interior Art team of Lucas Meyer and Giuliano Peratelli

 

FEROCIOUS FIVE variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Rob Willis (Shinobi Sasquatch, Graveyard Shift III) and Kyle Ritter (Starblades, Cyberfrog)

 

THE ALPHA variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Preston Asevedo (Doc Salem, IX Devils, Three Days/Four Knights)

 

3 Promotional Trading Cards 

 

Don't forget to purchase your add-ons at the checkout page!

  • Add an  11x17 ROLLED Poster of Graveyard Shift and Sovereign Wolf
  • Add an Evangelina "EVA" Rose Lenticular Print
  • Add Extra Copies of the Graphic Novel Variant of your choice
  • Add Extra Copies of the 6x9 Print Variant of your choice

This  beautiful 11x17 ROLLED poster of Graveyard Shift and Sovereign Wolf, is NOW available for purchase as an ADD-ON.  This will be EXCLUSIVE to this campaign and will NEVER be offered again once the campaign ends. (*ALSO included in the EVERYTHING perk*)

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out the campaign!

An 18-page Prequel Story by Gabriel Caitano and Michael Woods
 
An 8-page Side Story By Renan Shody and Angel Rd
 
10 Pages of Pinups - Line art and colored versions of 5 images
 
8 Pages of Character Files (Not Final)
 
And much more!

Behind the scenes/Making-Of Content
Cover Gallery
Tiny Glimpse of Things to Come
The Filler (Thank You Page, Creative Team Info, etc.)

So what's available?
BAD MOON RISING variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Interior Art team of Lucas Meyer and Giuliano Peratelli
 

FEROCIOUS FIVE variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Rob Willis (Shinobi Sasquatch, Graveyard Shift III) and Kyle Ritter (Starblades, Cyberfrog)
 
THE ALPHA variant Graphic Novel and 6x9 Print by Preston Asevedo (Doc Salem, IX Devils, Three Days/Four Knights)
 
3 Promotional Trading Cards 

 
Don't forget to purchase your add-ons at the checkout page!

Add an  11x17 ROLLED Poster of Graveyard Shift and Sovereign Wolf

Add an Evangelina "EVA" Rose Lenticular Print

Add Extra Copies of the Graphic Novel Variant of your choice
Add Extra Copies of the 6x9 Print Variant of your choice

This  beautiful 11x17 ROLLED poster of Graveyard Shift and Sovereign Wolf, is NOW available for purchase as an ADD-ON.  This will be EXCLUSIVE to this campaign and will NEVER be offered again once the campaign ends. (*ALSO included in the EVERYTHING perk*)






 



Thank you for taking the time to check out the campaign!

story:
Creating a Sci-Fi universe is more challenging than ever before.   That's why some creators give up and simply join forces with other established Sci-Fi universes, such as S.T. and S.W.  and even S.G.

Star Missions has created over the past year (yes, only one year) a universe of their own.   There are new characters and aliens that one would love and hate.  The story develops over time and Terrans realize they are in  way over their head.  Only 200 years into the future, Terrans were relatively new to space exploration.   Only started getting use to the idea of extra-terrestrials... but now Terra is attacked and Terra's defenses are weakening.  Mankind is now in a fight for survival, and found themselves as unwilling players in the fate of the galaxy and potentially the entire universe.

As the situation unfolds in the Strolla System (STAR MISSIONS), they have no idea what is going on in our Solar System, on TERRA .  They are cut off, dozens of light years away.   That is where our story starts (EQUIPT #1) - It is the untold story (now being told) of what happened on the "other side of the gate".   It is also its own story in it's own right.  Creating a group of characters that will do all it can to save TERRA as well as the UNIVERSE, if they can.

I hope you will want to support this effort.  We started this project in early 2016 but couldn't keep it going, but fortunately, most of it was already drawn.  We need your help to finish it.   We hope to get enough to pay the new artist to finish, then editing and lettering.. and then print up to 100 issues at least... We hope anyway.  $800 won't cover it all, but it will help.

As a father and someone that grew up with comic books and sci-fi, it was only natural to find common interests with my children who were into that as well.   That is why this series is suitable for the whole family.  There is no profanity, excess violence, witch-craft or explicit nudity, so everyone can read the books and enjoy the art.  Yet, these are not children's stories.  We feel that adults that like sci-fi, mystery and adventure will enjoy this series and be entertained.

Please take look at our "perks" and help us realize our goal.    Thanks for your attention.

story:
Introduction

Hi! I’m Lowell Dean. Since childhood I’ve been drawing and daydreaming about superheroes. Most recently, I've put that passion into writing and directing films like WolfCop and Another WolfCop ... but some stories can't be told on an indie film budget.

Inspired by the likes of Venture Brothers, Bojack Horseman and Rick & Morty, The Atomic Victory Squad  is a globe-trotting, world smashing superhero comic with characters that could only exist in animated form. They're a team of unique misfits, forced to defend the earth when all the “real” heroes are violently killed. So WHO are the Atomic Victory Squad? 

INVINCIBULL is an alien from a planet where cows are men; think Superman but with giant udders. Since he's a milk producing male, society at large fears and rejects him. Even when he's saving their life! GARY THE MIME isn't your average mime. His "imaginations" physically manifest, so if Gary points a finger gun in your direction, you'd better duck! ZOOZANNA is a world renowned explorer cursed into the form of several animals... all at once.  BUBBLE MYERS is a recovering drug addict accidentally fused into a billion dollar government super-suit. SHE-GIRL was built as a pleasure-bot then reprogrammed as a sentient, no-nonsense, gadget filled assassin. Lastly there's TRIANGLE MASTER.... he just really likes triangles (tri-sexual). 

Real talk: The world doesn't need more superheroes, but this is no ordinary team. The Atomic Victory Squad  is a satire of the genre while still working within the confines of it (capes, costumes, superpowers and lots of action).

Below the surface, each team member serves as a metaphor for issues like addiction, race and gender identity, chronic depression and mental health. This series is as much about their private lives, personal struggles and relationships as it is about crime fighting.

This is the definition of a passion project. I’ve partnered with talented collaborators like brilliant comic book illustrator Javier Martin Caba (Blood Brothers, Lucha Brothers) and practical effects/sculpting wizard Emersen Ziffle (Krampus, WolfCop, Curse of Chucky) who is designing our campaign perks. Many other talented friends are contributing as well. 

We can’t do this alone. Hopefully our next member is YOU!

Costs = Cool Stuff

This campaign is designed to cover the hard costs associated with our comic and perks:

  • We need to pay Javier to illustrate and colour the first issue
  • We need to pay Micah Myers to letter the first issue
  • We need supplies to create hand crafted perks (badges, maquettes, t-shirts).
  • The hard costs of printing the comic
  • Shipping the perks to your door!

Get cool collectables and highly personalized perks! 

This is more than just a comic. Emersen is designing AVS collector badges, t-shirts, an udderly incredible Invincibull maquette... and a few more surprises! 

We also have individualized rewards. We can drop your name or draw you into the comic as a cameo or an actual character! We'll feature your business (or just you, no judgement) in a full page advertisement in issue one.

CLICK on each perk (to the right) to REVEAL MORE DETAILS.

The Real Hero... is YOU

We're pouring our blood, sweat and (happy) tears into this project and thinking long term. For us, this is just the beginning. 

We’re not just making a comic… we’re launching a universe.

This is not our first artistic endeavour or Indiegogo campaign, so we know there is serious work and obstacles ahead. That said, we're committed to making issue # 1 no matter what.

If we exceed our goals, we'll unlock secret perks and fast track the next issue!!

This is a truly grassroots campaign. Your help makes ALL the difference.

If you can't afford to contribute, we still respect you. You can support in others ways like sharing our campaign on social media (don't forget to use the Indiegogo promo tools) or just shouting the words "Atomic Victory Squad" at random strangers in the street. 

Thank you for reading. Now let's get the word out and bring these heroes to life!

#AtomicVictorySquad #AVS

If you can't afford to contribute, we still respect you. You can support in others ways like sharing our campaign on social media (don't forget to use the Indiegogo promo tools) or just shouting the words "Atomic Victory Squad" at random strangers in the street. 
Thank you for reading. Now let's get the word out and bring these heroes to life!

story:
The Standard Edition of BMKB #1 is a 56 page, black and white comic printed on newsprint for that nostalgic comic experience! All Perks include the Core Set. (Rated T+)

 

Forced to create genetically enhanced bioweapons by an evil organization, Doctor Albert Vogel is a scientist that has unlocked the limitations of human potential by creating a mutagen that can transform the average person into a superhuman fighting machine. When Vogel refuses to create an army of super soldiers for his sinister overlords, they kidnap his beloved niece, Saaya, threatening her life as leverage against him.

Injected with a mutagen granting her a superhuman physique and special powers, Saaya feels like a stranger within her own body. But with their lives on the line, she is forced to fight back in order to save her uncle and escape from the dreaded Court of the Black Sun!

Campaign Goal

The first campaign was a huge success, and I wanted to make the first issue accessible to everyone before we move onto the second. The Standard Edition of Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb (BMKB 1S) is printed on recycled newsprint like the comics of the '80s and early '90s.

There are no Stretch Goals for this campaign. Instead, I opted to just include everything in the Core Set from the start. Nice and simple! The one variable in the campaign is the foil insert card. The quality of the foil can be improved to a holographic patterned foil design if this campaign does really well, so let's see how far we can take this!

While offering the new material, I also have leftover inventory from the first campaign to offer up for a second time with price adjustments that are competitive with the secondhand market, out of respect for backers of the first campaign. The two returning items are the Premiere Edition and the Sketch Cover variant.

There were only 3,050 copies of the Premiere Edition printed and that is all there will ever be. Each book is uniquely numbered with a hot foil number stamped below the Murakumo Comics logo on the front cover.

The Sketch Cover variant is from the first printing and also contain all the additional content featured in the Premiere Edition. There were only 200 of these books printed with only 50 left.

 

Note: There will be no additional Perks added to this campaign. Once a Perk is depleted, it's gone for good!

 

Gratitude

This campaign marks the anniversary of Murakumo Comics! None of this would have been possible without the supporters of Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb. It is a privilege to create entertainment for you all and Murakumo Comics will strive to maintain the quality that is now expected from us. Thank you so very much!!

story:
Our Story

It should come as no surprise to people that the UK now have next to no funding for arts. Comedy is now no laughing matter and we are a group of comedians and film makers that are huddled together in the financial cold to make something original and wonderful to put in to the comedy industry. We have worked our asses off, sacrificed many years of hard work to get as far as we have to be told that anything new is a financial risk.


With so little funds it is harder for new and original work to make it to the screen, but we started with the vision to make something great and we are desperate to make this a reality. We are fortunate to have many talented friends who are volunteering out of belief for the project and every pound we make here would go towards making this pilot something truly special. 


We will make this pilot! Currently broadcasters are keen to see the finished product but will not be able to offer anything towards it. It's incredibly difficult to pull everyone together on no money during this financial climate, but we simply believe in this and would beg you to believe in it too. 


The Impact


This is a difficult industry to be a part of. If this pilot is made in to a series we will pledge that 20% of our production will be made of paid volunteers who are looking for good experience in television production. 

Furthermore, we pledge that in the result of a series that we will always keep our audition process open to the public, not just to profitable faces.

As a team of people who truly understand who difficult this industry is, we are also open to any other ideas that you may have in how we could give back.  As you can see we aim to give directly back to the aspirationals within the industry during these hellish times.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently we need - everything! The production has been scheduled for 14 days. Post production will be done for free entirely but the core members of the project.


Lights have been quoted at £100 per day x 14 = £1400

2 locations (9 days in 1, 5 days in the other) = (£ 350 + £150) 500


Other necessary equiptment as listed below


Track = (£20 x 5) = £100

Jib= (£20 x 2) = £40

Tripod= (£20  x 14) = 280 

Props + Costumes = £80

Make Up = £50 


The total adds to £2420 but we have extended it to £2,600 for the sake of possibly being able to feed all the volunteers involved but we are very happy receive any small amount that we can possibly get!


All our love,


The Shazam Team


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
My name is G. E. Gallas, and I am a screenwriter and graphic novelist (writer/illustrator). I will be making a trip to the U.K. early next year, and need your help to make my dreams come true!

1. My short screenplay, The Man Who Never Smiled (a contemporary film noir), is being produced by Dream Catcher Films in the North West of England. This film is being made on a tight budget, and there are no funds for me to get there. It’s important for me to be there during filming so that I can make on-the-spot changes to the script and get hands-on experience in film production.

2. In between filming will be the perfect opportunity to visit London to research the 18th-Century poet-painter William Blake, the hero of my graphic novel The Poet and the Flea. I plan to visit Blake’s grave as well as various museums that house his works. Seeing his works in person would be life changing. This would be my first time in England, and I hope to make this an unforgettable learning experience.

Your contributions will help cover expenses for transportation (airplane, train) and lodging. I truly appreciate any and all support, whether through contributions and/or spreading the word through social media (Twitter, etc.)!!

While in Europe, I plan to document my travels. When I return, I will share my photos and experiences with all of you through my blog gegallas.wordpress.com.

Thank you so much!

Gratefully,

G. E.

Homepage/Blog/Facebook/Twitter/Tumblr
