story:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Artisan Edition Hardcover Book: Signed by Kevin Eastman

This book is printed, signed, packed, and waiting for your address to put on the label!

The non-signed version is available at most book retailers, but this Limited Edition is signed by TMNT co-creator Kevin Eastman.

The Book

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Artisan Edition reproduces the original art from the first issue of one of the most important comic book phenomenons of the last 40 years. 

Scanned directly from the original artwork to mimick the experience of holding the hand-drawn pages, and collecting all of the layouts by the creators, the TMNT Artisan Edition offers something totally unique. Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird's creations have been called this generation's Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck, and now fans can know the feeling of holding those original comic pages in their own two hands.

The Exclusive Indiegogo Signed Edition

  

What is special about this version of the book: 

  • Each book is hand-signed by Kevin Eastman.
  • Limited to only 500 copies.
  • Only available from this Indiegogo Campaign.

story:
It's done!


What a fun ride. This little venture was as much an opportunity for some laughs as it was for any other purpose. Most of my friends got the joke, and really got a kick out of it. Some even went so far as to make a generous gift. To all of you, and especially those that gave, THANK YOU! 

This all started because it seemed every day I saw another person starting an indiegogo campaign and plastered it all over social media. Some were downright aggressive in their marketing. 

This campaign was largely a spoof of all those campaigns I saw. From the frivolous goal of the campaign, to the outlandish donation perks, to the social media "blitz" I engaged in, it was all just to lampoon some of the goofy campaigns I've seen of late. 

The difference with this goofy campaign and the others is that the other campaigns were serious about their efforts. Clearly I did not expect anyone to donate $100,000 for my beard in a baggie. Of course if someone had done it, I would have been obliged to shave it, sack it, and send it.  

I also learned about the "dark underbelly" of indiegogo. Here on the page through private messages, and through several private messages on linked social media sites, I got a lot of "pitch" messages from people running other campaigns. They promised big returns if I would just donate in some cases as little as $5 to their campaign. Making promises like "Make a $5 donation to my campaign, and I will direct 200 donors to yours who WILL give". 

Pretty shady. 

All in all, this was a fun, and eye opening experience. From the visit counts I can see a lot of people visited, and seems a lot clicked through to my IMDB page because my "starmeter" exploded during this campaign. Hope I'll be able to make you laugh on the big or small screen again sometime soon. 

Again, thank you all for being a part of this experience. 

      Sincerely, 

                Mario Sellitti


PS: There are some good, sincere campaigns on this site, and I encourage you to find them. This spoof is in no way reflective of my view of ALL indiegogo campaigns. 


Hi there!

Like many of you, growing up, I had dreams. Unlike many of you who said, hey that's grossly unrealistic, and I should figure out something more reasonable, I moved to Los Angeles to chase my dreams. While I have enjoyed some success, the road is long, and I have had to take many "survival" jobs that I really can't stand. The problems with the current job are:

  • It is kind of commission based, and if sales are low, it's minimum wage
  • The schedule is not flexible, and if I get an audition, I will likely lose my job.
  • Everyone there is miserable. It sucks the soul out of me to even walk in. 

Eventually, I will lose this job, or it simply won't pay enough for me to continue on, and I will lose my home. 

The part where I tell you what you get for helping me:

So this is where most people offer some random perk for donating. They are usually pretty outlandish, and I promise not to disappoint:

  • $5 - I will personally send you an e-mail that says "You donated $5 to Mario's quit his crappy day job fund, and all you got was this lousy email" email. Sure to be worth a fortune some day, or at the very least bragging rights. I don't know. 
  • $25 - I will make a post to your Facebook wall either graciously thanking you for your incredibly generous contribution, or go off on a rant complaining you did not give nearly enough. YOUR CHOICE. (The rant will probably be a lot funnier). 
  • $100 - I will make and post a YouTube video to ask out someone you really like on your behalf. (May contian blatant lies, and embarrassing details)
  • $1,000 - I will write a song about you (Vocals & Accoustic guitar) and post it on YouTube (Will also likely contain blatant lies and embarrassing details)
  • $10,000 - I will make a short film (under 5 minutes) starring you. (Must be in Los Angeles) You can write the script, or I can. Your choice. (Budget will not exceed $1000)
  • $100,000 - If someone donates $100,000 I will shave off my beard and mail it to them. Yes, really. 

I've since added some new ones, and as promised they are batshit crazy. I will keep adding new ones right up to the end, so you best follow. You would be real disappointed if I added a Pants Off Dance Off for an hour and you missed it. 

Why are you doing this?

I thought it would be fun. Donate, don't donate. That's fine. Everyone else has one of these, and I was really starting to feel left out. If when it's all said and done, all this gets is a few laughs, it will be worth it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you're sympathetic, but you're just as broke as me. Here's what you can do:

  • Share this page with others
  • Help me land some acting work
  • Stop watching reality TV
  • When you see me, tell people "Hey that guy is awesome!"
  • Laugh

Now, according to indiegogo, that's all there is to it. So here's to me celebrating nobeardtober rolling around naked in $100,000. Hmmm... that's probably a disturbing image for most, I probably should remove that. 


Be sure to check out the comments section for any updates to this campaign.

story:
So, what's all this, 'en?

Stiffs is a five issue comics mini-series coming out through Deadstar Publishing from December 2011. The Apocalypse Party is written by stand-up comedian Drew Davies, PJ Montgomery and Joe Glass (The Pride), with art by up-and-coming spectacular artist Gavin Mitchell, and colours by Adam Cadwell (The Everyday, Blood Blokes) and Kris Carter (Lou Scannon)

 

It also features a talking monkey...more on him later.

 

GUNS! MONSTERS! BOOZE! MONKEYS! WE HAVE WHAT YOU WANT!

Okay, 'ou got me attention, butt. What's it about?

Set in a dead end town in the South Wales Valleys, it follows the adventures of working stiffs Don Daniels, and his monkey life partner (they're just friends, really) Kenny McMonkey, as they discover that the undead stalk the valley at night. Raised on a steady diet of rubbish horror films and heavy metal, they do what any sane person would: become a pair of bad-ass, hard-living zombie hunters.

 

Soon though, hunting becomes more than they had bargained for and they are forced to enlist a group of their best friends to become a group of marginally skilled, off-kilter monster hunters. What follows is a zombie-bashing, vampire-beating extravaganza...wherein adventure and hilarity and some kick ass shit ensues!

 

Magic, women, guts 'n' gore, and a chain-smoking, foul-mouthed asshole monkey come together to make the craziest, funniest, most kick-ass action comic series of the next year!

 

Awright 'en, so what do 'ou need?

 

We want to get this comic into as many hands as possible: that means marketing, spreading the word, merchandise and printing a whole lot of copies!

 

We also want the comic to spread as far and wide as possible, and at the moment, if you are outside the UK, preordering the series right here is the best way to ensure you get your hands on it. You'll be sent the comic directly from us!

 

We also want to get it featuring at as many comic cons and shows as possible to help put this in the hands of awesome fans!

 

This all costs money, so all we raise here will go into making the best comic possible and getting it out to as many people as we physically can!

 

There are some amazing perks for helping out, including comics, art, merchandise and more! So please help!

 

So, 'ou just want money, 'en?

 

No, no, you can also help us by spreading the word!

 

Use Facebook, twitter, Linkd In, Tumblr, Google+ and more to tell people about the series and help us attract new preorders and funders!

 

Tell all your frinds about it and why they should help us make this bad-ass comic book series!

 

Blog it, and hey, we're more than happy to do interviews, reviews and previews, just get in touch!

 

Awright 'en, butt! I'm on board! 'Ow do I help?

 

Just use the simple links on this very page! Thank you so much!

story:
About The Jacket:

Colton Emerson is a young man trapped in a dead end job in a dystopian society where the leaders keep the masses in a constant state of sloth through daily berating and condescending. To escape the oppressive confines of his world, Colton finds solace in a recurring dream where he is a superhero. When he puts on a seemingly normal jacket in a store, the barrier between his dreams and reality is shattered. Armed with his newfound abilities, Colton finds himself with the opportunity to escape his monotonous confinement and follow his dreams down a path that will pit him against a dangerous enemy of the state. But how long can the dream last in a world where mysterious forces seek to limit the potential of the individual?

Conceived in 2009, The Jacket is a nine chapter graphic novel that is part superhero, part dystopian sci-fi. It is the brainchild of writer Jason Biamonte and illustrator Randy Haldeman, who have been at work for two years mapping out the entire story. Now, Chapter 1: From the Beginning is near ready for print just in time for Baltimore Comic Con on August 20. All we need now are your pledges to help pay for printing.

What We Need The Money For:

Even though we said it in the video, it never hurts to explain again. All money will go towards the materials to complete the comic, the printing of the comic, and the printing of promotional materials. Any extra money (though we are trying to not have any) will go directly into completing the whole second issue. So even if there is money left over, which we highly doubt, it will only go back into this comic series that we've worked so hard on for so long now.

Incentive Clarification:

PDF:

-The PDF is of the entire 22-page run of the comic. There will also be a PDF specific page for the "Thank You"'s, along with the main cover and alternative cover by Helaine Crawford. It will look like the final book, but in PDF.

Sketch Cards:

There will be 4 original sketch cards drawn. Those will be copied on cardstock and inked individually. They will also be colored with graytone markers. So there will be actual ink on your sketch cards.

Sketch Cover:

We are limiting these because...well, who doesn't love limited edition things? Randy will draw a sketch on the cover of anything you want. If you just want something that pertains to the story, that is okay. If you want more, he is all ears!

Short Film:

The short film will be filmed before the end of this project campaign. We will be distributing it both through digital and DVD formats. Obviously the DVD will cost money to create, and ship so it will cost more to get it. The story of the film is based on the comic, written and filmed by Randy and Jason, as well as a bunch of other awesome Keyhole Comics Studio helpers!

Original 5-Page "Dream" Sequence Pages:

These pages were done during the inception of The Jacket. They are old in terms of Randy's art and characters have changed since then. They are the precursor to the first 5 pages of the new version of the comic.

Original NEW Pages:

There are 21 pages in the new version of the comic (the one you are helping to get printed). As we ship out the packages for people with the original artwork pages, we will choose a page at random to put into the packaging. (If you have a preference on page at a later date, then it might accidentally slip into your package)

Baltimore Comic-Con 2011:

If you are able to attend Baltimore Comic-Con on August 20-21, 2011, we'd love to have you stop by and see the fruits of your labor! If you plan on going we want to know so that we can just hand over your package there (to save on shipping costs). Also, we'll put a little something special in the package just for those of you who can actually come to BCC and support us!

Shipping:

We will not charge for shipping, but if you live outside of the continental United States, we may have to ask for a bit of assistance depending on the tier you select. If you are outside the continental United States, please keep this in mind when you select your perk!

More Keyhole Comics / Helaine Crawford:

You can find more about Randy Haldeman and Jason Biamonte at this link:

http://www.KeyholeComicsStudio.com/aboutus.html

Helaine Crawford:

http://www.redwhiteblack.com.au/

Thank You!

Thanks so much for everything! We appreciate it all! If you have any questions or need help with anything, don't hesitate to contact Randy directly at:

RTHaldeman@keyholecomicsstudio.com

for the "Thank You"'s, along with the main cover and alternative cover 
by Helaine Crawford. It will look like the final book, but in PDF.Sketch Cards:There will be 4 original sketch cards 
drawn. Those will be copied on cardstock and inked individually. They 
will also be colored with graytone markers. So there will be actual ink 
on your sketch cards.Sketch Cover:We are limiting 
these because...well, who doesn't love limited edition things? Randy 
will draw a sketch on the cover of anything you want. If you just want 
something that pertains to the story, that is okay. If you want more, he
 is all ears! Short Film:The short film will be 
filmed before the end of this project campaign. We will be distributing 
it both through digital and DVD formats. Obviously the DVD will cost 
money to create, and ship so it will cost more to get it. The story of 
the film is based on the comic, written and filmed by Randy and Jason, 
as well as a bunch of other awesome Keyhole Comics Studio helpers!Original 5-Page "Dream" Sequence Pages:These 
pages were done during the inception of The Jacket. They are old in 
terms of Randy's art and characters have changed since then. They are 
the precursor to the first 5 pages of the new version of the comic. Original NEW Pages:There are 21 pages in the new 
version of the comic (the one you are helping to get printed). As we 
ship out the packages for people with the original artwork pages, we 
will choose a page at random to put into the packaging. (If you have a 
preference on page at a later date, then it might accidentally slip into
 your package)
 Baltimore Comic-Con 2011:If you are able to attend Baltimore 
Comic-Con on August 20-21, 2011, we'd love to have you stop by and see 
the fruits of your labor! If you plan on going we want to know so that 
we can just hand over your package there (to save on shipping costs). 
Also, we'll put a little something special in the package just for those
 of you who can actually come to BCC and support us!
 Shipping:We will not charge for shipping, but if you live 
outside of the continental United States, we may have to ask for a bit 
of assistance depending on the tier you select. If you are outside the 
continental United States, please keep this in mind when you select your perk!
 More Keyhole Comics / Helaine Crawford: You can find more about Randy Haldeman and Jason Biamonte at this link:http://www.KeyholeComicsStudio.com/aboutus.htmlHelaine Crawford:http://www.redwhiteblack.com.au/
 Thank You!Thanks so much for everything! We appreciate it all! 
If you have any questions or need help with anything, don't hesitate to 
contact Randy directly at:RTHaldeman@keyholecomicsstudio.com

story:
Swedish Comic Sin

Swedish Comic Sin is an indie project where a group of comic artists collaborate to make a graphic novel anthology with erotic short stories.

It all started as an experiment, to let young aspiring artists test their limits as storytellers, and at the same time create a book together. The project is coordinated by the editor Natalia Batista, a comic artist and teacher at Sweden's most prominent comic art school, Serieskolan in Malmö.

These are the previous books, you can order them here:

The project also aims to broaden the erotic graphic novel genre, with a more Scandinavian touch to it. Inspired by the "Swedish Sin" back in the 50'ies and 60'ies, with movies by Ingmar Bergman and Arne Mattsson making Sweden famous for a liberal view on sexuality, we want to include and engage. Gender and sexual equality is the basis for this project, and all artists give feedback on each other's stories in the process, to create the best anthology we can together. 

What we will do with the money

We are now ready to print the latest anthology in this series. It's a stand alone book, with nine short stories and 180 pages of beautiful, creative, exciting and interesting comics, by the following artists:

Ane V.
Bård Larsson
Henrik Rogowski
Ida Öhlén
Jenny Hannula
Johanna Gustafsson
Sandra Bergström
Sara Berntsson
Therese Malmgren

All money will go to paying for the printing costs, and also the shipping costs for the gifts we want to send you as a thank you for your donation.


What we want to give you

As a thank you for the donation you do to our project, we would like to give you gifts. You can see to the right what perks-levels we have.

If you donate at least $20, you'll get the printed book and a signed postcard sent to you anywhere in the world, plus a digital book for your tablet or computer.

If you donate more, at least $30 one of the artists will draw in and sign your book.

If you donate more, at least $60 you will also receive a black and white original artwork by one of the artists in the book.

If you donate more, at least $100 you will receive a color original artwork (instead of the black and white) by one of the artists in the book.

Here are some examples of the original artworks that we will give away:


What happens if we don't get all the money

We will print the book either way, but by you helping us raise the money we need for the printing costs, you help us out financially so that we poor artists don't have to put up our own money to make this happen. To keep the integrity of the project, we have no sponsors etc. All costs are payed by what we get from this campaign, and the rest is from our own pockets.
So we thank you so much for even the smallest donation you can spare us!

The book will later on be sold at events, comic markets and online, with it's officiall release in May 2015. By supporting this campaign you can lay your hands on the book before it is even released! 


Other ways to help us

We would really appreciate if you could spread the word, link to the campaign on social media and let other people know about this. Thank you!

story:
HORACE – THE ANIMATED SERIES

 

You've seen Horace in the funny pages. Now's your chance to help make him gallop!

Hi there! We're Kavio Productions, a small Finnish animation studio. We're on a mission to make Horace walk and, well... not necessarily talk -- maybe grunt a lot!

We've already created two animated pilot episodes of Horace - check'em out below! We'd love to produce more!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The comic strip Dark Side of the Horse (starring Horace) was created in 2008 by a Finnish cartoonist Samson AKA Samuli Lintula.

The comic strip is published (almost) daily on GoComics.com. Thanks to the amazing support of the cartoon syndicate Universal Uclick, Dark Side of the Horse has already built a loyal and growing fan base.

 

 

 

 

The first two pilot episodes of Horace  have been produced with the generous support of the Finnish Film Foundation. Did we mention we'd love to produce more? Sometimes more is more!

The completed episodes will be published on Horace's YouTube channel.

 

 

 

 

Each episode of Horace will be approximately 40-80 seconds long. The actual animation work will be done using the excellent Anime Studio by Smith Micro Software. The production of the episodes financed by crowd funding is scheduled to start in fall 2016.

Animation will be produced in accordance with the production costs per episode with the funding received from the campaign. $3,200 will cover the production costs of one high quality episode from start to finish. The more we raise the more episodes we are able to produce! All funding received from the campaign will be invested in the production expenses after reducing the VAT (24%), the Perk expenses (10%) and the Campaign platform commissions and expenses (8-10%).

 

 

 

 

 

No perks, no campaign, right? The perks will be delivered to you right after the campaign has been concluded, apart from the perks of $10, $100, $200 and $1200, which are related to the publishing of completed episodes.

 

 

By supporting our campaign with a contribution of $10 you'll get both our eternal gratitude and a chance to see each completed, crowdfunded episode 24 hours prior to the official release. Early horse gets the wor... uh, we know you get the picture!

 

 

 

Horace goes arty! You will get an access to 1) a print quality PDF file containing a color picture created exclusively for this occasion and 2) a one-of-a-kind PDF cartoon collection "Dark Side of the Horse: The Best of 2008-2016"  (Release date: July 2016).

In addition to this, you are entitled to the perk described above!

 

 

 

A comic strip like no other! By participating in our campaign with a contribution of $40 you will receive an access to 1) a PDF file containing a DSotH comic strip created exclusively for this occasion and 2) THE ultimate PDF cartoon collection "Dark Side of the Horse: The Complete Collection 2008-2016".  This warts-and-all collection will contain every DSotH cartoon (there's thousands of 'em) published between July 2008 and June 2016 (Release date: Summer 2016). 

In addition to this, you are entitled to the perks described above!

 

 

0 to 60 in seconds! A contribution of $60 enables us to gallop towards our target and we want to acknowledge this with an official Thank You on the silver-ish screen! By claiming this perk your name will be presented in the end credits of a single episode!

In addition to this, you are entitled to all the previous perks described above!

 

 

 

 

Become a part of our production team! A contribution of $100 enables our hero to race towards the finish line with full speed! You will be billed as Co-Producer in the end credits of a single episode!

In addition to this, you will receive all the perks described above!

 

 

A gift from us to You! By participating in our campaign with a contribution of $400, we will mail you a signed piece of original Dark Side of the Horse artwork. In this digital age, there will never be too many of these around!

And naturally, you are entitled to all the previous perks described above.

 

 

 

Be the Boss! With a contribution of $1,200 you will have an exquisite chance to be involved in the work of our Executive Group! Your financial support will be acknowledged with the title Executive Producer. Along with the title, your picture will be captured in the end credits: a portrait of You, sketched from a picture of your choice. This unique piece of artwork by Samson will also be delivered to you by mail. And we will start every production day by bowing in your general direction.

Sadly, you are not entitled to any of the other perks described above.

No, we're kidding! Yes, you are!

 

 

 

The creator of Dark Side of the Horse, the Finnish cartoonist Samson (Samuli Lintula) sold his first cartoon in 1983. After that numerous comics, caricatures and illustrations by Samson have been published in countless newspapers, magazines and books as well as online.

The animation producer of Horace Tuomas Mäkelä graduated from the respected Irish School of Animation in 2004. After the graduation he has worked as an illustrator, animator and a producer in various projects varying from Moomin children's books to crowd games for international audiences.

 

 

 

 

 

Animated episodes of Dark Side of the Horse  have always been much requested and like we've said above, we're ready and willing to produce more of them!

We want you to be a part of our campaign: spread the word to anyone who loves fun, games, long walks on the beach... maybe some of them will dig our stuff once they've, uh... walked enough :D!

story:
THE FUCKING FROGMAN IS BACK!

The FUCKING FROGMAN is back with a super team and the amazing Stefano Cardoselli's arts (Heavy Metal Magazine, 2000AD and more).

Release date will be this October and it will be printed as a special One Shot "BEFORE YEAR ZERO", a fucking prequel on the Fucking Frogman origins and on his first capitalist Cuban enemy.


IL FOTTUTO STA TORNANDO!

Torna il Fottuto UomoRana con un super team up e con i bellissimi e folli disegni di Stefano Cardoselli (Heavy Metal Magazine, 2000 AD, and more).

Per Lucca Comics and Games 2014 e per gli USA verra' stampato un One Shot speciale "BEFORE YEAR ZERO", un prequel Fottutamente folle sulle origini del tetro batrace e sul suo primo nemico capitalista cubano.


WHO'S FUCKING WHO?

40-page original One Shot, few copies for a crazy limited editon with an amazing kickass cover!

The FUCKING needs your help to come to life and to get to your fucking bookshops and comics stores!

Super gifts come with the comic book for all the people that contribute to the release of this crazy project. 


CHI STA FOTTENDO CHI?

Un One Shot di 40 pagine tutto nuovo e inedito con poche copie a disposizione in una edizione limitata con una cover che spacca i culi!

Il FOTTUTO ha bisogno del vostro aiuto ora per poter prendere di nuovo vita ed entrare nelle vostre fottute librerie e fumetterie di fiducia!

Con il fumetto ci saranno golosissimi premi per tutti coloro che contribuiranno alla nascita di questo folle progetto!




COSA SI DICE DEL BASTARDONE VERDE?

"Sono rimasto completamente spiazzato da questo fumetto. Ad esser sincero l’idea non mi dispiaceva ma non riuscivo a capire come potesse uscirne qualcosa di interessante. Questo fino a quando non l’ho comprato, e sfogliato. E letto. Questo fumetto è fottutamente epico."

Da Dailybaloon

The fucking frogman video old version

story:
HELP A BROTHA OUT!

Andy Roy is a favorite Anti Hero in skateboarding. And while he's had his ups and downs in the past, he's been keeping it mellow building his image and career in skateboarding back up.

Because of this, Andy has been invited to go on this year's Thrasher Skate Rock, but with just a few dollars and some change in his pocket. He is trying to raise a little cash to be able to support himself while on the trip.

If you want to see him get wild and crazy for the video, send a donation to help him out!

WHAT ANDY NEEDS AND WHAT YOU CAN GET...

  • Andy doesn't need much, just enough to get through the week without being broke and be able to afford the necessities with few little extras here and there, if he can. The more money he's got, the less worries and he'll be able to go all out for the video!
  •  $500 is not a lot... really, kick down what you can. Every donation will be greatly appriciated, just throw down what you can and want.
  • C'mon, you want a postcard from the road... right? Or a phone call! It's guaranteed to be wild, who knows who else will be on the line. For a buck you get to know that your contribution went to a good cause... Andy's good times. For 5 bucks you get stickers selected by Andy from his stash! Get one of 4 autographed boards... or hell, come to San Francisco and skate with him!! Hang out, he will appreciate the help you did for him!

SKATE ROCK WILL GET ROCKED

Feed the monster that is Andy Roy and you won't be disappointed. The more you give, the more Andy will be amped and fired up!

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO

Get the word out to everyone you know! By Helping Andy you have a hand in helping him get more crazy then he's already planning to get. So go out there on the internets and get the word out on the Facebooks and the Instagrams!
 

GET IT GET IT GET IT!

story:
Saving Neil the Horse

Greetings from Hermes Press! We are a comic book and popular culture art publisher based in New Castle, Pennsylvania. We are a family business that has existed since 2001, and run our company with only 3 full-time employees, along with our unpaid office-dog Moose. Over the years HP has reprinted such titles as The Phantom, Buck Rogers, and Dark Shadows. We have also dabbled in new works such as Scratch9.

Our newest reprint project, Neil the Horse, is a reprint of the much-beloved  1980s Canadian comic book series created by Arn Saba (now Katherine Collins).  Hermes Press wants to print Neil the Horse, but to do that we need your help!  

We are already working on restoring the pages, but don’t have the dedicated funds to print the book. Until we do, it’ll just be sitting on our desktops! By helping us fund this project, you will be saving an iconic series. Neil the Horse  will always be in comics history. But we want more for our horsey hero. How about letting him live again?

Neil and his friends Soapy and Mam’selle Poupée are an always-struggling songand-dance act. To gain success, they will go anywhere, do anything, and put up  with anything — like a trip to Hell, or captivity inside a video game, or a gang of  slap-happy aliens in a stunt-driving saucer. Oh, and a drunken and disorderly  back-up band of cats.

Neil is a happy go-lucky (and not too bright) horse with a mania for bananas.  He’s one heck of a tap-dancer and singer, and he can also get down to breakdancing. He adores his two pals, and will do anything for them. 

Mam'selle Poupée is a romantic and lovelorn living doll from France, whose wooden body is jointed with hinges. With red circles on her cheeks, curly blonde hair, and large bust, Poupée appears to be a cross between Raggedy Ann and Dolly Parton. She is a serious dancer, and practices at the studio every day.

Soapy is a street-wise and cynical (with a heart of gold) orange alley cat, a cigarsmoker and a drinker, who serves as their trumpet player, manager and the brains of the operation. Neil thinks that Soapy is the smartest guy in the world . . . and he just might be right.

The book includes an introduction by Trina Robbins, and brand-new commentary by Neil’s creator, Katherine Collins. There’s also some rare art, and souvenirs of the early career of Neil.

Help us help you get this project started so that we can successfully reprint Neil the Horse!


What We Need & What You Get

So what exactly do we need this money for? All of our work in done in-house, so that's already paid for by our boss, but we are lacking funding in one very specific area: printing. The cost to print this kind of book is pretty high if we do it correctly (and we want it done correctly!)

We want $15,000 to pay for printing the book, as well as shipping it back to the United States (we print in China). None of this money will go to anything but our printing costs, because we want, more than anything, to preserve this comic series.

If you help us, beyond the satisfaction of knowing that you put your money to a good cause, you can also get a copy of the finished book if we get funding! 

We want to keep this simple and keep costs down, so the only real perks are the regular edition of the comic book reprint or the special limited edition version, with extra pages, and signed by Katherine Collins. The regular edition is priced currently at $60.00, and the limited edition at $95.00. You'll also get your name in the Thanks page if you donate $25 or more!

The Impact

Every project Hermes Press has done has been a success. This time we decided to reach out to the fans, old and new alike, and see if they'd like to be a part of the process from the beginning, instead of just at the bookstore.

By reprinting Neil the Horse you will be helping preserve a unique comic creation. Not to mention Making the World Safe for Musical Comedy, of course!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please spread the word! Social media can only help us, so please share this on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other media you use!

We are a family business that has existed since 2001, and run our company with only 3 full-time employees, along with our unpaid office-dog Moose. Over the years HP has reprinted such titles as The Phantom, Buck Rogers, and Dark Shadows. We have also dabbled in new works such as Scratch9. 

Our newest reprint project, Neil the Horse, is a reprint of the much-beloved  1980s Canadian comic book series created by Arn Saba (now Katherine Collins).  Hermes Press wants to print Neil the Horse, but to do that we need your help!  
We are already working on restoring the pages, but don’t have the dedicated funds to print the book. Until we do, it’ll just be sitting on our desktops! By helping us fund this project, you will be saving an iconic series. Neil the Horse  will always be in comics history. But we want more for our horsey hero. How about letting him live again?
Neil and his friends Soapy and Mam’selle Poupée are an always-struggling songand-dance act. To gain success, they will go anywhere, do anything, and put up  with anything — like a trip to Hell, or captivity inside a video game, or a gang of  slap-happy aliens in a stunt-driving saucer. Oh, and a drunken and disorderly  back-up band of cats.
Neil is a happy go-lucky (and not too bright) horse with a mania for bananas.  He’s one heck of a tap-dancer and singer, and he can also get down to breakdancing. He adores his two pals, and will do anything for them. 
Mam'selle Poupée is a romantic and lovelorn living doll from France, whose wooden body is jointed with hinges. With red circles on her cheeks, curly blonde hair, and large bust, Poupée appears to be a cross between Raggedy Ann and Dolly Parton. She is a serious dancer, and practices at the studio every day.
Soapy is a street-wise and cynical (with a heart of gold) orange alley cat, a cigarsmoker and a drinker, who serves as their trumpet player, manager and the brains of the operation. Neil thinks that Soapy is the smartest guy in the world . . . and he just might be right.
The book includes an introduction by Trina Robbins, and brand-new commentary by Neil’s creator, Katherine Collins. There’s also some rare art, and souvenirs of the early career of Neil.
Help us help you get this project started so that we can successfully reprint Neil the Horse!




What We Need & What You Get
So what exactly do we need this money for? All of our work in done in-house, so that's already paid for by our boss, but we are lacking funding in one very specific area: printing. The cost to print this kind of book is pretty high if we do it correctly (and we want it done correctly!)
We want $15,000 to pay for printing the book, as well as shipping it back to the United States (we print in China). None of this money will go to anything but our printing costs, because we want, more than anything, to preserve this comic series.
If you help us, beyond the satisfaction of knowing that you put your money to a good cause, you can also get a copy of the finished book if we get funding! 
We want to keep this simple and keep costs down, so the only real perks are the regular edition of the comic book reprint or the special limited edition version, with extra pages, and signed by Katherine Collins. The regular edition is priced currently at $60.00, and the limited edition at $95.00. You'll also get your name in the Thanks page if you donate $25 or more!


The Impact
Every project Hermes Press has done has been a success. This time we decided to reach out to the fans, old and new alike, and see if they'd like to be a part of the process from the beginning, instead of just at the bookstore.
By reprinting Neil the Horse you will be helping preserve a unique comic creation. Not to mention Making the World Safe for Musical Comedy, of course!



Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, please spread the word! Social media can only help us, so please share this on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other media you use!

story:
Short Summary

Help our angry cupid's arrows reach more hearts, and blast through more heart break!

Ex(it) Wounds Cabaret takes real break up letters and turns them into comic monologues, puppet shows, songs and other performances. We don't get paid to do this show, but nothing in life is free. We want to reach out beyond our friends and welcome new folks into our audience, but we need some funds to get the marketing necessary. And we don't have any. We're broke as jokes, yo.  

We are hoping to raise $500.00 to cover postcards, ads, and seat fillers if we can't make our audience quota. :-)

The Impact

We take heart break and heal it with comedy, who couldn't use more of that? If we cannot reach a broader community, our little show that could, won't.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, we would really appreciate it if you told your friends about our show, or come (again! We always have new letters and new performers as well as special guests!!)

 

Our next (and maybe final) run is:

Thursdays at 7:30 (February 7, 14, and 21)

IO West Mainstage 

6366 Hollywood Blvd, Los Angeles, California 
 
$5.00 - Bring us your break up letters/texts/emails for 2 for 1 tickets and the chance for your letter to performed live by our special guests!

story:
Hello, and thanks for checking out my project. Lionheart Tales is a 52 page black and white comic with a full color cover, continuing the adventures of the intrepid feline investigative reporter who covers the world of mobsters, movie stars, aliens and super heroes. I wrote and drew hundreds of pages of humorous comics in the 80s and 90s for Eclipse, Fantagraphics, Mirage and a few others. Lionheart first appeared in Fantagraphics' funny animal anthology Critters in 1985; the last appearance of Lionheart was in 1995, in the pages of Usagi Yojimbo.

Nearly twenty years later I decided to return to the character and create the first new pages of comic art I had crafted in decades. I wanted to connect some dots from the earlier adventures while covering some of what happened to Lionheart in the years he's been out of print. The new story features talking appliances, a disembodied super genius, a possibly psychic monkey, an overzealous mouse with super powers, and aliens, both gelatinous and crablike.

Lionheart Tales 2014 features 36 pages of brand new black and white art and a 16 page reprint of classic material that relates to the new story. I am delighted to include a rear cover illustration by the brilliant Stan Sakai, featuring Lionheart and Usagi Yojimbo almost side-by-side. The artwork on this book is 99% complete, and now I want to raise enough money to self publish a few hundred copies. And give people a chance to own some nifty original art.

Perks include PDF downloads of older Lionheart stories including a special full color version of Lionheart's debut tale, Zany But Deadly. Original art boards and sketchbook pages, including Stan's superb drawing, are available at higher perk levels for contributors.

Those unfamiliar with my previously published work should visit my website, www.tomstazer.com, or my blog, http://cattywampus-tom.blogspot.com/

story:
Wussup!! We are...The Crank Brothers.

This series is about 2 brothers growing up in Cranksville together with help of their neighborhood friends, as they learn life lessons and all types of genres of music (Go-Go, Jazz, R&B, Blues…etc) and its different pioneers and legends which will appear in some form or fashion in each episode.


This campaign is to complete episode 1. 

(Episode 1) Title: "The Day I Found...."

Story: While playing outside, the crew hears a hypnotic and grooving sound that changed their lives forever! Once discovered they learn who it came from and how to play it.

_____________________________________

Future episodes: 

Episode2: Sardines & Pork and Beans (child hunger)

Episode3: Run Joe (dont use drugs)

Episode4: Ruff It Off (stop bullying)

Episode5: Overnight Scenario (teen pregnancy)

Episode6: Always a Homie (friendship) 


___________________________

MEET THE CHARACTERS:









WE CRANKFULLY APPRECIATE YOUR CONTRIBUTION!!!

story:
THIS IS THE LAST CHANCE TO RESERVE GREG HILDEBRANDT'S EPIC, NEW RED SONJA COVER BEFORE IT'S GONE!

A Long Time Ago In a Galaxy Far Far Away...

1977 was a revolutionary year for sci fi and fantasy.  Greg Hildebrandt was at the epicenter of the event having collaborated with his brother Tim on the incredible original Star Wars theatrical poster for the movie that changed the genre forever.  The image has been a beacon of fandom and has inspired generations of fans to look to the stars and imagine the heroism of a rebel alliance fighting against the tyranny of a galactic empire.  Greg's wonderful eye for the fantastic and flair for capturing the magnificent has been on display for over four decades.  Every project he undertakes comes to life on the canvas and is a virtual feast for the imagination.

Red Sonja #1 Debuts in 1977

That same year, Marvel Comics would publish the first dedicated series for a sword and sorcery hero that changed the fantasy landscape forever in Red Sonja #1.  Following her heralded debut, creators Roy Thomas and Frank Thorne delivered a fantastic series that saw the character flourish and forge her own way in a world of monsters and magicians.  Red Sonja cut a swath of heroic adventure through a landscape of horrors for an eager fanbase that could not get enough of the visionary title.  Since that time, Red Sonja has continued her journey in the form of comics, film, and novels.

Greg Hildebrandt Commemorative Red Sonja #1 Edition

Flash forward to 2020 - we asked Greg Hildebrandt to commemorate Red Sonja #1 with a special edition that represents that first issue with a cover that is an homage to the famous Star Wars theatrical poster he and his brother painted!  As you've seen in the video, Greg did an extensive video photo shoot to prepare for this painting.  He worked with his models and photographer to find just the right pose and presentation to capture the action and spirit of Red Sonja in glorious vibrant brushstrokes.  The painting process took him back to that earlier time and allowed him to revisit the creation of that masterpiece.  And the result speaks for itself...

A Look Back at Red Sonja #1 (1977)

For many, this was their first introduction to the She Devil with a Sword.  Red Sonja's first solo series featured two of comics' most revered talents in writer Roy Thomas and artist Frank Thorne.  These two legends of four color glory brought a vivacious energy to Red Sonja and an kindred spirit of action to the page.  Monsters, mythology, and mad magicians sprang across the panels to torment the red haired fury.  But she always found a way to carve her destiny out with the steel of her sword.  This is a peek inside the interiors of this commemorative edition that has recently been remastered in color.

The Legend of The Lord of the Rings Art

Greg and Tim Hildebrandt were legendary fantasy painters even before that famous movie poster.  Their collaboration on the Lord of the Rings calendars defined the vision of J.R.R. Tolkien's seminal masterpieces.  Fantasy fans everywhere wanted these illustrations hanging in their homes as a small window into the worlds of wonder they loved.  The paintings were collected into a beautiful art book - The Tolkien Years of the Brothers Hildebrandt - which now serves as the portal into The Lord of the Rings for new generations of fans.  This updated and expanded edition includes all-new pages with commentary and new materials.  Its presented here for fans that want to discover the incredible treasures and for longtime enthusiasts looking to relive the magic of the Hildebrandt Brothers' work.

 

 

EXTREMELY LIMITED EDITIONS WITH EARLY SHIPPING

These Greg Hildebrandt Red Sonja editions are extremely limited and are printing right now.  It is our intention to have the unsigned / non graded books shipping right after the close of this project.  We want all of our supporters to have these amazing homage covers in your collections as soon as humanly possible.  Watch for production updates and forthcoming shipping details!

story:
Who me?

My name is Kamau Mshale, I'm an artist and comic book creator from Philly. Many black comic book fans will complain about the black characters in comics today. They are stereotypes or they don’t look like African Americans or they are sidekicks and not prominent enough.  There are lots of reasons but it boils down lack of exposure for the many independent characters by smaller creators who intentionally fill these voids. So this is the start of my campaign to create a character and have her transcend the underground and indie-comic section and become a American cultural icon.

Create a cultural icon?

Not just for me, or black people but for young women and little girls and little boys and young men whose standard of beauty and body image, is being shaped every day. Just not in a positive way.  A recent study showed that the self image of African American youth has not changed much since 50's. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ybDa0gSuAcg 
The size and shape of women is constantly being scrutinized and the black woman even more so. It was the labeling of world class athletes and models as "fat" that prompted me to create an image that speaks to the shape of many women and a lot of them African America. Women who are by no means fat or out of shape or obese but don’t fit the BMI standards or what is shown in media as “in shape”.

Great but what does that really mean?

I've seen firsthand the smiles created by Captain Kacela on little black girls.  The look of a person greatly impacts self esteem. When you don't see yourself in the places of power in video games, fiction books, comic books, movies or even music, imagine what that could do to yourself image and self esteem. There have been some efforts to consciously boost that image, this is one step in that line and every step is important. I want to add this positive character to the worlds collective thoughts and give young women one more positive reflection and I need help.

How you can help?

I've been working on it. I’m drawing inking digitally editing everything. There are  some road blocks: Production Distribution and Advertising. A lot of the problem is the amount of money I’m able to put in. I can only buy a small amount of books. I haven’t done any real advertising yet. The majority of the money will go to printing a larger volume of quality books, will go to paying for advertising, online and a few convention tables.

Awesome but your broke.

It’s not all about money though. If you can’t contribute please help by telling people about Kacela (ka-chay-la). She doesn’t mean anything if she isn’t a idea that people know about. She is about accepting and loving who you are and not falling victim to the idea that there’s only one look that equals beauty. Every one you tell every time someone talks about the character what she was created for or buys a book it helps tremendously.

story:
Our Story

Dance Crisis is the first student team to come out of The New Movement's New Orleans training center. We came together a year ago and with the help of Stupid Time Machine and Chris Trew and Tami Nelson the nine of us are on our way to becoming fierce improvisers. Back in June we found out that we had been accepted into the Upright Citizen's Brigade's Del Close Marathon which is a very big opportunity for us. That's why we are here.


The Impact

The New Movement's New Orleans training center is just starting to shift into high gear. We are trying to get the word out to as many people as possible, and Dance Crisis has a beautiful opportunity to raise awareness not only for themselves but for our home theater which we are so proud of.

What We Need & What You Get

This is where you come in. We need help getting up there. Flights, hotels, etc. add up and every dollar you donate will help us enormously. In exchange, you get some awesome gifts that come straight from our hearts to your hands.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Twitter! Facebook! Good ol' fashioned email! Carrier Pigeon! We need to spread awareness about this, can you help?

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Nathan Fehr, creator of Interesting Times. I've been drawing for as long as I can remember, and writing journal comics on a regular basis for the past seven years. I love getting to do this and over time have built a small but loyal fanbase. Honestly I've never had aspirations of fame, but I have always thought it'd be awesome to see my work in print.

Around a year ago a friend of mine and his wife told me they wanted to help with that dream. They were getting into the idea of independent press, they told me, and with so much available material my site was practically book-ready! 

And so I got to work digging out old files, compiling commentary and getting everything ready. At long last I'm proud to announce that we're ready to get this thing published and start sellin' copies!

...there's just a matter of getting it printed.

What We Need & What You Get

"Interesting Times: Year One & Two" will be 300 pages of the best Interesting Times comics printed in black and white on high quality 50 lb paper with hardcover and foil stamping. To get this done, we reached out to Friesens, a Southern Manitoba-based company that does high quality publishing work including oh I don't know the HARRY POTTER books. They gave us a printing price per unit of $14.89 for 200 books, which means we need $2978. That's kind of a lot of money!

So in return for helping us make this a reality, we want to give you the credit you deserve: your name in the book, cool extras like stickers, pins, and some of the most beloved Interesting Times web banners as prints for supporters! Best of all, the perk for a $35 pledge is the physical printed book itself. And for $60 you get an Indiegogo exclusive Ninja Edition with custom drawings by the author! What's more, if you've ever wanted to meet me for an hour lunch, it's now possible with the magic of currency!

The Cover:

 

The Pins:

 

The Sticker:

 

The Individual Pin:

 

 

Hit the "Gallery" tab up top for more!

 

The Impact

Printed books are being challenged by digital alternatives these days. We get that! But, did you notice that protoype book in the video? Even though it's low-resolution and hastily assembled there's something special about having a solid, tangible, printed thing. I'm not trying to toot my own horn here, I've had that prototype lying around for a while now and I've seen it draw people in. And the one we want to make is going to be even better.

For me personally this book will still be a meaningful accomplishment even if we don't make a dime. For others I'm sure it'll be different things -- something fun to have on the coffee table, something unique to have on the bookshelf, or even just something stable to put a monitor on. Whatever motivates you, I want to thank you in advance for helping out. I know you're going to enjoy the finished product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this campaign! Even if you don't contribute financially, tell somebody about it! You can link this page directly in whatever way you choose OR use IndieGoGo's share tools! Thanks in advaaaance ;)

So in return for helping us make this a reality, we want to give you the credit you deserve: your name in the book, cool extras like stickers, pins, and some of the most beloved Interesting Times web banners as prints for supporters! Best of all, the perk for a $35 pledge is the physical printed book itself. And for $60 you get an Indiegogo exclusive Ninja Edition with custom drawings by the author! What's more, if you've ever wanted to meet me for an hour lunch, it's now possible with the magic of currency!
The Cover:

 
The Pins:

 
The Sticker:

 
The Individual Pin:

 
 
Hit the "Gallery" tab up top for more!
 
The Impact


Printed books are being challenged by digital alternatives these days. We get that! But, did you notice that protoype book in the video? Even though it's low-resolution and hastily assembled there's something special about having a solid, tangible, printed thing. I'm not trying to toot my own horn here, I've had that prototype lying around for a while now and I've seen it draw people in. And the one we want to make is going to be even better.
For me personally this book will still be a meaningful accomplishment even if we don't make a dime. For others I'm sure it'll be different things -- something fun to have on the coffee table, something unique to have on the bookshelf, or even just something stable to put a monitor on. Whatever motivates you, I want to thank you in advance for helping out. I know you're going to enjoy the finished product.


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about this campaign! Even if you don't contribute financially, tell somebody about it! You can link this page directly in whatever way you choose OR use IndieGoGo's share tools! Thanks in advaaaance ;)

story:
Hello Everyone!

My names Crystal Jayme, but you can just call me Scotty!

I'm the artist/writer for Technicolor London!

I'm so excited to be working on Volume 3! It seems like yesterday I was barely starting page 1 of this comic TwT (So many memories!)

This'll be my first campain to help raise funds for everything related to this comic! <:3

I'm hoping to raise $1200.00 to cover the books and perks, but even if we don't meet the full amount by the deadline , I'll still use the funds to print books, and everyone is guaranteed the perks that they paid for. (I'll just be doing a smaller print run of Volume 3 <3) 

If you can't contribute, but would like to help out, Spread The Word! 

Any help would be greatly appreciated! TwT 

What the Comic is About

  The story focuses on Toby and Mark's  relationship as a new couple and how they learn to deal with the stress of work, social life and eachother.

 The comic updates Every Tuesday and Friday, and you can Read Vol. 1 and Vol.2 online for free at:

ww.TechnicolorLondon.Smackjeeves.com 

Check out the Official Website here!

And "Like" the Technicolor London Facebook page here!

The Breakdown

 Volume 3 will be around 115 pages. 93 will be the story + 22 pages of Bonus Comics! The book will be B/W, Perfect Bound and 6.75x10.25.

 The book will be done by November, and shipped out by the end of the month! (Plenty of time before the holidays~!)

Note: I'll be adding more Bonus Material so the Page count will most likely be around 130.

 I'm currently Penciling pages for Volume 3 and  I'll be constantly updating with pics on how Volume 3 is coming along on Tumblr! (You can find the link on the bottom :3)

 100% of the proceeds will go to Printing books, Shipping fees and the IndieGogo fees. Anything left over will be used for printing future Volumes and more Technicolor London Goodies!

Note: If you'd like to switch Volume 3 with either Volume 1 or 2, Please State which Volume in the "Comment Section" When you claim your Perk! <3

The Perks

These are the Items i'll have available for this campain!

Volume 3 Cover: TBA

2'' Inch Logo Button

 

3x4 Kiss Cut Sticker Sheet

 

1''Inch Keychains (Set of 3)

1'' Chibi Button Set (Set of 6)

Bookmark Set: TBA

Hoodie: TBA

Volume 1 

Volume 2

11x17 Print

Commission Details

Your Commission will be inked on A4 sized paper and you can request up to 2 characters. Fanart or Original Characters! 

Special Appearance Details

You send me info if it'll be you or your character that will be in the comic. Which character you'd like to have the interaction with, and In december I'll begin storyboarding Volume 4. Once completed,  I'll send you info on the setting and the page setup for which your character will appear. From there, you'll get to write the dialogue for that scene!

 Your name will also be listed in the back of the book! 

Note: Volume 4 will be storyboarded in December and won't be due untill 2013.

Original 3 Page Comic

You can request whatever you'd like for this. You can come up with the script yourself and I Illustrate it, or you give me the basic idea and I work from there, Or maybe you want it to be about your favorite anime series! The possiblities are endless! <3

Own Original Pages

You get to own your favorite page from Each Technicolor London Book! Volumes 1-3!

Note: 10-15 pages are missing from Volume 1 and 2. (I blame this on my cat T^T)

ALL BOOK ORDERS WILL BE GETTING A FREE GIFT!

Shipping Details

To Cover Additional Shipping costs, International Backers, Please add:

  • $5.00 to orders $15+
  • $8.00 to Orders $75.00+
  • $15.00 to Orders $150.00+

Have any Questions?

Feel free to email me at ScottyStudios@yahoo.com or on any of the sites below!

  • Deviantart
  • Twitter
  • Tumblr

Thanks for taking the time to check out this project! <3

    -Love Scotty!

story:
Short Summary

Doxi the Dog in Ambienceworld is a 52 page full color comic adventure book suitable for all ages but mainly targeted at 9 years plus.

Ambienceworld is the first book in a series of adventures featuring the characters I have created.

The stories center around the main character Doxi the Dog, Skuttler the Duck and Peewee the Croc (introduced in future stories) as they stumble into numerous adventures encountering many friends and foes on the way.

I've been drawing this character for many many years. The first appearance of Doxi was in a comic zine in 1984. He also made an appearance in the first version of the Ambienceworld story in Bonafide Comics in the mid 90s.

I have since set about rewriting and redrawing the entire story to reach a wider audience and years later it is finally finished and ready to be unleashed.

The Plan

The plan is to publish using Publish on Demand. POD means that there is no big print run, it is just printed as and when there are sales, although I would be ordering a small run at cost price for promotional purposes

I will also make the book available on ebook platforms such as iBooks on the Apple iPad, Barnes and Noble Nook reader, Amazon Kindle, Kobo and others using the excellent Graphicly platform. They will provide the aggregation service to these various ebook platforms as well via their unique Facebook app.

For printed versions of the book I will either use CreateSpace or Lighting Source to make it available to buy on Amazon as well as their partner networks such as Barnes and Noble and distributors such as Ingram and NACSCORP.

Finance

Although Publish on Demand is a very low cost form of publishing there are certain costs I need to raise for the following (in order of priority)

  • Different ISBN numbers are needed for the numerous formats, including ebook versions, such as ePub (iBooks) PDF etc and the printed versions. A batch of 10 should cover these.

  • The POD service distribution package cost

  • Initial Order of physical books from Createspace/LSI for Promotional purposes and your Indiegogo Rewards :-)

  • Graphicly
    Syndication of the ebook version via the Graphicly platform

  • Layout help needed for print ready artwork

If possible any additional funds would also go towards developing a website presence, advertising and possibly an app - but the top priority is covering the book/ebook costs.

Please note: The book is actually already available on the Kindle, as a test, as this was free and fairly easy to set up.

What You Get

Be part of the relaunch for this great creative project and help unleash the first book for the enjoyment of, hopefully, millions :-)

There's a combination of Perks including postcard sets, PDF and perfect bound versions of the book, stickers, signed drawings and prints.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute you can help in many ways and this is hugely appreciated!

Tweet and Share this funding campaign on Facebook by using the Indiegogo sharing tools

Tell your friends!

Help me unleash the Mutt! thanks a million :-)

story:
Members of Team StarKid recently opened a sketch comedy show at UP Comedy Club in Chicago. The show closes March 3rd and to congratulate the team we want to send two beautiful bouquets of flowers to them on closing night along with a message from the fans, including a list of names of people who contributed. 

 

The target is set at $500, this is because that is the minimum amount allowed to set up this project, but don't worry! If we don't hit the target, we can still go ahead! 

 

We will need $140 to cover the flowers and delivery. Please see the link below to the florist and submit any preference to which bouquets you'd like us to send to StarKidCorner@hotmail.co.uk.

Any funds left over after the flowers are purchased will be donated to a charity of StarKid's choosing on their behalf. 

 

We know not everyone could see the show in person, but even so, we are ALL proud of what the team has accomplished. This is our way of showing that! 

 

Thank You for taking the time to visit the project page! 

 

Check out the flowers here >>> http://www.rd-rausch-cliffordflorist.com/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris Hicks. I'm a screenwriter and filmmaker with over twelve years of experience under my belt. Crafting this story has been a passion of mine for over six years. As a comic book lover all my life, I wanted to create a story that would be familiar, yet stand on its own. Dark Hero is about the dark side of being a "superhero". It's about the "What If's". If the city you sacrificed everything for and protected for years, turned its back on you--what would you become? What if they need you back? This is a story that deserves to be told. We are very proud to bring this story to life and share it with ALL LOVERS OF COMICS. With your help we know this can be something different. Something special!

Met the team!

Co-writer - SHANE STEPHENS

Illustrator - JESSICA RUBY

Promotions - NICHOLAS PEREZ 

What We Need to finish

  • 60% will go towards finishing the illustrations.
  • 20% will go towards editing.
  • 20% will go promotions. 

LIMITED EDITION PERKS! 

  • Printed copies(special variant cover), wall banner, poster, stickers, and T-shirt.
  • You can be drawn in our next issue!
  • ALL PERKS ARE LIMITED EDITIONS CREATED FOR THIS ISSUE!

  • Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk when you go avant-garde. It can be extremely challenging, but we have the experience, talent, and passion to overcome our obstacles. With your help we can get this story out to the world for everyone to enjoy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any and all help is greatly appreciated!

Remember you can use your SHARE features here on Indiegogo! 

Share with all your friends and family that LOVE COMIC BOOKS!

REMEMBER TO FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA SO YOU CAN STAY UP TO DATE!

INSTAGRAM @DARKHEROCOMICBOOK

TWITTER @DARKHEROCOMIC

FACEBOOK @DARKHEROCOMICBOOK

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR TAKING TIME OUT FOR OUR PROJECT!

story:
• Created by Timothy Lim and Mark Pellegrini
  • Art by Timothy Lim
  • Written by Mark Pellegrini
  • Lettering by Timothy Lim
  • Music by Doug Garrett 
  • Made and Printed in the USA

KAMEN AMERICA is the ongoing story about aspiring fashion designer Charlotte "Carly" Vanders, who finds herself thrust into a world of monster-fighting and heroics, all the while having to contend with media hounds, unscrupulous profiteers, and the struggles of maintaining some semblance of a private life. An unexpected sleeper hit that debuted in the spring of 2020, KAMEN AMERICA, Volume 1 raised more than 900% over its initial funding goal between Kickstarter and IndieGoGo and is slated to debut in retail stores (in a shortened format) courtesy of Antarctic Press this fall.

KAMEN AMERICA, Volume 2: The Founding Fighters takes place almost a year after the events of the first volume and months after the tie-in story featured in BLACK HOPS, Volume 3: Hopocalypse Now.

After turning down her future prospects with her media rep, Carly is working tirelessly to promote herself while suffering a daily barrage of media smear pieces. Monster appearances have not ended and the mystery of who's behind all of it still remains. Fortunately, this time she's joined by former foe Misha Lovacova, who now goes by the name Kamen Comet. Things get complicated really quickly when Carly's former agent, Niro Lansky, joins forces the mysterious woman behind the monster attacks: Vermillion Masquerade! And if that wasn't enough, a rival from Carly's past shows up to complicate things even further!

A few twists and turns present themselves as the cast and world of KAMEN AMERICA continues to expand! We know that you'll find that this second volume truly bests our previous work in terms of storytelling, art, and craft!

WE ARE 100% COMPLETE! Since last year, we have made it a point to only go live with our pre-orders once the book is fully finished: for IndieGoGo, you have the extra bonus of already having a fully-printed book since we launch our pre-orders after having successfully funded on Kickstarter.

While some industry professionals are consistently late on their crowdfunded books due to a combination of unrealistic expectations, poor time management, and/or prioritization of other dealings, every member of our creative effort comes from a business management world, where it is crucial for us to deliver a quality book, on time, as promised. We offer a small number of reward tiers to accommodate a variety of tastes and budgets while keeping it lean enough for an easy fulfillment. Our rewards for Volume 2 include:

  • KAMEN AMERICA, Volume 2: The Founding Fighters 64-page graphic novel. It includes 8 pages of bonus content that any future potential retail version won't have. Front cover by Timothy Lim and Genzoman; back cover by Jacob Gerber
  • A reprint of KAMEN AMERICA, Volume 1: Stars & Strife with a brand new front and back cover by Ale Borgobello and IBUO, respectively
  • An upgraded acrylic standee. Measuring almost 6 inches tall, this is a 2 inch upgrade over our previous offering and features Kamen America and Kamen Comet!
  • Kamen America and Friends 1st Annual Swimsuit Calendar. This 12 month 2021 calendar features art from Kamen America, RAGS, Punchline, and Black Hops. Showcasing a variety of artists including Luigi Teruel, Matthew Weldon, Sashi Perdigao, Scott Malin, and Timothy Lim!
  • Original, full colored art by Timothy Lim
  • KAMEN AMERICA, Volume 2 Genzoman / Andrew Herman / Timothy Lim variant cover signed by creators Timothy Lim and Mark Pellegrini

IMPORTANT INFORMATION REGARDING FULFILLMENT:

We pride ourselves on 2 years of successful crowdfunding and shipping in a timely manner: all of our books between 2019 and 2020 were delivered either a month early or on-time. However, the unique system by which crowdfunding operates necessitates some personal policies to protect both you, the reader, and us the creators:

  • Digital PDFs are TIME SENSITIVE, sent within 24 hours of receiving funding from IndieGoGo, which is usually 4-10 days after the campaign ends. These files are sent via WeTransfer links, which expire after 7 days. Due to our busy schedules, we will be strongly enforcing this. We are not responsible for backers who do not download our files: we have to be able to focus on other work without taking time out of our day to resend huge files to delinquent backers.
  • Physical books will be replaced if our tracking data shows that the parcel has not arrived within a reasonable period of time, or if significant damage was done to the books in transit. However, we are not responsible for book inquiries 3 months after the ship date. After 3 months, USPS will typically scrub tracking data. We cannot be dealing with shipping inquiries 6 months, a year, 2 years after the shipping date: that is not fair to us, nor is it fair to backers who have been monitoring the status of their orders. The onus of responsibility must fall on the customer to keep up with our updates regarding shipping schedules and other inquiries.

Risks and challenges

With 2 years of successful, on-time crowdfunding under our belt, we can guarantee a Fall 2020 fulfillment on or ahead of time. The book is 100% complete and funded on Kickstarter previously, meaning that all we need to do is go to print!

Due to our busy schedules, we will be strongly enforcing this. We are not responsible for backers who do not download our files: we have to be able to focus on other work without taking time out of our day to resend huge files to delinquent backers.
Physical books will be replaced if our tracking data shows that the parcel has not arrived within a reasonable period of time, or if significant damage was done to the books in transit. However, we are not responsible for book inquiries 3 months after the ship date. After 3 months, USPS will typically scrub tracking data. We cannot be dealing with shipping inquiries 6 months, a year, 2 years after the shipping date: that is not fair to us, nor is it fair to backers who have been monitoring the status of their orders. The onus of responsibility must fall on the customer to keep up with our updates regarding shipping schedules and other inquiries.

Risks and challenges
With 2 years of successful, on-time crowdfunding under our belt, we can guarantee a Fall 2020 fulfillment on or ahead of time. The book is 100% complete and funded on Kickstarter previously, meaning that all we need to do is go to print!

story:
Short Summary

The comics will be illustrated by artist Nathan Thomas Milliner who created a beautiful limited edition piece several years back that we previously sold through our B4TM webstore (see photo gallery)! We want to release all 8 issues in this series (this cover art is a working draft) and this funding campaign is the catalyst for upcoming projects...

All issues will be shipped with backing in a protective plastic sleeve.

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal is $18,000. This covers the costs for the first 3 issues.

We have a TON of perks! Not just the comics, either. We're offering autographed copies of the issues, posters, shirts and best of all the opportunity to have a character named after you in an upcoming issue!

The Impact

When we attempted to fund our sequel a few years ago, we heard you loud and clear. You want us to #BringLeslieBack! We want to make it happen just as badly as you do. This comic series is a vital stepping stone because it illustrates (literally) the vision for the movie while also proving the demand (assuming it sells!). Leveraging the movie's 10th anniversary year is super important because there won't be another chance like this to build momentum towards another film.

story:
Hello!
We are four comic creators, Anette, Natalia, Elise and Diana, and we are the editors of the Freya anthology!

What is Freya – Sequential Love Stories?

Freya is an indie comic book project. It is an anthology that includes stories made by fourteen of the best Scandinavian comic artists with focus on women's love stories. That means that all of the main characters in Freya define themselves as women and every story is written from women’s point of view with the theme of love between women.

Our goal was not to force the artists to make erotica, but to let them simply explore the enjoyment and hardships between two female persons without the need for intimacy unless the story led them there. Some of the artists chose to depict a blooming love or interest, while others wanted to go even further…

So, what is this lovely campaign about?

This is what we need your help with.

  • We are hoping to raise 2000€ to help us pay the printing costs for the books, (this will also cover the shipping costs for the gifts we would like to send you as a thank you for your donations).

  • Since this is an indie project, that means that we have no outside funding to print these books, other than the gathered help of the participating artists.

  • If you choose to donate, for example, 18€ (about 20$) we will give you a physical copy of the book as a thank you!

  • Every little bit helps, even if you’re only able to donate 1€, we will be really grateful for your support. We also have other perks and gifts for you who choose to donate, be sure to check them out.
Don’t forget to check in from time to time to see our updates!


Can we do this? Yes, we can!

All of us editors have either participated in or been editors for anthologies like this before and have produced many marvelous and appreciated self-published comic books and anthologies.
We know how to deal with printers, creators and how to make this project a reality.
Trust us, we’ve got this ;)

What happens if we don’t reach our goal?
Don’t worry. If we don’t reach our campaign goal we will still print the books and everyone who donated will still receive their books and perks!

All of the donations that we receive from this campaign will go to the printing of the books, and the rest will come from our own, the artists, pockets.

Why is this anthology important?

We started this project because of the lack of stories about love between women, made by people who themselves define as women. To let us define women’s love stories without the influence of the male gaze or porn clichés.

Where does the name Freya come from?

The name is tied to our origin, the Nordic countries. She is the Norse goddess of lust and sensuality, but she is also given half the souls of those Vikings killed in battle, making her a goddess of war and death as well. We chose to name the book Freya because of her dual nature and independent spirit. This duality of hers is reflected in our collection of stories.

Our perks!

We would like to thank our donators by giving you gifts!
Here are some of the perk-levels that we are offering, check out the full list to the right on this page.



The finished book!

The book consists of:
  • 300 comic pages
  • Made by 14 of Scandinavias most talented comic artists
  • Full color cover and black/white/gray interior pages
  • Dimensions of the book is 165 x 235 mm
  • A perfect-bound softcover volume, meaning that the final volume will have a smooth spine to which the interior pages are glued
  • All text is completely in English
  • Contains genres like sci-fi, slice-of-life and fantasy!
  • All of which are love stories between women!

Timeline

We have just sent the book to the printers!
All of us have been working together since September 2014 by reading each other’s layout sketches and giving each other feedback to ensure some really lovely and varied comics for you to read.
The book will be officially released at Stockholms International Comicsfestival in May 2015.

We expect to be able to start shipping out your books and perks in May! Hooray!


Gallery

Please check out our gallery (the tab at the top of the page) to see some of the sketches, behind-the-scenes material and sneak peeks of the comics in Freya – Sequential Love Stories. Plus, an exclusive look at how the cover art for the book as created.
There is already some stuff up there, so go have a look! Also look for updates and new art added throughout this campaign.


Who are we, the editors of the Freya anthology?

Anette Bengtsson, creator of the webcomic Cover (tapastic.com/series/cover-up).

Elise Rosberg, founder of Wasabi Press, comic creator and teacher of comics.

Natalia Batista, teacher at the Comic art school in Malmö and creator of the comics A Song for Elise, Mjau! and Sword Princess Amaltea.

Diana Davidsson, member of the studio Think Ink and creator of the webcomic The Protector (protectorcomic.smackjeeves.com).


The artists of Freya – Sequential Love Stories 2015

Anette Bengtsson + Anna Landin + Diana Davidsson + Elinore Sander
Elise Rosberg + Emi Greneby + Jenni Söderlund + Lina Brunhage
Lisa Harald + Simo + Natalia Batista + Nicole Svensson + Sara Berntsson
Therese Malmgren

Help support us!

If you don’t have the funds to donate, there are other ways that you can help us. By sharing this campaign, invite your friends, talk about it and spreading the word you are helping us a lot!

Want to know more about us?

Visit, share and like us at:
Facebook.com/freyaandfrey
Twitter.com/freya_and_frey

Thank you!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project! We hope that you like what you see and that you’ll support us by sharing this campaign and by helping us raise the funds to print these awesome comics!

story:
After a meteorite crashes into the woodland outskirts of a small feudal Japanese village, an elite group of Samurai are dispatched to investigate. What they discover is a massive rip in time and space with dinosaurs pouring through it.

Written by Mike Murphy, art by Sergio Calvet, cover by Kelsey Shannon. 116 pages, black and white. All copies will be signed by Mike Murphy

This was Chibi Comics' first major IGG/Comicsgate campaign in 2019, and this is your last chance to get your 1st edition copy! Once they're gone, THEY'RE GONE.

All orders will ship in late June!

Brief excerpts from The Cabin:
