story:
YOU! Hello!

My name is Gavin. I need help printing a comic book. YOUR HELP!

 In 2010 I started Soldiers of Fortune Comics. It is something that can generously be called a comic book company. Hailing from the jughandles of northern New Jersey, I am passionate about world building and story telling. I am bad at the arting. That is where Angela "The Hammer" Fernot comes in. She do draw good as well as me am write!

BEHOLD!

Blackout page 11.

"If ifs and buts were candy and nuts..." eh, how does the rest of that go?

You might be saying "They may be dead sexy but how do I know they have any follow-through?" Good question! And thanks, I have been blasting my quads more. The reason we are doing flexible funding is because Blackout WILL be printed regardless of money raised. With SoF being an extremely small operation, every penny counts. Any money raised means having more breathing room to pay people, continue making comics, and allows us to buy food that doesn't have to written in quotation marks, as "food", on the package. We already have 2 complete comics. Ironhorse issue #1 and #2 combine to make 60 pages. Issue #3 has started pencils. Total will be about 260+ pages over 8 issues.

Yeah, great. Mind telling me what Blackout actually is?

Oh! sorry about that! Too many baseball bats to the head.

Blackout is a complete story (no drawn-out 8 issue arcs here! instant gratification!) in 36 glorious full-color pages. WOW! so big! The major companies are down to like 16!

Blackout is 100% penciled, 66% inked, and 25% colored. Expected completion is 6 months.

WARNING: Nitty gritty world details follow, from inside the front cover:

Blackout started life as the main quarry for the city of Ironhorse. As the city grew,

it hungrily consumed vast amounts of stone. The quarry quickly bore down into the earth. Hitting an enormous natural cave system, it evolved into a hybrid of an open pit quarry and mine system. The stonecutters-now-miners spread throughout the underground, turning their underground camps into makeshift towns. However, the grueling work took its toll on the guilds. Illness was common among those who came and went from the mine. Fatal accidents were all too common. The missing people were numerous. With resources becoming harder and more expensive to extract from the mine and the workforce weakening, the entire mine was abandoned. Eventually, the slums of Ironhorse grew to encompass the old quarry, now renamed Blackout, for a more sinister purpose.

A quote from Bala Wong, a reporter from Ironhorse, regarding the subject:
   "[...]it is currently used as dumping ground for people who are deemed unfit for
society and must be removed. Typically, if a person commits a grievous mistake against the guilds they get tossed into the slums. If they can not even get along with the gangs in the slums, they get tossed into, or run to, Blackout, destined never to return.
   
   [...]The people who survived the fall into Blackout ended up forming gangs of their
own, like those in the slums. These more tribe-like bands keep to themselves and only leave their home base to forage for food and supplies amongst the ruins. Since resources are scarce, any meeting between these tribes while foraging is immediately hostile as they vie for control of the area."

Sive leads Outcast Family, the largest tribe in Blackout. She refuses to turn her back on those in need despite dwindling resources. After a fire wipes out their food supply, the lives of the entire tribe are in Sive's hands. The only answer is a desperate mission to scavenge for anything they can find in the darkness of Blackout.

Blackout page 19.


Our Catch-22

We all have day jobs which slows down our production to a crawl. Typical days are 12 hour days, then make noodles, fall asleep face down in said noodles. Be thankful we didn't die in the salty ramen goodness. repeat. Comic production happens mostly on the weekends, sadly, and any concision non-noodle time we find. With slow production we can't make a living making comics and we can't produce faster because of work. Compound that with the fact quality comic art takes time...a lot of time. We are caught in "The catch-22" by "The System" run by "The Man" and that is "The Depressing"!

Cover of Blackout by Angela Fernot



Stretch goals

$3,000 - Printing in the USA! Like it or not New Jersey is apart of the USA. So we'd like to shop local and keep some people employed here. Sadly, it is more expensive and/or needs larger quantities. With your help we might not destroy America!

$Anything extra - Why give us more money? Why not a poke in the eyes? Uh, Forget I said that last part. Anyways, anything beyond the goal goes directly to paying the artists, inkers, colorists, and printing which keeps us going, keeps those lights on, and lets us crank out more stories, faster .

Thanks for reading this and please spread the word!


Rewards


The buttons. 1" round. Top button is the Ironhorse city symbol. Bottom button is the church of Torban symbol.


The magnet! 1.75"x2.75"


Ironhrose #1 and #2!

The 11x17 print!

Angie's sketch book! 8.5'x5.5' 14 pages with a blank back cover for a unique sketch if you picked that option!


Naming a character - In both Blackout and Ironhorse characters come and go all the time. This is your chance to be one of them! Any name you like will be used in a future comic (Ironhorse #3 is currently being worked on, Another Blackout story is being written as well). Names tend to be used in Ironhorse, Nicknames tend to be used in the slums, even stranger names tend to be used in Blackout.
 
Blackout Sign - This sign is an example of what would be hung in Ironhorse at the entrance to Blackout. It has been vandalized and worn by its time in the slums. You get a 24"x28" metal sign made with oil and acrylics paint. Each one will be hand weathered, dinged, chipped, and rusted to give it an authentic look.


Drawing - Done by Angela Fernot. Black and white on an 11x17 page. Fully inked original drawing. Comic style portrait or full shot of you as a character from Blackout.




Sword replica - Sporting an 18' blade, This hero quality PROP replica of Sive's sword is hand crafted by a professional prop builder with years of experience in movies and tv. Sorry for the lack of a picture but each one is hand made per order. You can't buy this in a store! Trust us, it will kick ass!

story:
Roll up! Roll up!

 

We are raising money to print a high quality, tabloid-sized newspaper, chock full with comics by artists from all over the world. These contributions aren’t your usual superhero fare – they’re specially commissioned works of underground, alternative and small-press storytellers, spinning yarns of sad theatre performers, blackmailed entertainers, plane crashes, wrestling matches gone wrong, flatulent stand-ups, persecuted human statutes and of four eyed-wonders – plus a whole lot more besides! If this sounds like the kind of thing you’d like, READ ON!

 

Who’s in it?

 

The Sorry Entertainer features the work of…

 

The Dynamic Duo: Messrs Andrew Cheverton and Rol Hirst

The legendary Lord Brad Foster

The ineffable Master Christopher Fairless

Mr Dangerous himself, David Ziggy Greene

The mysterious Dr Thom Ferrier

The curious case of Jarod Rosello

The wistful Master Jason Martin

The card-shark stylings of Messrs Jordan Collver and Richard Worth

New York’s finest tumbler, Miss Lauren Barnett

Florida’s own Ringmasters, Messrs Loren Knack and Ron McVicar

Argentinian mastermind, Loris Z

The stage-ready Mr Matt Reichmann

The ever-suffering Master Nick Soucek

The despairing President Noah Van Sciver

Buskin’ Paddy Lynch

The Inky Devil, Robert Malkin

The excitable Mr Peter Batchelor

Master of Northern wit and ice-cream salesman, Rob Jackson

Diarist and humourist, Mr Sam Spina

…and Simon ‘just whose idea was this anyway?’ Moreton

 

Why on earth are we doing it?

 

Quite simply, we want to produce something that is at once disposable and essential, tactile and unique. We want to make something fun, something entertaining, and something that we can pass around the cities in which we live, proud of the fact that we made it. We also want:

 

-         to take control of the way publishing happens for people like us who can’t always get a look in with bigger publishers.

-         to help unpublished artists get together and have a chance for exposure.

-         to give people who aren’t always into comics a change to see what’s happening and to get their hands on something entertaining, inky and wonderful.

 

What we need and what YOU get

 

We are fundraising to cover the printing and distribution costs for 500 copies of this newspaper.  The problem is, honestly, we don’t have the resources to do this on our own, and that’s why we’re reaching out to you lovely people. The money won’t line our pockets. There will be no profit if this is successful, because the total amount will only just cover our costs. That said, if we ARE wildly successful, we’ll just get more copies printed! How’s that?

 

So, depending on how much you donate, you can get your hands on:

 

-         minicomics from the contributors

-         copies of the newspaper itself

-         your name in the paper

-         original artwork from the anthology

 

Have a look on the right hand side of the page for more details about these perks.


PLEASE NOTE: only donations made before 23:59 on Sunday 8th May will be eligible to have their 'name in the paper'. This is because we have had to move our printing deadline forward, and the paper will need to be completed by this date.

However, new perks will appear on Monday 9th May for the last week of the campaign - so you can still help out and make a difference!

Why do I get so many copies?

 

We send you more than one copy of the anthology if you donate more, because we want it to get our there into the world That’s right: they are yours to do with as you please – take them to a bus stop, leave some in a shop, share it at school, sneak it onto shelves in libraries, wrap presents up in it, make a mural, hand it out to strangers, flog ‘em for pennies down the arcades. Anything! We just want the Sorry Entertainer to have a life of its own to surprise, entertain and delight strangers all over the world.

 

What else can you do?

 

That’s up to you – but we would love it if you could spread this URL all over twitter, tumblr, the internet, at home, email, facebook – anywhere and everywhere! Even if you aren’t able to donate, DO think about who you know that might be able to. Got a friend who likes comics? Get them involved. Is your neighbour a multi-millionaire newsprint enthusiast? Tell them! Please, spread the word – and we’ll love you forever.

 

At the end of the day, we just want to get the work of these artists out to you – the lovely public – to show you just what amazing stuff people are getting up to in the world of comics. We think comics are awesome, the contributors are awesome, and frankly, so are you for reading this far...



Simon and Nick, Bristol, April 2011
story_txt:
Roll up! Roll up!
 
We are raising money to print a high quality, tabloid-sized
newspaper, chock full with comics by artists from all over the world. These
contributions aren’t your usual superhero fare – they’re specially commissioned works of underground, alternative and
small-press storytellers, spinning yarns of sad theatre performers, blackmailed
entertainers, plane crashes, wrestling matches gone wrong, flatulent stand-ups,
persecuted human statutes and of four eyed-wonders – plus a whole lot more
besides! If this sounds like the kind of thing you’d like, READ ON!
 
Who’s in it?
 
The Sorry Entertainer features the work of…
 
The Dynamic Duo: Messrs Andrew Cheverton and Rol Hirst
The legendary Lord Brad Foster
The ineffable Master Christopher Fairless
Mr Dangerous himself, David Ziggy Greene
The mysterious Dr Thom Ferrier
The curious case of Jarod Rosello
The wistful Master Jason Martin
The card-shark stylings of Messrs Jordan Collver and Richard
Worth
New York’s finest tumbler, Miss Lauren Barnett
Florida’s own Ringmasters, Messrs Loren Knack and Ron
McVicar
Argentinian mastermind, Loris Z
The stage-ready Mr Matt Reichmann
The ever-suffering Master Nick Soucek
The despairing President Noah Van Sciver
Buskin’ Paddy Lynch
The Inky Devil, Robert MalkinThe excitable Mr Peter Batchelor
Master of Northern wit and ice-cream salesman, Rob Jackson
Diarist and humourist, Mr Sam Spina
…and Simon ‘just whose idea was this anyway?’ Moreton
 
Why on earth are we doing it?
 
Quite simply, we want to produce something that is at once
disposable and essential, tactile and unique. We want to make something fun,
something entertaining, and something that we can pass around the cities in
which we live, proud of the fact that we made it. We also want:
 
-        
to take control of the way publishing happens for people like
us who can’t always get a look in with bigger publishers. 
-        
to help unpublished artists get together and have a chance for
exposure. 
-        
to give people who aren’t always into comics a change to see
what’s happening and to get their hands on something entertaining, inky and
wonderful.
 
What we need and what YOU get
 
We are fundraising to cover the printing and distribution
costs for 500 copies of this newspaper. 
The problem is, honestly, we don’t have the resources to do this on our
own, and that’s why we’re reaching out to you lovely people. The money won’t
line our pockets. There will be no profit if this is successful, because the
total amount will only just cover our costs. That said, if we ARE wildly
successful, we’ll just get more copies printed! How’s that?
 
So, depending on how much you donate, you can get your hands
on:
 
-        
minicomics from the contributors
-        
copies of the newspaper itself
-        
your name in the paper
-        
original artwork from the anthology
 
Have a look on the right hand side of the page for more
details about these perks.
PLEASE NOTE: only donations made before 23:59 on Sunday 8th May will be eligible to have their 'name in the paper'. This is because we have had to move our printing deadline forward, and the paper will need to be completed by this date. However, new perks will appear on Monday 9th May for the last week of the campaign - so you can still help out and make a difference! 
Why do I get so many copies?
 
We send you more than one copy of the anthology if you
donate more, because we want it to get our there into the world That’s right:
they are yours to do with as you please – take them to a bus stop, leave some
in a shop, share it at school, sneak it onto shelves in libraries, wrap
presents up in it, make a mural, hand it out to strangers, flog ‘em for pennies
down the arcades. Anything! We just want the Sorry Entertainer to have a life
of its own to surprise, entertain and delight strangers all over the world. 
 
What else can you do?
 
That’s up to you – but we would love it if you could spread
this URL all over twitter, tumblr, the internet, at home, email, facebook –
anywhere and everywhere! Even if you aren’t able to donate, DO think about who
you know that might be able to. Got a friend who likes comics? Get them
involved. Is your neighbour a multi-millionaire newsprint enthusiast? Tell
them! Please, spread the word – and we’ll love you forever.
 
At the end of the day, we just want to get the work of these
artists out to you – the lovely public – to show you just what amazing stuff
people are getting up to in the world of comics. We think comics are awesome,
the contributors are awesome, and frankly, so are you for reading this far...
Simon and Nick, Bristol, April 2011

story:
Autogen is a motion comic about a young man trying to make a difference. It's centered around the question "What would you do?". See the rise and fall of a power fantasy!


What is this Campaign?


This is the Indiegogo campaign for Autogen, a Youtube based motion comic. We are here in hopes of raising the funds we need to finish the first season of this ongoing series. The first season will include 9 animated Episodes, dubbed in 2 languages, each with a runtime of ~10 minutes.
Our goal is to finish Autogen season 1 and start releasing the series early 2014.

Autogen will be released on Youtube and all episodes will be watchable for free by everyone!
So you don't "need" the DVD to watch the end result of this campaign!

Story

Autogen is a youtube-based motion comic about a young man trying to make a difference.

As the writer of the project my main goal for Autogen is to tell a satisfying story about the characters and the challenges he has to overcome. He is struggling to do whats right in an ignorant place and will often be faced with difficult choices with no clear right or wrong answer. There are many important aspects to this, such as the struggles he discovers, as well as the complications of maintaining relationships with your piers while leaving your normal life behind.

When will you lose your touch with reality while you try to become something bigger than just the guy next door.
How will you act when times get rough?

My intention is to make Autogen a story that is as much about growing up and figuring out how to survive in this boring world as a dreamer and figuring out who you really are as a person as about the spark in all of us to do the right thing, no matter the consequences.

Autogen started out as a autobiographical fiction in 2009, it took a lot of key moments of my own life and I have woven it into a compelling Super Hero story.
Remember all the times you regret not doing something that was right or important?
I want to try to motivate the audience to make a difference in real life, take their chances and to show them that it's worth it.


What's the money for?


Currently we have drawn 6 episodes of Autogen.
The first season contains 9 episodes and the money is for these last 3 episodes.

It costs us about 840€($1160) to produce one episode.
(4 pictures=70 Euro, there are about 48 pictures per episode and we want to ramp it up a bit for the finale of season one)

So it's 3000€ for Drawing the rest.
I do the post production like the animations and sound design all by myself, so I can keep it fairly low-costed.

The remaining 1500€ are for promotional material, to give the voice actors a little bonus and of course to produce the rewards for this campaign.


The Rewards


We decided that we want to make YOU a big part of Autogen, so besides the 2 entry level rewards("Make a difference" and "Here to Stay"), there are a lot of opportunities to be IN the comic.


  • Collect them all! 15€/$20 - With this perk you will get a set of 8 limited season one collectible cards, featuring the main characters and key moments of the story.

  • Season 1 DVD 35€/$46 - This will give you the full season one of Autogen together with all the trailers, making of's and behind the scenes. As a Bonus it will feature a short story episode only available on this dvd!
    Please be aware, that the DVD's will be shipped when the last episode is about to air!



Be in the Comic: - with "The crowd goes nuts!" "YOU!" and "EVIL YOU" we give you the chance to be In the comic.
Either in a crowd shot, or become a reoccurring support character or even become the antagonist of season one!

Attention: We will contact you via the email adress from you paypal account when the campaign has ended, so we can exchange data/photos for the drawings of you!



The ultimate fan package:


"The Big Screen" and "Wear the Cape" - One gives you the chance to get you hands on the leather jacket that we used to create the outfit of the main character.
The other one will be a premiere night in Cologne, Germany, with the opportunity to see the first 2 Episodes in a Cinema and meet the cast and crew.


The Prestige Level:



Be a co-producer!
Be the main-producer!

With these perks you can single-handedly skyrocket the production of Autogen and make the big difference!

Not only will you get prominent display in our studio, your name/company logo will also be shown at the beginning/end of every episode!


Thank you for supporting this project!


And if you can't contribute, please help us spread the word, everytime you tell someone or share it online it really helps our campaign! And check back for news of when the motion comic goes live, along with previews and extra bonus incentives added as we go along!


What happens if we don't reach our goal?

This is a flexible funding, so every dollar helps, even if we don't reach the goal!
Autogen will be finished and released no matter the outcome!
And of course you will get the rewards you spent your money on!
(except for the "The Big Screen" and "The Big Screen++" those 2 will be refunded because it would be too expensive to hold this event without reaching our goal, sorry)


You can contribute via paypal or by card (using paypal - you don't need an account!)

Note all rewards for contributions will be sent out as soon as we can, once the total is reached and we know what is going where. Please allow time to produce sketches, get the comic printed, etc.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I'm Jarod With I'm the illustrator and co-writer of these comics we're trying to make and I'm the one running this campaign. Sean and I are trying to start our own graphic novel making "company" we both write the stories and I draw them. The only problem is we need money to get them published and to do some other things. 

What We Need & What You Get

Okay, so. If you donate to this, the money that you give us will go towards:

  • Publishing the books.
  • Gettin new and improved tools for making them. (Pens, Paper, Ink etc.)
  • Buying a real domain name so our website can actually be taken seriously. (epicomix.com instead of epicomix.co.nr)
  • Setting up online stores for merchandise, if we build up a fanbase.
  • Getting multiple copies of our books to sell at flea markets or stores in our town.

And you can see what kind of stuff you'll recieve if you donate over to the side. 

The Impact

As some of you may be able to tell, comic book stores and creators are slowly disappearing. You'll rarely ever be able to walk down the street to a comic book store and pick up this week's Amazing Spider-Man issue or something. We're just trying to get comics and graphic novels a little bit popular again, and it's always been our dream to be able to have an actual series published. We have multiple sotrylines in the works right now, the first one being Dan Price: Ninja Assassin. You can read more about DPNA at our facebook page or website. 

If you donate you'll be helping us and you'll be able to help provide new and intersting stories to the world :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have no money but still want to help, that's awesome! Feel free to spread this link to your friends or buddies. Sean and I both would greatly appreciate it.

story:
Hello!

My name is Christopher and I’m a graphic designer from the city of Montreal. When I was in elementary school I began writing short stories and reading them to the class. They were usually of mysteries or of the post apocalyptic genre. Now a little bit older, I still possess a love for writing and illustration, and so I've started to write a book about….robots.

It all began when I joined my sisters for a scrapbooking party. No, I was not really down for scrap booking so I started drawing a robot instead. After a while, one of my sister commented on how cool the robot looked. I realized how many other ideas I had for other robotic creations; from there on, I started drawing non stop. Everyday I had new robots in my sketchpad.

I was inspired.

I developed a main character, a villain, an elaborate plotline and of course…a crazy amount of robots. Soon after I started a blog to post the drawings I had done and to give a little background to Neil in Robot City.

The illustrations themselves are black and white, geometric in nature and visually multi layered and complex. This gives a very unique feeling to the robots, landscapes and characters in the story. Everything is first hand drawn piece-by-piece, scanned then placed using Photoshop to compose a final image.

I plan on designing a set of books (small books) each with a few chapters inside. I am already finished the first chapter, and now working on the second and third.

The story so far… Neil in Robot City is about a young boy who is brought to Robot City by his Grandfather, a great inventor with many secrets. Along the way the airship they are traveling in is struck by lightning and Neil is forced to evacuate via an emergency escape pod. He lands in a section of the Forest Zone and beings looking for his grandfathers house. Heeding the last words of his grandfather, Neil looks for the journal bearing a map and the guide to this miraculous place. Soon after, Neil befriends a robot and learns that his grandfather has landed somewhere nearby. Neil sets off bound to overcome obstacles, find his grandfather and solve the mystery of Robot City. 

 

This project means the world to me and I have really put a piece of myself into the creation of the illustrations and the story. It’s a project that is very personal and that is very important to me, and I am determined to see it through to the end. I want to produce something that will inspire my readers and them to create something they are passionate about as well.

With your help and contribution, you will be a constructor in the building and creating process of Neil in Robot City! The funding will be used to cover the costs of new material, proofing, printing and will allow me to work on this project full time. I go through markers for the illustrations extremely quick and I am in dire need of a new sketchbooks (I have resorted to drawing in any corner I can find). However, proofing and printing will be the bulk of my expense as well as my time spent working on this project. Even if I don’t reach my monetary goal, I’m still going to work on Robot City until the story is finished. Every little bit helps so thank you in advance for any contribution.

For helping out, I have come up with some nice perks just to say thank you for your kind donation. It starts off with a simple thank you tweet, moves into a printed copy of the first chapter, then there are posters, robot cards and goes all the way up to having an art book with all the work and history that has gone into crafting Neil in Robot City. 

You can take a look at my blog and follow, make comments or suggestions. I’m always uploading illustrations and an extra piece of the adventure.

http://neilinrobotcity.blogspot.ca/

Also, if you could take the time to fill out the survey to help me decide what the 150th robot should look like, I would much appreciate it.

http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/8B3SQBN

story:
Summary

For millennia, the Sentinels have hunted the vampires with steel and magic. Antonio is the Wind of Fire, the strongest Sentinel of that element, the most powerful spellcaster of his generation. Edgar is a capable Fire Sentinel in his own right, and serves as Antonio's lieutenant. Together, the two of them were chosen for a very special mission: to scout out the vampires' greatest citadel, the Court of Shadows itself, in preparation for the Sentinels' final assault. Their actions that night will set in motion a destructive chain of events that will echo across supernatural society for generations...

The Pact Arcanum Saga is a science fiction vampire epic, crossing genres from urban fantasy to paranormal romance, from space opera to supernatural political thriller.

The Secret Histories - The First Age
The Secret Histories - The Second Age
The Secret Histories - The Third Age

Click to buy the books at Amazon.com!  Amazon.co.uk  Amazon.de  Amazon.ca  BarnesandNoble.com  Kobo.com  AllRomanceEbooks.com  Lulu.com

How did I get into such a weird genre of writing? It was basically a thought experiment. What would you get if a vampire slayer was turned into a vampire, yet recovered his or her soul? How would they function with that level of spiritual dichotomy? How would his or her allies respond to having a vampire in their midst, having known that person previously as a mortal? So I created a story in my mind of how I thought that sequence of events would play out. I added to it over the years, including elements of my favorite science fiction concepts, and added a new parameter: What would happen if everyone in the world found out? Most paranormal novels are based on the supernatural elements being hidden from society as a whole, or they posit wide acceptance and extrapolate what society would look like in response to that knowledge. So what would events look like in that transition period, as civilization moved from treating the supernatural as mere superstition and fantasy, to accepted fact? I would bet there'd be some growing pains.

I played with the various ideas in my head for over a decade, just for fun, but I never intended to write them down. I had always meant to write a novel someday, but I suddenly realized that my work environment was relatively stable, and my free time was only going to decrease in the future. There’s no time like the present. But I hadn’t written anything seriously for years, so I thought I needed to start small, just for practice. And then I sat down and wrote out my playful vampire story. Three months later, I came up for air and had a first draft manuscript in my hands of about 185,000 words (around 760 pages). That manuscript was eventually broken down into two manuscripts and expanded into what became my first two novels, Sunset and Sunrise. That’s glossing over more than a year and a half of editing, of course, but that’s not important. The main thing is, I published the first two novels in early 2011. About six months later, I wrote a direct sequel, Moonlight; a novella, Cathedral of the Sky, to expand on certain aspects of the plot; and finally penned the final book in the series, Starlight, in 2012.


Click to read reviews of the series at Goodreads!

Which brings me to the comic book. I love comic books. I have been collecting them since elementary school, though I haven’t had time recently to read them very often. I thought, why not see if I can adapt the material into something that could be appreciated visually.

So I partnered online with an artist named Jayant Mall, and we created Issue Zero of the Pact Arcanum comic book, starting with the chronologically first scene out of all the books. It was mainly an experiment to see how long it would take, how expensive it would be, and what the issues would be in bringing the story to life.

For the sake of the limitations of the comic book medium, I broke the books down into scenes, and placed them in chronological order, so that the storyline would be simpler, without flashbacks or simultaneous plotlines. Issue Zero is the first chapter of the chronological text.


SAMPLE PAGES:

What We Need & What You Get

Now that Issue Zero is complete, I know the process is too expensive to continue on my own.  I estimate that each issue will cost approximately $2,000 to cover artwork, and another $1,000 to cover printing costs and postage to get the books out to my supporters. As when I started writing, the hardest part of completing such an effort is to get started in the first place.  I've already taken that first step, but I need your help to continue this journey.  Please consider joining me for the next step, and hopefully, we can reach the end of the road together.

The primary goal of this solicitation is to generate donations to fund the artist who will translate my script into art (Jayant Mall, J Labs). I would do it myself if I had the skill, but my gift is in my visualization of the story, and then writing it down. The secondary goal is to fund the cost of printing the comic book into a tangible final form. A tertiary goal is to raise enough extra funds to pay for postage to get it out to my audience. It will be a massive undertaking to complete translation of the entire story into a visual medium, but I'm game if you are.


NOTE:  For taxation purposes, where applicable, the sale value of all tangible products including posters, books and all other merchandise is stated to be $5.00 CAD for each item.

Warning:  This story is intended for an adult audience, due to coarse language, violence, and non-explicit depictions of homosexuality.
story_txt:
Summary
For millennia, the Sentinels have hunted the vampires with steel and 
magic. Antonio is the Wind of Fire, the strongest Sentinel of that 
element, the most powerful spellcaster of his generation. Edgar is a 
capable Fire Sentinel in his own right, and serves as Antonio's 
lieutenant. Together, the two of them were chosen for a very special 
mission: to scout out the vampires' greatest citadel, the Court of 
Shadows itself, in preparation for the Sentinels' final assault. Their 
actions that night will set in motion a destructive chain of events that
 will echo across supernatural society for generations...The Pact Arcanum Saga is a science fiction vampire epic, crossing
 genres from urban fantasy to paranormal romance, from space opera to 
supernatural political thriller. 


The Secret Histories - The First AgeThe Secret Histories - The Second AgeThe Secret Histories - The Third Age


Click to buy the books at Amazon.com!  Amazon.co.uk  Amazon.de  Amazon.ca  BarnesandNoble.com  Kobo.com  AllRomanceEbooks.com  Lulu.com


How did I get into such a weird genre of writing?  It was basically a
 thought experiment.  What would you get if a vampire slayer was turned 
into a vampire, yet recovered his or her soul?  How would they function 
with that level of spiritual dichotomy?  How would his or her allies 
respond to having a vampire in their midst, having known that person 
previously as a mortal?  So I created a story in my mind of how I 
thought that sequence of events would play out.  I added to it over the 
years, including elements of my favorite science fiction concepts, and 
added a new parameter:  What would happen if everyone in the world found
 out?  Most paranormal novels are based on the supernatural elements 
being hidden from society as a whole, or they posit wide acceptance and 
extrapolate what society would look like in response to that knowledge. 
 So what would events look like in that transition period, as 
civilization moved from treating the supernatural as mere superstition 
and fantasy, to accepted fact?  I would bet there'd be some growing 
pains.I played with the various ideas in my head for over a 
decade, just for fun, but I never intended to write them down.  I had 
always meant to write a novel someday, but I suddenly realized that my 
work environment was relatively stable, and my free time was only going 
to decrease in the future.  There’s no time like the present.  But I 
hadn’t written anything seriously for years, so I thought I needed to 
start small, just for practice.  And then I sat down and wrote out my 
playful vampire story.  Three months later, I came up for air and had a 
first draft manuscript in my hands of about 185,000 words (around 760 
pages).  That manuscript was eventually broken down into two manuscripts
 and expanded into what became my first two novels, Sunset and Sunrise.
  That’s glossing over more than a year and a half of editing, of 
course, but that’s not important.  The main thing is, I published the 
first two novels in early 2011.  About six months later, I wrote a 
direct sequel, Moonlight; a novella, Cathedral of the Sky, to expand on certain aspects of the plot; and finally penned the final book in the series, Starlight, in 2012. 

Click to read reviews of the series at Goodreads!

Which brings me to the comic book.  I love comic books.  I have been 
collecting them since elementary school, though I haven’t had time 
recently to read them very often.  I thought, why not see if I can adapt
 the material into something that could be appreciated visually.
So
 I partnered online with an artist named Jayant Mall, and we created 
Issue Zero of the Pact Arcanum comic book, starting with the 
chronologically first scene out of all the books.  It was mainly an 
experiment to see how long it would take, how expensive it would be, and
 what the issues would be in bringing the story to life.
For the sake of the limitations of the comic book medium, I
broke the books down into scenes, and placed them in chronological order, so
that the storyline would be simpler, without flashbacks or simultaneous
plotlines. Issue Zero is the first
chapter of the chronological text.


SAMPLE PAGES:


What We Need & What You GetNow that Issue Zero is complete, I know the process is too expensive 
to 
continue on my own.  I estimate that each issue will cost approximately 
$2,000 to cover artwork, and another $1,000 to cover printing costs and 
postage to get the books out to my supporters. As when I started 
writing, the hardest part of completing such 
an effort is to get started in the first place.  I've already taken that
 first step, but I need your help to continue this journey.  Please 
consider joining me for the next step, and hopefully, we can reach the 
end of the road together.
The primary goal of this solicitation is to generate donations to fund 
the artist who will translate my script into art (Jayant Mall, J Labs). 
 I would do it myself if I had the skill, but my gift is in my 
visualization of the story, and then writing it down.  The secondary 
goal is to fund the cost of printing the comic book into a tangible 
final form.  A tertiary goal is to raise enough extra funds to pay for 
postage to get it out to my audience.  It will be a massive undertaking 
to complete translation of the entire story into a visual medium, but 
I'm game if you are.
NOTE:  For taxation purposes, where applicable, the 
sale value of all tangible products including posters, books and all 
other merchandise is stated to be $5.00 CAD for each item.

 This story is intended for an adult audience, due to coarse language, 
violence, and non-explicit depictions of homosexuality.

story:
Join forces with the Justice League

For the last time this year, we’re mobilizing Justice League Super Heroes, creators and fans into one unstoppable force to fight the hunger crisis. Once again, we’re bringing you a mind-blowing collection of limited edition, one-of-kind stuff. But this time, we'll bring you a brand new set of perks EVERY week! This week, the spotlight is on the Justice League. 

You’re our strongest ally in this fight

Like the Super Heroes of Justice League, each one of you can bring something to this fight. All donations, big or small, go to bringing help and hope to the eight million people still affected by the hunger crisis in the Horn of Africa. Let’s get together and show the world what the power of good looks like.

When you bring the good, we’ll bring the cool stuff

Answer the call today to help take on the hunger crisis. You’ll get comic books, lithographs, props and more from the creators behind Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern, Green Arrow, the Flash, Aquaman and Cyborg. You can only get it right here. Get it before it’s gone, because each hero will only be here for one week.

If you have any questions check out our FAQ and Legal below or email us at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com

Jim Lee and Geoff Johns BBQ

Nope, you’re not dreaming. This could be real life. Spend the day hanging out with Jim Lee and Geoff Johns. 

Jim Lee WCBH Litho

Available only through We Can Be Heroes this original litho also comes with a bonus: Jim Lee’s signature. 

WCBH Hardcover Bundle

Seeing double? Get double the hardcovers with Batman: Earth One and Superman: Earth One. 

Wayne Enterprises Booklets

Start dreaming about your own suit with these Wayne Enterprises Equipment Booklet covers. This perk includes both the Nomex Survival Suit and Grapple Harness and Belt.

Batman’s Bat Belt Dispensers 

Used in the Batman trilogy, these Bat Belt Dispensers were a critical part of Batman’s arsenal. This set of two dummy dispensers measure 4” x 4” – And there’s only one set! 

Justice Dark Vol. 2  

Vampires strike in Justice League Dark Vol. 2: The Books of Magic. Get your copy signed by writer Jeff Lemire and artist Mike Janin. 

Sunday Evening

This copy of Sunday Evening by the Legion of Doom plays off the collective dread of "the Mondays" usually experienced the night before. Get your 18” x 24” digital print signed and numbered by the artist Rey Taira. 

WCBH Litho Bundle

Fourteen (yup 14!) lithos all in one bundle. Share them among friends or keep them for yourself. Either way your whole donation goes to fight the hunger crisis in the Horn of Africa. 

Injustice Ultimate Edition

Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition won’t be out until November. But you can preorder your game here AND get it signed by creator Ed Boon. 

Signed JL of America Vol. 1 

A new Justice League emerges following the events of Throne of Atlantis. Find out how this new team works together in Justice League America Vol. 1. 

Shazam! Vol. 1  Hardcover 

Follow the adventures of Captain Marvel in this hardcover signed by Geoff Johns and Gary Frank. 

Forever Evil #1 Variant Cover

Don’t miss your chance to get the exclusive Forever Evil #1 Variant Cover by David Finch.

SM/WW T-shirt

In this Superman/Wonder Woman t-shirt you can be unstoppable too. Designed by Tony Daniels.

This campaign badge is only available right here. Right-click the image and select Save As, or just drag it to your desktop.

Post it to Facebook, your blog or anywhere you'd like to let the world know you've joined forces with Superman and the rest of the Justice League to fight the hunger crisis.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is it true that these perks can’t be shipped internationally?

A: Unfortunately, yes for most perks. We cannot ship any of the physical perks internationally for legal reasons. Digital perks and experience perks are open to international donors. However, experience perks do not include any international travel. Travel will be the sole responsibility of the donor. To find out if a perk you are interested in is available internationally check the perk copy on the right hand of the page. We sincerely appreciate our international fans interest and we encourage them to still donate to We Can Be Heroes.

Q: What T-Shirt size should I order?

A: Our t-shirt sizes are all unisex. Women typically buy a size smaller than usual, while men generally buy the same size or one size larger. We’ve included the chart below to help you out. 

Q:  How often are the perks updated?

A: This campaign is a little different than our past campaign. We’ll be featuring a different member of the Justice League each week and swapping in new perks each week (and keeping a couple favorites throughout). Best way to know when new perks are out is to follow us @DCComics on Twitter and DC Comics on Facebook.  

Q:  Where does my donation go?

A: All donations are divided between our three nonprofit partners: International Rescue Committee, Mercy Corps and Save the Children to help fund their efforts on the ground in the Horn of Africa. Every donation, no matter how small, helps.

Q:  Can I donate more than once?

A: Yes. You can donate a thousand times. Not only will you get a cool new perk each time but also you will help bring hope to the men, women and children in the Horn of Africa. However, each time you donate you will have to make a separate donor transaction. 

Q:  I put in the wrong address/zipcode/tshirt size. What now?

A: We're happy to help with this! Email us at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com. 

Q:  I'm super excited about my new variant cover! How will it be shipped?

A: Great question. We ship our books in MODERN AGE Mailer Comic Book Mailers (image below). They are constructed of high quality corrugated cardboard and can hold up to 12 comics.

Q:  What if I have more questions?

A: We would love to hear from you. If you have questions related to the perks or a donation please feel free to email us at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com. If you just have a general comment on the campaign please feel free to express yourself on our Indiegogo comment page. 

RULES & RESTRICTIONS

ALL PERKS: The perks above are subject to availability onwww.indiegogo.com/at/wecanbeheroesfrom Tuesday, 9/17/13 at 9:00:00 a.m. ET/6:00:00 a.m. PT through Monday, 10/28/13 at 11:59:59 a.m. ET/8:59:59 p.m. PT. All applicable Warner Bros. rules and regulations apply. Perks international availability vary. Please read the perk descriptions carefully to see which are available internationally. Perks that are marked AVAILABLE INTERNATIONALLY are available worldwide, except where prohibited by law. No perks provide international travel and DC Entertainment will not be responsible for any international travel. Only perks explicitly marked AVAILABLE INTERNATIONALLY will be available internationally. DC Entertainment attests that all signatures on We Can Be Heroes product offerings are authentic.

5 DIGITAL COMICS: This perk requires the donor to be registered (or to register) with comiXology. Redemption is subject to comiXology's Terms of Use. Downloads must be completed by 12/31/13.

1-YEAR PRINT SUBSCRIPTION: This perk requires the donor to be registered (or register) with DCComics.com. Subscription is subject to DC Comics Terms of Use. If the subscription title is cancelled, the remainder of the subscription will be fulfilled with an age appropriate title to be selected by DC Comics in its sole good faith discretion. Redemption must be completed by 12/31/13.

JIM LEE AND GEOFF JOHNS BBQ: This perk does not include transportation. Date, time and location of the lunch is subject to Geoff Johns and Jim Lee’s availability. Donor and one (1) friend will attend the BBQ. The available dates for the BBQ will be provided to the donor for selection and confirmation.

DAMAGED OR MISSING PERK INSURANCE CLAIMS (as applicable)

Specific to Perks that are shipped via USPS, the recipient of an insured WE CAN BE HEROES-specific Perk must file notice of non-delivery or damage with U-PIC within ninety (90) days from the date of shipment for United States Post Office Shipments. There is a twenty-one (21) day waiting period before the Insured may file a notice of non-delivery to U-PIC for packages shipped domestic via the United States Post Office. There is a forty-five (45) day waiting period for packages shipped international via the United States Post Office before the Insured may file a notice of non-delivery with U-PIC. APO/FPO shipments require a forty-five (45) day waiting period before filing a notice of non-delivery with U-PIC. No claims will be honored if filed after the 90 day expiration period. The insured will submit completed Endicia claim form, copy of the original invoice to the consignee, signed and dated statement from the consignee, proof of damage if applicable and any additional documentation requested to substantiate loss. Shipping costs must be included in the declared value in order to be paid with claim. Handling fees and insurance fees are excluded from coverage. All damaged property for which payment (not repair costs), or replacement has been made, must, on request, be returned to Underwriters. Failure to hold the damaged property until the claim has reached a resolution will result in the denial of the claim. In the event it is necessary to file a claim, you may e-mail for additional information and instructions at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com. In the Subject field, type “WCBH3 Request for Perk Insurance Claim”

Specific to Perks that are shipped via UPS, subject to the claim-related terms and conditions of United Parcel Service as disclosed on their website. Visit: http://www.ups.com/content/us/en/resources/serv....

™ & © 2013 DC Comics. All rights reserved.

TM & © 2013 WARNER BROS. ENTERTAINMENT INC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

story:
Our Story

Threshold Comics was created in spring of 2011 as an independent publishing company to produce, distribute and market comic books and graphic novels.  The mission of Threshold Comics is to create a universe unique and distinct in its vision of comic book storytelling and the way in which comic books are created and sold.  The founders of Threshold Comics believe in the power of storytelling to transport a reader to an entirely new realm of imagination and seek to create an environment where individuals can develop and nurture their creations and present them to fans eager to read new and challenging material.

 

Both Michael and George are life long fans of comic books and superheroes and would love nothing more than to create a universe where their stories may be enjoyed and appreciated by fans who share their love of comics.

The Impact

The founders of Threshold Comics have made a commitment to produce a twelve month run of their flagship comic book "Lost Angels" and hope that this will be the first of many additional titles to come.  We wish to raise funds to offset production and printing costs, which can be significant.  The completed script as well as a large amount of artwork has already been completed, and we have come to this site for the opportunity to not only raise funding to continue the production process, but also as a way to connect with other writers and artists within the independent comic book publishing community, as well as to connect with other free thinking and innovative minded people.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The $2500 amount will cover the entire cost to produce a single months issue, including salary to the interior artist, payments to the artist coloring the issue, and to the artist designing and illustrating the cover.  Printing costs and promotion of the issue will come from Threshold itself. 

 

In order to encourage support for this endeavor, we have come up with a number of incentives:

 

Any donation of $1 up to $9.99 will get you a dollar for dollar credit good for anything available for purchase on our website.  For example, if you donate $8 you will recieve a credit good for $8 worth of merchandise from our website.  It's like getting something for next to nothing. Nice

 

Any donation of $10 or more, and you will get a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer.

 

Any donation of $25 or more and you will recieve a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer and with a limited addition variant cover. Cool!

 

Any donation of $50 or more and you will recieve a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer and artist with the limited addition variant cover embossed with a very limited chromium cover.  So Rare!

 

Any donation of $100 or more and you will recieve the entire run of the first story arc to "Lost Angels" Spear of Destiny, or the first three issues of "Lost Angels" with the limited addition variant cover embossed with the chromium finish as well as a listing on the thank you page in one of the issues.  Whichever you choose, all issues will be signed by the writer.

 

Any donation of $250 or more and you will be granted comic book Immortality!!!  Why buy the book, when you can be a part of the Threshold Universe!  For a $250 or more donation our artist will take your likeness from photos that you provide, and we will make you a character in the Threshold Universe, with a guarantee of an appearance in no less than 3 separate issues.  How's that for something to share with others around the watercooler on Monday morning?  Can't convince your friends that it's really you?  No worries, we will name the character after you, at no extra charge!  (Unless of course your name is Clark Kent or Bruce Wayne, in which case we may have to take some artistic liberties.)  There are a limited number of these incentives available so please don't delay. Some release of rights of your image to Threshold Publishing is needed for this.

 

Well that is basically it...thank you so much for taking the time to share our vision.  More information can be found on our website.  Thanks so much for your support!

 

Michael Reyes and George Zaragoza

The founders of Threshold Comics have made a commitment to produce a twelve month run of their flagship comic book "Lost Angels" and hope that this will be the first of many additional titles to come.  We wish to raise funds to offset production and printing costs, which can be significant.  The completed script as well as a large amount of artwork has already been completed, and we have come to this site for the opportunity to not only raise funding to continue the production process, but also as a way to connect with other writers and artists within the independent comic book publishing community, as well as to connect with other free thinking and innovative minded people.
 
What We Need & What You Get
 
The $2500 amount will cover the entire cost to produce a single months issue, including salary to the interior artist, payments to the artist coloring the issue, and to the artist designing and illustrating the cover.  Printing costs and promotion of the issue will come from Threshold itself.  
 
In order to encourage support for this endeavor, we have come up with a number of incentives:
 
Any donation of $1 up to $9.99 will get you a dollar for dollar credit good for anything available for purchase on our website.  For example, if you donate $8 you will recieve a credit good for $8 worth of merchandise from our website.  It's like getting something for next to nothing. Nice
 
Any donation of $10 or more, and you will get a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer.
 
Any donation of $25 or more and you will recieve a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer and with a limited addition variant cover. Cool!
 
Any donation of $50 or more and you will recieve a #1 issue of our premiere comic book "Lost Angels" signed by the writer and artist with the limited addition variant cover embossed with a very limited chromium cover.  So Rare!
 
Any donation of $100 or more and you will recieve the entire run of the first story arc to "Lost Angels" Spear of Destiny, or the first three issues of "Lost Angels" with the limited addition variant cover embossed with the chromium finish as well as a listing on the thank you page in one of the issues.  Whichever you choose, all issues will be signed by the writer.
 
Any donation of $250 or more and you will be granted comic book Immortality!!!  Why buy the book, when you can be a part of the Threshold Universe!  For a $250 or more donation our artist will take your likeness from photos that you provide, and we will make you a character in the Threshold Universe, with a guarantee of an appearance in no less than 3 separate issues.  How's that for something to share with others around the watercooler on Monday morning?  Can't convince your friends that it's really you?  No worries, we will name the character after you, at no extra charge!  (Unless of course your name is Clark Kent or Bruce Wayne, in which case we may have to take some artistic liberties.)  There are a limited number of these incentives available so please don't delay. Some release of rights of your image to Threshold Publishing is needed for this.
 
Well that is basically it...thank you so much for taking the time to share our vision.  More information can be found on our website.  Thanks so much for your support!
 
Michael Reyes and George Zaragoza

story:
I'm really glad that you came across our campaign.

We are Team Exoro Choice. We are a group of talented and creative individuals. Our goal is to help each other improve our skills and along the way we hope to achieve our dreams.

Check out our profiles and portfolio. We enjoy putting 100% effort into each of our creations. We believe a masterpiece can be achieved but only with great effort and your support. Our efforts and passion for art pushes us to expand, and participate in many events. We will be publishing and launching our first comics in April, 2012. We will also be selling and distributing internationally from our website.

On this regard, we are cordially inviting everyone to be part of this project by being one of the sponsors, your company, group, or name will be included and advertised to avid comic fans out there through our printed comics, website, as well as on our Facebook fan page.

We want to show you a pure, high-fictional story with great quality output that can meet and exceed your expectations. We will create more chapters of our story soon. Imagine the world behind our creations, where dragons, and magical powers exist! This is a one of a kind story that you will never forget. 

Short Summary

Long ago, dragons and humans coexisted  in harmony. However, a conflict ensued between the two races and eventually war erupted. Centuries later, the battle is still being fought. For Halbert Viedelman, reading in the library is more important than fighting. Despite his desire for a peaceful life, Hal is forced by his father to bring the family sword and join the war.

As soon as he embarks on his journey, he stumbles upon a cursed dragon named Howard. To his utmost surprise, Howard grants him a Dragon Tear, a gift that dragons used to give to the humans long ago before the war started. With no real desire to battle, how will Hal use the gift given to him to stop the war?

Dragon Tears Main Characters

Halbert Viedelman

Hal is the youngest son of the famous Viedelman family. He loves reading so much and is usually found in the library of their mansion. However, because their family is known for saving the people from dragons, Hal  is forced by his father to help stop the war. He is banned from every library until the war is over. Hal gets easily nervous thanks to his vivid imagination.

Nidelle Geard

Nidelle travels from different villages to help spread knowledge on curing different wounds and diseases. Her ancestor once owned a dragon tear and it helped them learnways to cure using different flowers and plants. She volunteers to helpothers and is rather strict when it comes to health. Thanks to the stories that her family told her, she is able to guide and help Hal decide on a way to use the dragon tear.

Howard

Due to a curse, Howard  is currently in a small form which stops him from using all of his powers. He can’t remember who cursed him and so he is now travelling with Hal in hope of getting back his real form and power. Like Hal, he has no affinity with the on-going war and would rather travel to different places than fight humans.

Dragon Tears Comic Preview

What We Need & What You Get

As an independent publisher, printing of high quality comics is very financially challenging. We cannot afford to fund it ourselves. We hope our artworks and creations will inspire you to help us. We dedicate a lot of our time to creating this masterpiece; a graphic novel to be enjoyed by everyone.

Your company, group, or name will be included and advertised to comic fans  through our printed comics, website, and Facebook fan page.

So what's the deal?

Every perk you get from us is a sign of our hard work, effort and dedication to  this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help us with our monetary issues, you can still help us by sharing this campaign with others. We will appreciate it if you can spread this campaign through word of mouth, Facebook, Twitter, or other social sites.  We want you to be part of this project and make it happen! Thank you!

story:
AVE - nice to meet you. La nuova antologia di Attaccapanni Press, che vi ha stregato con Grimorio e affascinato con Melagrana, stavolta vi porta vicino a personaggi di ogni genere, in ambientazioni tra le più varie, affrontando un tema senza tempo: l'incontro.

Il primo incontro. L'ultimo incontro. L'incontro fatale, l'incontro voluto dal fato. 12 autori vi porteranno attraverso questi ed altri intrecci, in 10 storie da 10 pagine, curate da Laura Guglielmo con l'assistenza di Ariel Vittori e della Social Media Manager, Laura Vivacqua.

I fumetti e gli autori che vi delizieranno sono:

Mala di Noemi De Maio (NuNaMe, Grimorio)

Cookie di Monica Sangermano (Jiltie Book, Grimorio)

Xenia e Sigfried scritto da Sara Silvera Darnich (esordiente) e disegnato da Laura Guglielmo (Grimorio, Supergum)

Pattugliando il Corpo Umano di Francesco Guarnaccia (From Here to Eternity, Cavalier Inserviente)

Bubbled di Laura Vivacqua (Grimorio, Metamorfosi)

Poaqui di Ste Tirasso (Ricomincia da Qui)

Melvina di Rachele Aragno (Owlgirls, Rumble)

Tamashii scritto da Brian Freschi (Le Piccole Morti, Gli Anni che Restano) e disegnato da Stefano Martinuz (Rebirth, Costellarium)

Ortles di Martina Naldi (La Cerimonia del Demone Rosso, Gatacornia)

Temperatura scritto da Laura Guglielmo e disegnato da Ariel Vittori (Little Waiting, Oltregomma)

132 pagine impreziosite da una copertina doppia di Rita Petruccioli (Frantumi), in brossurato 16x23. Cosa chiedere di più? Tutto quello che vedete tra i perk disponibili, ecco cosa!

Ave potrà essere spedito a casa vostra con l'aggiunta del perk SHIPPING oppure potrete ritirarlo a Lucca Comics&Games in Self Area!

 

[ENG] AVE - nice to meet you. Attaccapanni Press' new Anthology: we have enchanted you with Grimorio, enamoured you with Melagrana, and this time we'll be bringing you close to many different characters in so many varied settings, dealing with a timeless theme: the encounter.

First meeting. The last. A fatal meeting or a fateful one. 12 authors will bring you through this and other encounters with 10 stories, 10 pages each. Curated by Laura Guglielmo with assistant editor Ariel Vittori and our Social Media Manager, Laura Vivacqua.

The comics and authors that will delight you, move you, scare you are:

Mala by Noemi De Maio (NuNaMe, Grimorio)

Cookie by Monica Sangermano (Jiltie Book, Grimorio)

Xenia e Sigfried written by Sara Silvera Darnich (esordiente) and drawn by Laura Guglielmo (Grimorio, Supergum)

Pattugliando il Corpo Umano by Francesco Guarnaccia (From Here to Eternity, Cavalier Inserviente)

Bubbled by Laura Vivacqua (Grimorio, Metamorfosi)

Poaqui by Ste Tirasso (Ricomincia da Qui)

Melvina by Rachele Aragno (Owlgirls, Rumble)

Tamashii written by Brian Freschi (Le Piccole Morti, Gli Anni che Restano) and drawn by Stefano Martinuz (Rebirth, Costellarium)

Ortles by Martina Naldi (La Cerimonia del Demone Rosso, Gatacornia)

Temperatura written by Laura Guglielmo and drawn by Ariel Vittori (Little Waiting, Oltregomma)

132 pages with a wonderful wraparound cover by Rita Petruccioli (Frantumi), soft cover 16x23 cm. What more to ask for? Why, all of our wonderful perks you can check out here!

You may get Ave shipped to you by getting the perk 'SHIPPING' or you may pick it up at Lucca Comics&Games at our booth in Self Area!

[The physical edition of the book is in ITALIAN ONLY, but the PDF is available in English]

[ITA] Oltre al 10% destinato a tasse di Indiegogo e bancarie (€420 circa), tutto il resto della cifra richiesta servirà a stampare il libro (€1600) e realizzare i bellissimi perk (€930), più il necessario a pagare spese di stand per le fiere (€470), promozionali per la campagna e amministrative per l'associazione (€880). 

[ENG] Aside from the 10% for Indiegogo and bank fees (€420), the rest of the funds will be needed to actually print the book (€1600) produce the amazing perks (€930), convention booths (€470), and promotional plus administration expenses to keep Attaccapanni going (€880). 

[ITA] Questo è il terzo crowdfunding di Attaccapanni Press. L'anno scorso,  Grimorio ha concluso la campagna a luglio e per Dicembre tutti i nostri backer avevano il magico tomo in mano. Melagrana che ha ricevuto con successo i suoi fondi ad aprile, è stato stampato, in attesa di essere consegnato a Treviso e Lucca, e di essere spedito prima di Novembre: l'unico motivo per cui non è stato già consegnato è che vogliamo darvi l'occasione di risparmiare sulle spese di spedizione, e ricevere Ave assieme a Melagrana!

Sappiamo cosa stiamo facendo, e Ave è già pronto e impaginato: aspetta solo voi per essere realtà. 

[ENG] This is Attaccapanni Press' third campaign on Indiegogo. Grimorio, in 2016, was funded in July, and by December everyone had their enchanted books. Melagrana was funded this spring and the book has been printed already, waiting to be picked up at conventions and sent to your homes before November: and we're only holding off so that those of you who want AVE too, may have them shipped together!

We know what we're doing, and the whole book is done, just waiting for you. 

 

[IT] Potete aiutare AVE a diventare realtà facendo sì che incontri più persone possibile: condividete la pagina della campagna sui vostri social media, parlatene con i vostri amici, familiari, colleghi! Ve ne saremo infinitamente grati.

Facebook: facebook.com/attaccapanni.press

Website/Tumblr: attaccapannipress.tumblr.com

Twitter: @grimorio_comic

Instagram: @attaccapanni.press

[ENG] You can help make AVE a reality by making it meet with people you know: talk about it with your coworkers, during your book club, or even easier... share this page on your social media! We'll be so very grateful. 

Thanks to our media partner:

story:
UPDATE: Much thanks to everyone for support! The motion comic is released now:

 

 

My name is Nikolai Mamashev, I am animation artist. I would like to produce an open-source motion comic, based on the work by David Revoy - «Pepper & Carrot». The result is going to be published for free under the terms of Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike license, together with all sources (much like as all open-movies).

 

 

 

This work is going to be done exclusively with free and open-source software - namely Krita and Blender. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

«Pepper & Carrot» webcomic is originally created by French independent artist David Revoy. The story is concentrated around "Pepper" - a young witch - and her cat "Carrot". They live in a fun fantasy universe made of potions, magic and creatures. It's a comedy/humor webcomic suited for any audience. No mature content, no violence.

 

 

 

DISCLAIMER: This campaign is collecting funds exclusively for my
(Nikolai Mamashev) work on production of motion-comic. Although
original author of the web-comic (David Revoy) has acclaimed the
initiative of this campaign, he is not involved in production process
of motion comic and does not receive/shares any revenues collected
here. The name of David Revoy on images are specified for attribution
purposes (as requirement of license), but not as sign of affiliation.
You can support the work of David Revoy on production of original
web-comic through his Patreon page.

 

 

A motion comic is a form of animation combining elements of print comics books, animation, music, sound and special VFX. Unlike an usual animation film work, motion comics takes less time to produce, allowing to deliver alive and thrilling stories in a short time.

 

 

 

 

 

 

The money collected from this campaign will go for production of one motion comic video, based on the «The Potion Contest» episode (this is one of my favorite ones). You can find it here — http://www.peppercarrot.com/en/article271/episode-6-the-potion-contest.

 

The production process will include following steps:

 

- Original webcomic image is separated into individual parts. Missing segments (overlapping areas, extended frames, etc.) are painted and reconstructed by hand;

Original webcomic image by David Revoy

 

 

 

 

Separated into individual parts

 

 

 

- The parts composed together in Blender. Here goes simulation setup and VFX, rigs for characters and environments;

 

 

- The parts are animated in Blender;

 

 

- The ready animated shots are rendered and stitched together in Blender's Video Sequence Editor, combining together with music and voice. Here also goes sound design works.

 

 

 

 

I am a freelance artist and within the outlined budget of this campaign I will be able to dedicate full-time schedule to this production. I have a skills in painting, cutout animation and 3D modeling. For my daily work I use exclusively free and opensource software (Krita, MyPaint, Inkscape, Blender). Below you can see some of my works.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I am inviting you to join this campaign and support creation of the first animated comics, based on «Pepper & Carrot» by David Revoy!

story:
I've always been afraid of basements. For me, there are few things more chill-inducing than walking into a stone subterranean enclosure where one's own sanity is locked in a battle of wills with their own eyes and shadowed surroundings. But in a basement, in a dusty box warped by humidity, is where I found New Mutants #1, written by the immensely talented Chris Claremont. This changed my life.


This box was in Gary, Indiana, in my uncle's house. It was the top box out of probably a dozen or so other boxes, all filled with comics collected over the years by my father and his brothers. See, my family took us on annual trips to Gary to visit my dad's family. Gary is a bit rough around the edges, so when the sun set at night, I would tiptoe into the basement, grab armfuls of single issues, and sprint up the stairs, certain that the shadows were trying to suck me back down to that moldy hell. Then I'd sit in the living room and thumb through stacks of comics, wide-eyed and wondering what genius could possibly write such awesome stories with such amazing characters. This is when I'd love to say that I decided to make comics. Alas, not yet.


As long as I can remember, I've written and drawn. I over-wrote book reports in elementary school, much to the chagrin of my teachers. I drew the same Iron Man from the '92 Marvel trading cards probably a dozen times. Poetry in junior high, centering around hazy, evil things bent on corrupting man. Oh, and Excalibur (which I drew piercing a helmet). Sketches of anime characters and Batman in high school. More poetry. Love letters that toed the line between sweet and utterly depressing. Half-finished novels as an adult. Four aborted screenplays. And whatever else I forgot to mention.


But over the past few years, I've had an itch, so to speak. I thought it was to write a novel. My magnum opus. However, it's just not time for that yet. So this year, I sat at my desk (which, until a month ago, was just a pillow with my laptop on it) and wrote an introduction to a comic. Then, I kept writing. And kept writing. Three issues later, and I figured, "Hey, it's probably time to hire an artist."


And here I am now. I need your help. I've finally found my purpose in life, but I can't do it on my own. I'm asking you ladies and gentlemen to help me hire an artist to turn my words, emotions, loves, and fears into pictures. My goal is to raise enough to completely finish the first issue. In September, I'm going to print whatever I can and take it to the Baltimore Comic Convention to pass around. Hopefully, I can meet some editors and other creative folk that I can network with. Once the issue is complete, I will pitch it to publishers such as Image, IDW, and Vertigo, then possibly release it as a webcomic. Either way, I need to release the contents of this dusty box I call a brain. 


My artist, JC Grande, is a spectacular artist and has been published. My cost to him is $90 per page, penciled, inked, colored, and lettered. Full service for an amazing price. The first issue is 24 pages, but I am padding by two pages in case my script calls for more room. That comes out to $2340. If I don't reach my goal, I'll figure out something. This is important to me, so I appreciate each and every dollar that comes my way.


Seriously, any little bit will help. I won't go so far as to say this will change your life, but I'm hoping to shine a bit of light on those gray areas of society. Please, share this on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, MySpace, Yelp, and your local Yellow Pages, because Dominic King and Natalie Guerra can't handle this alone. After Dominic questions what most would call a "miracle," and Natalie experiences one of the worst tragedies a single parent can imagine, the ex-soldier and current police officer strike an uneasy alliance to find and rescue Natalie's daughter. Only, an ancient evil is rising. An evil that challenges everything we've ever thought about living in "modern" times by manipulating mankind into tearing itself apart. Dominic and Natalie will experience pain and loss, but they must venture into the deepest recesses of sin to save mankind from itself. Because when there's no light, try hard enough and one can find comfort in The Blessed Dark.


For those interested in JC Grande, you can find his work here!


DeviantArt Gallery       http://johnnymorbius.deviantart.com

Twitter                        @jcgrandeart

Facebook                   J.C. Grande

Blog                           jcgrande.blogspot.com

story:
ABOUT THE STORY

TAINTED tells the story of cheerleader Creek Wilden, whose life is dramatically changed when she loses the love her life Reid Williams in a bus crash. 

Creek falls into depression but something within her genetic makeup awakens an ability to see a hidden society known as the Viciat. The Viciat has been around for thousands of years and they have been placed in positions of power throughout the world. 

Throughout the course of the epic 5-issue series you will learn their secrets, Creek's connection to them and the underground movement known as the Julio Cross that has been setup to stop the Viciat.

In Issue One, you will follow Creek's story as she deals with the fallout of losing her first love, a peak inside the Viciat and an introduction to Octavius Farici, Creek's mentor.

SAMPLE PAGES OF ISSUE ONE

PAGE 3

 PAGE 4​

PAGE 5

PAGE 6

----------------------------------------------------------

SAMPLES FROM ISSUE TWO

PAGE 3

PAGE 11

ORIGINS OF THE BOOK

The first issue in a five issue series has been almost 2 years in the making. Creek has gone through many iterations from a variety of different artists., One of our later stretch goals will be to release a gallery book focusing on the evolution of Creek.

First shot of Creek by Greek artist George Agas

The comic also has a powerful and personal story. I created TAINTED because I wanted to help youth with mental health struggles. I wanted them not to be alone and why not add some fantasy elements to help with the message.

I suffer from Major Depressive Disorder and the past five years it has been getting progressively worse. I lost my job and have been hospitalized over five times. It is a daily struggle to eat and function.

So with my struggle, I decided to write a comic that would show a heroine who can use some of the teachings I have learned and help others who struggle. Young people with anxiety and depression have a harder time overcoming and understand the techniques available. Maybe seeing a hero their age will help with the fight.

ISSUE ONE - PAGE 10

The comic might be about a struggle with mental health but is also a fantasy story about fighting the demons within but also learning to prepare yourself for an unknown future. 

Spider-Man has a tagline "With Great Power, comes Great Responsibility." Creek's tagline is "Even in Darkness, we fight!"

#1 COVERS

SHHH! COVER BY FRANCOISE VALIMORA

ATTITUDE COVER BY DIANA NORIEGA

CHEER COVER BY BILL WALKO

SURVIVOR COVER BY MARC HUIZINGA (RARE)

ISSUE 2 COVERS

FIGHTIN' COVER BY FRANCOISE VALIMORA

PEEKABOO COVER BY ARTIST CB ZANE & COLORIST JOEL CHUA (RARE)

TAINTED: FOREST COVER by Beezzz Studios

PRODUCTION

There have been all sorts of risks and challenges with TAINTED over the course of producing just a first issue. But the first issue is completely finished. The second needs to be printed and shipped. This campaign will cover the cost of printing, shipping, cost overages and fully funding the third issue of the five part series. Each issue will be 24 pages.

TAINTED will be printed on 80lb almost cardstock paper with glorious glossy covers. The art will literally jump off the page it will be so beautiful. This will be a super high-quality comic.

$2800 for printing

$1000 for shipping.

$700 to get #3 started.

Anything over our initial $3800 goal will go back to producing #3.

BELOW IS THE QUALITY OF THE FIRST ISSUE

 

REVIEWS

Comicbookyeti's Matt Ligeti on #1

 https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1325856476/tainted-1-always-keep-fighting/posts/2393978 

Comicbookyeti's Jared Lujan of #2

https://www.comicbookyeti.com/post/tainted-issue-2

Pipedreamcomics critic James Blundell on Tainted 1 &2

 http://pipedreamcomics.co.uk/review-tainted-1-2-eclipse-press/ 

STRETCH GOALS

story:
HI!

Hey everyone! I'm Sevastianos or Sevos or "kner".
I am  an illustrator and love designing characters! I love the art of comics and I thought crowdfunding is a really good way to publish my first one-shot story.


 

DEMON CASTLE

Demon Castle is a project that combines things that I was always passionate about, like monsters castles, and fights and comes in a full-color 52 page comic. The hero decides to kill the demons that represent the 7 deadly sins and free the world from their existense, but in the end he finds out the truth about "evil" in this world!

 

What you get!
 

Well, to make this comic come to life , I could use any help I can find, so even if you can't afford to buy a perk even spreading the word is a big help.

 

Digital Copy
A digital pdf for reading the comic on your computer or on your mobile device!

Signed Comic
 A signed physical copy of the comic.
Size : 17x24 (cm)
52 pages total (full color)
Paperback

 

A5 Print
An A5 print of your choice between the demons and the hero!

         Beelzebub                 Belphegor
 

            Azazel                     Asmodeus
 

          Mammon                    Leviathan
 

             Satan                           Hero
 

A3 cover Print
 An A3 print of the cover of the comic book!


 

Personalized Sketch
 A sketch inside the comic that suits you best and reveals your favorite demon!


IMPORTANT NOTE
When delivery is done in person, shipping cost is refunded.
 

Spreading the word!

A big help to achieve this would be the promotion through your social media. You can always show your support by sharing this campaing wherever you feel like !
Feel free to ask any questions!

You can also find me here Facebook DeviantArt Tumblr Instagram
Or by mail at cnerone21@gmail.com

Thanks for supporting! 

Sevos
