100 copies of On the Morrow: $221.00
Shipping Perks: $30.00+
Indiegogo cut: 4% or 9%
Total: ~$500.00+

 So, with your help and support I’ll be able to get both of these comics printed and ready for conventions this fall! Anything over the funding goal will go towards printing the best-looking books I possibly can.
Also, if we do reach the goal, I will update with additional incentives and bonus perks, which will include commissions, stickers, and even MORE comics! I’ll update on this further if we get closer to funding.
 
Edit: Ohmygoshwereachedthegoal!!!!!!!!!!! You guys are literally AMAZING. OK, so stretch goals? YES.


If we reach $800! Perk levels above and including $15 will ALL get the limited edition print, as well as STICKERS! (images forthcoming) AND a new LIMITED* perk will be added at the $25 level: Avatars! I'll draw you a twitter/tumblr/whatever avatar based on... whatever you want! Want a preview? You can check out my twitter @Tarabba! (*Limited, meaning: 10 only) UPDATE: We did it! Thank you! The new perk has been added! I'll be working on making stickers!!



If we reach $1,000! Puddles will recieve the spot-color treatment!!! I'm kinding of geeking out about this one, it's something I've been toying with doing for some time! The colors would be following the colors on the cover! UPDATE: WOOO!!! It's happened! Spot-color Puddles is GO! Check out the latest update for a preview of what it's going to look like!!!


If we reach $1,200! On the Morrow will get upgraded paper stock and cover stock!!! If we reach this goal, I will also grey tone the comic as well!

Now, onto the perks!


$1 A thank you in the books!


$7 PDF of BOTH comics


$15 Physical Copy of either Puddles or On the Morrow, plus a random "convention sketch", a quick drawing done with pencil and ink based on which book you get.


$25 Physical Copies of Puddles and On the Morrow, PDFs included. (Convention sketch included)


$35 Personalized Commission if you’d rather get a drawing instead of a comic, plus a digital copy of the piece. (5X7, Spot Color, subject matter is up to YOU.)


$45 Physical Copies of Puddles and On the Morrow, PDFs included, a limited edition print (image forthcoming!), plus a convention sketch, and a hand-drawn button pack (4)!


$60 Retail Perk! 5 copies of one book, or a mix of both sent to your comic shop! 


$75 Everything listed above!

 ***All copies of either book will be signed and personalized! If you would like it plain, just let me know :)
 *****Shipping is included for ALL goals for ALL locations.
 
 
[PERK UPDATES!:]
(7/11): Instead of a B&W commissions for the $35 and $75+ level, they will now contain a spot color!! Woo!!
 
 
 
 Any Challenges?
What’s great about this particular project is that both comics are already drawn, so there won’t be a delay in getting the books to the printer! ALSO, if you will be at either TBCC or SPX, you can pick up your copies of the book there! (and I won’t have to ship it to you! Wooo! Chances are though, by that point I won’t have commissions finished, but we’ll see, if you intend on being there, let me know and I can work something out!) Otherwise, all perks will be shipped out by mid October!

 Any other ways to help out?

 I know that money is tight and will always be tight (it’s the reason I’m doing this project) so I absolutely understand if you can’t contribute. However, if you can spread the word that would be amazing and I would be eternally grateful! Twitter, facebook, Google+, tumblr! Whatever you can do, I’d really appreciate it. Thank you!
Be sure to check out the gallery as this campagin goes on! I'll be posting previews throughout!
 
FAQ:
Q: Does the levels above $15 also come with a convention sketch??
A: YES, they do! Silly me forgot to put it in there, and now it won't let me edit it. The only level that does not come with the sketch is the $35 level, because it's a commission level. Thanks!! 
Q: What about shipping? I live outside of the states, can I still get comics?
A: YES! Since the books are relatively small in size and soft covered, I included the shipping within the reward tier regardless of where you live. I tried my best to estimate how much I'd be spending on shipping, so it should cover it. If I have to pay a wee bit extra that's ok.

story:
Description

The Day the Cat Got Shot is a collection of 15 interconnected short stories, ranging from 5 to 15 pages. By exploring snippets and conflicts from the lives of the four main characters, we come to understand why a cocky secret agent who looks like a 1995-era Matthew Modine would shoot a cat and then jump out of an airplane with no parachute. (Short answer from the plummeting agent himself: “It seemed like a good idea at the time. Oh, damn it, this is going to hurt.”)

(McTiegue and Dorian Marseilles match wits. Art by Colin Dyer.)

I’m sure it goes without saying, but my main goal is for the graphic novel to be entertaining. I’ve done standup comedy for the last four years, so I hope the sense of absurd and observational humor I’ve developed will come through in the novel. On top of that, I’ll be employing the storytelling experience I picked up as I earned my Master’s in Creative Writing. I find that, in many comics I’ve read, storytelling and humor can sometimes be at odds, where one must suffer for the other to thrive. My goal is be entertaining because humor and storytelling hold equal weight and make each other stronger. I feel this will be a strength once we begin seeking publication for the novel.

(Eli's father gives his son his first gift. Art by Tahnee Torres.)

The Project 

This is the longest time I’ve ever spent on a project. I first started writing and publishing short stories about these characters in 2010 and started to develop the project as a graphic novel in 2012. It’s been rewarding to spend so much time with these characters, as it’s allowed me to explore a lot of different sides of characters that, initially, seem like stereotypes. It also lets me intersect the stories in some really intricate and funny ways. As you read the different stories, you’ll start noticing subtle references to other stories, explanations will pop up, you’ll see events from other angles. And you get to see people die in sweet ways. There’s this part with a knife. Oh man.

(Rough sketches by the author meant to serve as an inspiration for an illustrator. Drawing by Ben Dudley.)

The art is another goal- I want a diverse, interesting, and appealing look for the comic. I have 15 different artists at the moment, each with their own styles, working on stories suitable for those styles. A flashback to the CIA agent’s childhood is done with thick lines and watercolors. An underground fight club is rendered in a shadowy noir-like style. The smuggler’s descent into paranoia is rendered in the semi-abstract. The artists constantly surprise and impress me. Working with such a wide array of people in a variety of ways—from afterwork meetings with a colleague to look at sketches to extensive email threads with an artist 1000s of miles away—has been the most rewarding aspect of this project so far. I think this variety will create a very unique finished product.

(A young Eli uses the knife his father gave him to seek revenge on the man who raised him. Art by Michael Lee Harris.)

So far, I have paid all of the artists out of pocket. I’m dedicated to paying them whatever they typically charge for commissions. I don’t want to ask anyone to take any pay-cuts just because this is a low-budget project, though some have volunteered to lower their prices just to be involved. This Kickstarter exists so I can give the hard-working artists what they deserve.

(McTiegue displays his cocky penchant for narrating everything he does. Art by Justin Lynch.)


Characters

Cassandra Vargas lost her sister to unchecked fear and Cassandra wants to make sure the same thing doesn’t happen to her fiancé, Dorian. She has few qualms about using cunning (and her expert marksmanship) to achieve this. (Drawing by Colin Dyer)


Dorian Marseilles is a ruthless smuggler, brimming with power, wrath, and wealth, though these traits do him little good in light of his overpowering fear and paranoia. (Drawing by Colin Dyer)


McTiegue was born rich, confident, and muscular. He works for the CIA, is stupid, and wishes Dorian would see him as a threat. He is, unfortunately, the only person Dorian does not perceive to be a threat. (Drawing by Bart Noble)

Eli Gabriel’s mother died in childbirth, an event which emotionally crippled his father, leading to a harsh and unyielding childhood. Escaping his father, but not his cold, emotionless upbringing, Eli drifts around the Western hemisphere for most of his life, before arriving at Dorian’s compound and ingratiating himself as Dorian’s righthand man. (Drawing by Jeff Hicks)

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Birth of a Supernova tells the story of the newest Superhero to hit the borough of Brooklyn. Michelle Lee is a normal, Brooklynite. She is a Data Analyst at Chekov Labs.  Her friend and fellow scientist Mark Mathews are both infected by an alien matter labeled Comet 13.  Mark is transformed into an evil alien being with evil powers and is mentored by a fellow infectee, Nom Rot Sin.  Michelle is cured of her infection and given the power of a comet by Nom Rot Sins, nemesis, Cham Luna. Together Cham and Michelle use their powers to fight the evil Nom Rot Sin and Mark create while eluding capture from Chekov labs and the United States Military. 

CREATORS BIO

Charlene R. Jones is a Kansas City, KS native. She graduated from Washington High School where she was an active member of the AV club. Charlene later attended Kansas State University where she was an active participant in the Ebony Mask Theater and worked on such productions as Dream Girls, The Citadel and For Colored Girls. Charlene graduated with a B.S. In History, Pre-Law. She later moved to New York where she worked in independent film with such directors as Seth Carmichael, Louie Arribe and Rafael De Musa of New Horizons Theater. Upon moving back to Kansas City, she received her Masters of Secondary Education from the University of Phoenix and Masters of Science in Counseling from Emporia State University. After 15 years in education Charlene decided to work in film and television full time and entered the Savannah College of Arts and Design, majoring in Film and Television. She later changed her major to Dramatic Writing and earned her MFA in 2017.

IMPORTANCE OF THE CAMPAIGN

I truly believe that BlackStarr is a important project because it takes an everyday, average person (and through circumstances out of her control) from a hum drum citizen to a super hero with the power of a SuperNova inside.  It shows individuals that they can be anything even if they didn't know they had the right stuff inside of them.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE USED FOR

1. The hard completion of a 27 Page Graphic Novel in full color.

2. Digital Prints.

3. The ability to attend festivals and sell the project.

4.  Swag such as buttons, postcards and t-shirts.

5. Perks for backers.

6. Publicity.

7.  The ability to support other independent illustrators, printers, and artist.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

THE IMPACT

Having completed  3 previous crowdfunding campaigns, I analyzed the projects on costs of each project by reward level, number of backers and shipping.  The goal is to reach my  project's full fund amount of  $10,000.  (Assumptions: 250 Backers, average $40 spend ) The cost includes such expenses such as  coloring, lettering and book design (Cory’s labor).  According to my previous Indiegogo data, successful projects have had very small margins of profitability (less than 5%).  I believe in using independent printers and entreprenuers for the printed copy of the project, swag such as t-shirt, buttons, postcards and magnets to support local businesses.   This also includes initial fee's to some of nations smaller more intimate comic book festivals.  This is what the money raised will cover.

Risks & Challenges

Investing in anything is a risk but those who know me will attest that I always find a way to reach my goal.  If we don't raise enough to complete the pages in the allotted time I will create a series of mini-graphic novels that will efficiently tell the story.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you cant help:

  • Please feel free the share this campaign, get the word out and make some noise on your social media platforms.

story:
HEY THERE BABIES!

As you may know Comic Book Slumber Party successfully secured a table at the Toronto Comic Arts Festival in May. The bad news is that the funding we were relying on to make the trip a reality has - well - fucked the fuck off. So Hannah K Chapman, Donya Todd, and Jack Teagle are joining forces!


--

CBSP started way back when in 2013. Hannah, with a lot of help from Donya, started the organisation with an aim to promote women in comics and add something unique to the UK comic scene. We focus on planning events that encourage comic fans and creators alike to get together and just make something already! We have hosted events in Bath, Bristol, and London with guests including: Gemma Correll, Philippa Rice, Lizzy Stewart, Rose Robbins, and Isabel Greenberg. We also publish anthologies with a mix of established creators and newcomers. Our first book Comic Book Slaughter Party (co-created with Pic'n'Mixtape) featured the work of: Anna Bongiovani, Jenn Woodall, Rebecca Tobin, Donya Todd, Sarah Burgess, and Rose Robbins to name just a few. And to finish, this March we are hosting our first 'bootcamp', a week of intensive comic oriented workshops hosted by Plymouth College of Art.

Hannah K Chapman is a comics enthusiast, writer, and event organiser. As well as CBSP she is responsible for Chicago's first monthly Ladies' Night hosted by Graham Crackers Comics and writes regular features for the Forbidden Planet International blog.

Donya Todd  is an illustrator, painter, and comic artist who lives on a farm in Cornwall, England. Her comic book 'Death & the Girls' is published by Blank Slate Books and she is inspired by the magical, marvellous and macabre.

Jack Teagle is a British comic artist and illustrator. As well as his self-published work Jack's books Fight and Fight 2 were published by Nobrow and his work has been exhibited world wide.

Give us yer money!

  • We're releasing some Pledge Exclusives including a one-off patch design by Kate Leth, a book of Greasy postcards, hand decorated CBSP Girl Gang jackets, and of course comics just for you!
  • The two new releases will include the CBSP ANNUAL 2013 - collecting previously unseen workshop creators, comics jams, fan art, and fan art from our very first year. The second book will be a collection of stories featuring GREASY!
  • You'll be able to order currently out of stock products include Comic Book Slaughter Party, the original embroidered CBSP Patch, and an un-released goodies including a patch designed by Jenn Woodall and tote designed by Lize Meddings.
  • Funds raised will go directly to flying at least Hannah to Toronto for the festival with boxes and boxes of Comic Book Slumber Party books and merchandise. She'll also be packing self-published zines and comics from creators including: Donya Todd, Jack Teagle, Sarah Burgess, Isaac Lenkiewicz, and Kristyna Baczynski to name just a few.
  • If we don't reach our goal any money raised will be spent re-printing Comic Book Slaughter Party and the two new releases. We'd love to debut them at TCAF but 'the book is the thing' and it's what we want to focus on.
  • ORIGINAL ART REWARDS! See below!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you're strapped for cash? Big deal! Do a dog a favour and help us out in other ways:

  • Spread the word - know anyone who loves comics? Tell them about us! Know people who don't like comics? TELL THEM ABOUT US! 
  • If you're a shop that sells comics, or a venue of any kind, that would be interested in hosting a CBSP event then get in touch. We'd love to arrange events during the month of May in any of the following cities: Chicago (USA), Pittsburgh (USA), Toronto (Canda), Stockholm (Sweden), or London (UK).

Regardless of what happens we intend to make 2014 an awesome year for women in comics, the UK indie scene, and for Comic Book Slumber Party. We'll drink to that!

Note: P&P is included as part of your pledge! We'll be posting a list of cities and venues we'll be visiting so if you're able to come and grab your pledges in person you're welcome to!


Donya Todd  - 

ALOHA PAINTING


A4 INKS #1

A4 INKS #2

A4 INKS #3

COLOUR POSTCARD #1

COLOUR POSTCARD #2

COLOUR POSTCARD #3


HORROR- 


PIZZA SLUTS #1


PIZZA SLUTS #2

Kristyna Baczinski Original Art - 

Greasy Portrait


Jack Teagle Original Art- 

CHASE

LOSS

GUILT

story:
First Strike #1

See the Transformers and G.I. Joe like you’ve never seen them before! As Earth joins the intergalactic community, a massive explosion threatens the peace. Cobra is invading Cybertron, and only G.I. Joe and the Transformers can save the two worlds! In addition to Livio’s Indiegogo-exclusive cover, we’re offering sets of limited-edition variant covers, including our convention exclusive. And for you completists, we’ve got bundles of all 10 stunning covers to add to your collection!

THESE PERKS ARE IN OUR WAREHOUSE AND READY TO SHIP! WE JUST NEED YOUR ADDRESS!

The Indiegogo Exclusive Comic

  • Art by Max Dunbar
  • Written by Mairghread Scott & David R. Rodriguez
  • Colors by Ander Zarate
  • IGG Exclusive Cover by Livio Ramondelli
  • IGG variant not available anywhere else!

Enamel Pins

  • A must-have for any fan!
  • Traditionally only available at conventions
  • Pin sets are five (5) total pins
  • Pins available are:  Autobot, Decepticon, Bumblebee, Cobra, and Arashikage symbols

Posters

  • Designed by legendary artist Tom Whalen
  • Measuring  16" by 24"
  • Each showcases an individual character: Snake Eyes, Megatron, and Optimus Prime
  • Free in the Sketch and First Strike perks

Head Sketches

  • Limited run of 50, signed and drawn by Livio Ramondelli
  • 25 of Optimus Prime & 25  of Snake Eyes
  • Approximately 5.5" by 8.5"
  • NOTE: Sketches vary per character category 

Additional Covers

  • Regular A, B, C, and D Covers by Freddie Williams & Jeremy Colwell, Max Dunbar & Ander Zarate, Alex Ronald, and Rob Duenas
  • Limited-Edition A, B, C and D Covers by Jay Fosgitt, David Fabbri & Monica Kubina, Leonardo Manco, and Whilce Portacio & Thomas Deer
  • Convention-Exclusive Cover by Sara Pitre-Durocher
  • All cover variants of FS#1 are ONLY available in the First Strike packs
story_txt:
First Strike #1See the Transformers and G.I. Joe like you’ve never seen them before! As Earth joins the intergalactic community, a massive explosion threatens the peace. Cobra is invading Cybertron, and only G.I. Joe and the Transformers can save the two worlds! In addition to Livio’s Indiegogo-exclusive cover, we’re offering sets of limited-edition variant covers, including our convention exclusive. And for you completists, we’ve got bundles of all 10 stunning covers to add to your collection!THESE PERKS ARE IN OUR WAREHOUSE AND READY TO SHIP! WE JUST NEED YOUR ADDRESS!The Indiegogo Exclusive Comic
Art by Max Dunbar

Written by Mairghread Scott & David R. Rodriguez

Colors by Ander Zarate

IGG Exclusive Cover by Livio Ramondelli

IGG variant not available anywhere else!
Enamel Pins
A must-have for any fan!
Traditionally only available at conventions
Pin sets are five (5) total pins
Pins available are:  Autobot, Decepticon, Bumblebee, Cobra, and Arashikage symbols
Posters
Designed by legendary artist Tom Whalen

Measuring  16" by 24"

Each showcases an individual character: Snake Eyes, Megatron, and Optimus Prime

Free in the Sketch and First Strike perks
Head Sketches
Limited run of 50, signed and drawn by Livio Ramondelli

25 of Optimus Prime & 25  of Snake Eyes

Approximately 5.5" by 8.5"


NOTE: Sketches vary per character category 
Additional Covers
Regular A, B, C, and D Covers by Freddie Williams & Jeremy Colwell, Max Dunbar & Ander Zarate, Alex Ronald, and Rob Duenas

Limited-Edition A, B, C and D Covers by Jay Fosgitt, David Fabbri & Monica Kubina, Leonardo Manco, and Whilce Portacio & Thomas Deer

Convention-Exclusive Cover by Sara Pitre-Durocher

All cover variants of FS#1 are ONLY available in the First Strike packs

story:
WE DID IT ! AWWWWWWWWWWWWESOOOOOOOOOOME !

Thank you to our contributors !
Thank you all for sharing and helping us as well !

4 HOURS LEFT ! IF SOMEHOW THIS CAMPAIGN GOES OVER $500 - I WILL ADD A *SPECIAL* 1-OF-A-KIND COMMISSION ITEM FOR *EVERYONE* WHO GET'S AN ITEM MAILED TO THEM !!

**********************************************

Hello, my name is Rusty Gilligan, and I've been working in comics since 1978.

Let me introduce you to a small project I'm hoping to launch based on my "Mac and Trouble" comics property.

Currently, I am working up the funds to purchase a costume for an actor to wear at the many appearances and conventions that I do. We've scoured the internet, and found a costume close to the "Mac" character, and with some small alterations, we'll be ready to go.

This campaign is to help raise funds for the purchase (or should I say PURRchase) of the costume and help with the alterations to make it just right for our needs.



(only slight modifications need to be made to make this costume "Mac")

I've included some unusual rewards for this campaign... things that I hope will attract your attention. Any funds earned over the goal amount will result in EXTRA mystery prizes being sent to our contributors !!

Thanks for allowing my to pitch my campaign to you,

Sincerely,

Rusty !

__________________________________________________________________

(look for this special reward at right) --->

-Dan Gorman is the main penciler/artist for "Mac and Trouble" and his work regularly graces the pages of AC Comic's "FemForce". Dan is also a penciler on an independent comic called "Only Human" and has provided pin-up work for a Horror series called "Grindhouse: Doors Open at Midnight" published by Darkhorse Comics.

Dan has worked on over 90 Trading Card sets as a Sketch Card Artist.  In this capacity Dan has created artwork for major licenses like Star Wars, Marvel, DC and AMC's the Walking Dead to name a few.

__________________________________________________________________

(look for this special reward at right) --->

-Jim has been a fixture in comics for over 30 years, primarily as a cover artist… but has also done some wonderful interiors for projects like The Wraith, Lovely as  Lie, Ripperman, and many various independent publishers.

Jim has a previously published page from his time on The Wraith… these are the original pencils… that he will be donating… as well as a special Mac and Trouble piece that still targets Jim’s passion… Superhero Comics.

(look for this special reward at right) --->




                 http://thorthomas.deviantart.com/

(look for this special reward at right - only 3 available) --->

_________________________________________________________________

Please see the UPDATES SECTION at top for news on the new Mac and Trouble book project coming from Rusty Ink!

_________________________________________________________________

**JUST ANNOUNCED: WHEN THE $350 LEVEL IS REACHED, ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL RECEIVE A SIGNED 'FREE COMIC BOOK DAY' "DR. WHO" PROMO CARD !

_________________________________________________________________

JUST ANNOUNCED ... SPECIAL PRO AUTOGRAPH CARDS !!!

Upper Deck Marvel Masterpieces 2008 "Writer Autograph Cards"

top row: Tom DeFalco, Howard Mackie, David Mack

middle row: Jim Salicrup, Steve Englehart, Larry Hama

bottom row: Jeph Loeb

(PLEASE CHOOSE YOUR TOP 2-3 - FIRST CHOSEN/FIRST SERVED)

_________________________________________________________________
Rusty's sketch cards and inking samples can be found at:

** www.puntogallery.com/rustygilligan
** www.photobucket.com/user/mainpublishing/library/ninja
** https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10150896237464077.419849.592979076&type=1&l=70f999bf46
** https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.414088399076.195884.592979076&type=1&l=8153c61700

_________________________________________________________________
Dan Gorman's sketch cards and art samples can be found at:

**https://www.facebook.com/DanGormanArt
**http://www.dangormanart.com/

_________________________________________________________________


For those who are just getting acquainted with our project, here's some background...

**Rusty Gilligan... has been a fixture in comics since 1978 with credits including Marvel, DC, Big Bang, Image, Heavy Metal and more.


(above: Rusty poses with The Joker at the Great Allentown Show in PA)

His film work includes the original “Heavy Metal”, “Spider-Man 2 & 3″, and more recently “Captain America”, the "Avengers", and “The Walking Dead”. In the summer of 2014, Rusty will be working on a new comic-related motion picture.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0319207

Back in 1993, Rusty was working for card producer Clubhouse Diamonds and actually created the first commercial ‘sketch cards’ in the trading card hobby, and to his surprise, it soon took off and became a world-wide phenomenon. In the past few years, Gilligan rejoined the sketch card arena and has provided cards for Upper Deck, Breygent Marketing, Cryptozoic Entertainment, Cult-Stuff, and many others, including producing his own trading card sets for the “Mac and Trouble” comic book.

Coming up, Rusty's work can be seen in "Dr Who" and "David Bowie" card sets from Unstoppable Cards - a new "Star Wars" project for the George Lucas Foundation - "The Unofficial Dr Who Companion" by Matt Herring - an upcoming comic about bullying from JGM Comics - and a set of golden age projects for "Recollection Magazine".



___________________________________________________________________
CLICK HERE to download a flyer that you can use to help this campaign...

___________________________________________________________________


**Mac and Trouble... are actually real-life house cats, my best friends actually.


(above: the REAL Mac (left) and Trouble...

Mac was born with an ailment called "Cerebellar Hypoplasia" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebellar_hypoplasia) which causes him to have problems with his movements and he becomes very uncoordinated. He often has a problem walking, and at times falls down. He really can't jump or run, due to these problems as well.

Trouble was a kitten that came right after Mac. He's larger than most cats, a little clumsy, but an all-around best friend to the others... whether they want it or not LOL

Trouble and Mac got along famously right from the start, giving Mac the only playmate he's ever really known. They eat and often sleep together, and, you really can't think of one without the other.

AND THEY BOTH LOVE CHEESE !


(above: the recent "Mac and Trouble" comics 'The Director's Cut' now available at www.indyplanet.com along with other Rusty Ink! comics)

"The Adventures of Mac and Trouble" is the story of these 'average' house cats who fall through a wormhole in their litter box and land in the middle of the Nexus of realities. But... was it an accident, or were they meant to be there ? Only the evil Professor Wormhole knows for sure.

The 'Nexus' is a place outside of space-time, where a mysterious group known as the 'Collectors' base their operations. For all intent and purpose, it appears that they're operating out of a Movie Studio filled with all sorts of amazing characters and props, that interact with reality.

During their adventures, you will meet all sorts of characters on their comedic travel through the universe... some familiar, some not. Among them, long lost heroes, movie monsters, and historical figures to name a few, on a wild journey of the absurd.

Mac and Trouble have a few issues of their own comic, as well as having been in a newspaper strip, and have made appearances in other comics and magazines.

___________________________________________________________________

**Rusty Ink... Back in 1982, Rusty had formed MAIN Publishing and went on to produce many trading card and art print projects. Among their releases were the successful "M.A.I.N. Magazine" - "Test Drive" and "Sex Drive" comics (both of which won awards from various comic distributors) - and the "Wanted Women" card set.

In 2012, Rusty closed MAIN Publishing and re-opened under the imprint Rusty Ink! which currently publishes "Mac and Trouble" comics, "Recollection Magazine", and soon "Mac and Trouble Presents: TAILS" and a few trading card releases.

___________________________________________________________________

** Rusty has the following appearances coming up for 2014... all of which, the costume would appear at: https://www.facebook.com/notes/rusty-gilligan/conventions-and-live-appearances/419953411408802

**Also, galleries of this sketch card work: www.puntogallery.com/rustygilligan

**Mighty Titan art courtesy of http://www.redanvilcomics.com/

___________________________________________________________________

There are many ways to support us! 

  • Share with your friends and family, your groups, etc ! 
  • Share on your social media networks ! (Facebook, Twitter, etc)
  • Visit us at one of our many live appearances !
  • Download our flyer and bring them to pop culture events and shows !

  • MOST OF ALL... Pledge a tier and get a cool reward !

story:
Who Am I?

Hi, my name is Jason Brubaker and I have been working on graphic novels since 2006. My first book series called reMIND took seven years to complete. In 2015 I quit my great paying job at Dreamworks Animation to work on SITHRAH full-time. 

What is Sithrah?

SITHRAH is an young adult sci-fi about a little girl trying to find her father after their plane crashes in a unfamiliar land. That's when she starts seeing an invisible creature who has been following her around. Is he protecting her or just along for the ride? It's not long until she runs into a young man named Dino who is running from his own ghosts. Will they find the crash site? Will her father be there?

This series will be 6 books long when complete. Each book will have a different color cloth binding.

Popular Tiers


Art of Sithrah

Sithrah has been a big experiment with the comic format by mixing subtle prose with comic panels. My hope is to blur the lines between comics, children's books, and novels without making it jarring for the reader. Here are a bunch of double page spreads from book 2.

Most of my inspiration comes from the comic artists of the 90's when I refined my drawing style. Later I became influenced by Miyazaki's movies and storytelling and have been trying to make comics that have a similar depth and feeling. 

Feel free to read through my archive at Webtoons.com where I post weekly updates. I will continue to post new pages online until the full story is complete.

Book Specs.

SITHRAH 2 will be 160 full color pages in a hardcover book with a cloth binding. 1000 copies will have a signed and numbered bookplate. The interior pages will be printed on thick, high quality paper printed with the same care and attention to detail that I put into reMIND Volume 1 and 2. The retail price will be $24.95.

SITHRAH 2: Propositions (160 pages)

SITHRAH 1: Kingdom of the Air (96 pages)

Just so you know some history of my books: The first printing of my first book, reMIND, was printed in spring of 2011 with 2500 copies that sold out in about 6 months. It got much praise from fans and won some awards and achievements including:

2010 Xeric Grant Winner 

2012 Great Graphic Novels for Teens List (GGNT) 

2012 Selected for Arkansas State Reading list

When Will You Get Your Books?

November at the latest! In other words, JUST IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS! This will make a great Christmas present for kids and adults. :) So make sure to stock up and add lots and lots of copies as stocking stuffers.

Okay, let me backup and explain how this will happen...

SITHRAH 2 will be ready to go to the printer shortly after this Kickstarter ends. The printing process will take about 3 months for the proofs, printing and shipping. This means I'll probably be getting the books around September or October. I have helpers who will help me fulfill all the orders again and so we will try to get everything shipped within a month. (depending on how big this campaign gets)

I put November as the shipping date as an absolute worst case scenario but I am estimating that the books will be in my garage by September and I will start shipping them out soon after that.

Why Self-Publish?

People ask me why I chose to self-publish SITHRAH and reMIND. Well, when I started this my dream was to get the best agent and publisher and take the world by storm with my graphic novels. What I learned is that nobody cares about what you want to do until after you prove yourself. So I started posting pages online in 2009 to try to grow an audience and sure enough, a small group started following my progress. Later I applied for the self publisher's Xeric grant in 2010 and won $5000. This convinced me to fully commit to self-publish and it was then that I launched my first crowdfunding campaign back in 2010. To my surprise I raised over 12 thousand additional dollars to help print my first book. Then in 2012 I launched a second campaign for reMIND 2 and it raised a whopping $107,500! Although it was a crazy big campaign delivering so many books, it all worked out. Better yet, I now have a distributor for my books which was one of the biggest problems to overcome with self-publishing.

The funny thing is now that I have beautiful books published I am approached by publishers like I had dreamed about. I could easily sign a contract with a publisher but in being forced to self publish, I have also fallen in love with it. I can make the books exactly how I want them to look and reprint them whenever I want. I can focus on what's important to me instead of what's important to a publisher. It's a ton of work and I still have a lot to learn but overall I love self-publishing now. Thanks to Kickstarter and you guys for helping me I'll keep doing this as long as I can. :)

My business plan is to continue printing high quality first-printing books that are numbered, rare and sending them directly to my customers. The second and third printings will be manufactured more with mass distribution in mind.

I hope the quality of my books are apparent as soon as you see them on the shelf and even more so when you slowly flip through the pages. My goal has always been to make a coffee table book that also happens to be a comic.

Where Does The Money Go?

Now lets talk about where the money will go. I plan to print 3500 copies of SITHRAH 2 in China which will reduce my costs big time.

3500 copies = $14,000

Plus Shipping, Fees and Taxes +$10,000 (low estimate)

FUNDING GOAL = $24,000

Better yet, if we can blow past this goal then I will be able to unlock other books that are waiting to be printed. :)

Shipping

All domestic orders will get free shipping. 

International orders will be charged $20 for shipping 1 book. Canada and Mexico will be charged $13 for 1 book. Multiple book tiers will be charged International shipping according to weight. I know it adds up. Sorry, there's nothing much I can do to lower the shipping costs though.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this campaign but still want to help then here are some ways to go:

  • Please help me by spreading the word about this book series.
  • Give SITHRAH or reMIND reviews on Amazon or GoodReads.
  • Follow me on my YouTube channel. Just search for Jason Brubaker.

Risks and Challenges

This will be my 5th crowdfunding campaign and although I have successfully delivered all the rewards in my last campaigns I am even more prepared and confident that it will be a super smooth campaign. 

For instance, before I would have 80% of my book finished, but this time I have it 100% finished and even 100% of additional books finished that might end up being stretch goals. I have people in place to help me with shipping again. Not to mention I am working full-time on comics now instead of just after I get home from work. I have gone above and beyond to deliver on all my past campaigns even to the point of getting freelance jobs to help finish paying for stretch goals that the campaign didn't fully fund. 

There is always a chance that something could go horribly wrong and delays could happen but I have given myself a few extra months of buffer time if anything goes down. Thanks for trusting again. :)

It's a ton of work and I still have a lot to learn but overall I love self-publishing now. Thanks to Kickstarter and you guys for helping me I'll keep doing this as long as I can. :)
My business plan is to continue printing high quality first-printing books that are numbered, rare and sending them directly to my customers. The second and third printings will be manufactured more with mass distribution in mind.
I hope the quality of my books are apparent as soon as you see them on the shelf and even more so when you slowly flip through the pages. My goal has always been to make a coffee table book that also happens to be a comic.
Where Does The Money Go?

Now lets talk about where the money will go. I plan to print 3500 copies of SITHRAH 2 in China which will reduce my costs big time.
3500 copies = $14,000
Plus Shipping, Fees and Taxes +$10,000 (low estimate)
FUNDING GOAL = $24,000
Better yet, if we can blow past this goal then I will be able to unlock other books that are waiting to be printed. :)
Shipping


All domestic orders will get free shipping. 
International orders will be charged $20 for shipping 1 book. Canada and Mexico will be charged $13 for 1 book. Multiple book tiers will be charged International shipping according to weight. I know it adds up. Sorry, there's nothing much I can do to lower the shipping costs though.




Other Ways You Can Help
 If you cannot contribute to this campaign but still want to help then here are some ways to go:  Please help me by spreading the word about this book series.
Give SITHRAH or reMIND reviews on Amazon or GoodReads.
Follow me on my YouTube channel. Just search for Jason Brubaker.   Risks and ChallengesThis will be my 5th crowdfunding campaign and although I have successfully delivered all the rewards in my last campaigns I am even more prepared and confident that it will be a super smooth campaign. For instance, before I would have 80% of my book finished, but this time I have it 100% finished and even 100% of additional books finished that might end up being stretch goals. I have people in place to help me with shipping again. Not to mention I am working full-time on comics now instead of just after I get home from work. I have gone above and beyond to deliver on all my past campaigns even to the point of getting freelance jobs to help finish paying for stretch goals that the campaign didn't fully fund. There is always a chance that something could go horribly wrong and delays could happen but I have given myself a few extra months of buffer time if anything goes down. Thanks for trusting again. :)

story:
Short Summary

How often do we turn to the U.S. for sources for comedy? Too often! Canada's smaller population compared to the States makes it difficult for comics to produce Canadian-themed content because the powers that be don't care for Canadian audiences. But we do. Your support will go towards building up a NATIONAL satire newspaper (available online and in print) which will poke fun at Canadian politics, along with world issues subjected to a Canadian spin. Sounds good, eh?

By the way, when we say Canada, we mean ALL of Canada. From British Columbia to Newfoundland. Yes by!

What we're trying to offer is a satire source on equal footing with The Onion, The Colbert Report, The Daily Show, but with Canadian content. Canada's currently available sources of news parody sometimes fall short due to their limited availability (during elections, for example, many of the big programs were in between seasons) or they target demographics which leads to stiffled comedy.

What We Need & What You Get

 

 

 

We need money to print our third issue. The first two were well received, but the modest budget we had limited our ability to market and distribute properly. This new issue will be more robust, and we need a bit of coin to see it through properly from print to distribution.

Any money raised that exceeds our goal will allow us to print more copies and circulate them in nearby cities (we're located in Toronto, but we'd love to bring some to Ottawa and Montreal, and maybe other locales).

By the way, did we mention that in the grand scheme of things, if everything goes to plan, this will be a NATIONAL newspaper? For circulation numbers to increase we'll need to focus on our home city first, but plans are already made to distribute in major cities in every province, and  no one needs to be left out. If you can't find The Beaverton in your local coffee shop, you can find it online, or we can send you a copy by subscription.

The Impact

A CANADIAN PRODUCT FOR CANADIANS: Many other countries have national print satire newspapers. Why not us? Why should we support our neighbours to the south instead of our fellow Canadian comics?

JOBS FOR CANADIAN COMICS: Many Canadian comedians toil away for years hoping that one day they will find a job in the U.S. writing comedy for a sitcom or website, or The Onion. Wouldn't it be great if our community of comedians was able to find work within Canada, producing Canadian content, for Canadian audiences?

On top of this, Canadian produced Satire will give the world a viewpoint of issues going on in our own country and abroad. Satire can open people's eyes to big issues, sometime in more meaningful ways than traditional media.

Check out The Beaverton website (www.thebeaverton.com) and look at all the hard work we've been doing. This is what we've accomplished using our own money, and countless man hours, toiling away on the web to code the website, creating mockups of our print edition, going on the street and creating awareness by dressing up as a giant beaver... we're hardworking and  you can rest assured that all of the generous donations we receive will be spent in the best way possible. If you think our content needs improvement let us know by all means! But so far we've received great feedback. Creating satire is a complex procedure. We have weekly meetings to pitch ideas and punch-up our content. At the moment this is a labour of love. Help us with the seed money needed to start turning this project into a proper business.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you haven't got any spare coin for us, there are still many other ways you can help out:

  • Visit The Beaverton website (www.thebeaverton.com
  • Ask your local coffee shop/restaurant/hang-out space to carry print copies of The Beaverton
  • Like, follow, subscribe to our social media sites (Facebook, Twitter, Google +, Tumblr, etc...) - this kind of support gives all of the writers a huge moral boost :D

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hey Folks, I'm a comic artist who's been around for while. Most of my work can be found on:

www.memecenter.com/gearboy


Long Story short is that my laptop is on the verge of blowing up (because of how slow it is), and most of me and my parents' savings are going towards my university tuitions therefore I simply don't have enough to afford one right now.

Part of the money helps me afford a new computer and the rest helps me pay my uni tuitions.


To put it straight: a new computer would enable me to create far more comics and work of art for you and my followers.


If you don't really feel like donating - no worries ^_^ - I would still appreciate it if you got the word around about this little campaign! :D

story:
Vincent is an Elite assassin who takes a bit too much pride & pleasure in his work. He's got it all; style, money, reputation, and he also happens to be secretly dating his the boss's daughter. Betrayed & sent to his death on an ostensibly simple job: take out a old man as a favor. The old man, in actuality an ancient VAMPIRE, has other plans!

Now awakened as a vampire, Vincent discovers a supernatural world hidden in plain sight, While settling into his new abilities the assassin rains hell upon anyone standing between him and the vengeance he craves!

THE BLOODHUNT BEGINS!

EXCLUSIVE COVER BY SIMON "SIM" POTHIER NOW WITH NEW COLORS!

BLOODHUNT: The Specifications

  • Black & White
  • Stand-Alone
  • 76 Pages
  • Action, Supernatural,  Horror, and Fantasy
  • Printed in a square-bound soft cover format.

Created by Simon “SIM” Pothier I have 2 sequels planned, making it a trilogy with an even more epic ending!

I have already completed 52 pages (out of 72). I’ve been working non-stop for the last year & we're confident that it's the highest quality book we can offer. Unapologetic entertainment. Dark, Gritty and Violent. Non-PC and one hell of a ride!

             

BloodHunt 5 page sample   

STRETCH GOALS

NOW all closed since MAI 25th.

All backers who got a physical book tier, gets the stretch goal rewards. 

  • $5 000:  Two backers will be randomly selected to be on the Variant Wrap-Around Cover + Everyone will get a mini print of a new exclusive illustration + Vincent’s business card + 20 sketch cards will be made & randomly inserted in books. (unlocked)
  • $7 000: 4 extra pages of story + 20 more sketch cards will be made & randomly inserted in books. (total 40). (unlocked)
  • $10 000: Every backer of a physical BH tier will get a sketch card added to their perk + 4 extra pages of extra bonus content. (unlocked)
  • $15 000: ?

Another BloodHunt 4 page sample.   

THE TEAM 

SIM; Creator, Writer & Illustrator.

ADAM A.F; Co-writer (Dialogues) 

STEVE DYE; Editor

DAVID VILA; Letterer.                   

 

What you get;

  • All books are signed
  • A Beautiful high quality B&W graphic novel, Square-bounded softcover.
  • Exclusive & limited BloodHunt sticker. 
  • Constant update, here, You Tube, Facebook & Twitter.
  • Physical book tier backers will also get the digital, It will be sent after the book.
  • 100% unadulterated , unpolitical, non-PC & unapologetic entertainment. 

What we need:

We need the funding to get the book lettered & printed. I already got 52 pages inked on 64 so this book is very close to being done, you might even get it in advance ;)

W.I.P. Variant B&W Cover. 

 

Exclusive & Limited Art Print numbered & signed.

  

             

About SIM

SIM, I'm a Canadian comic book creator/Artist & Storyboard/Concept Artist from Montréal. I've been a indie comic creator since 2009, when I first self-published: The Wolfdragon comic. Later I started a very fruitful collaboration with ZIDARA 9, a french sci-fi anthology, from 2012 to 2016, where I published my creator-owned properties characters like; Nat the Merc, Helena Roze: Space-Pirate, Loani, Abigail Fate & Beta Test. I've worked for Heroes of the North the comic,  an award winning web-series of Canadian Superheroes.  

HUGE fan of S.Bisley, F.Miller, M.Silvertri, Jim Lee, G.Capullo, Dale Keown, Arthur Adams, Mike Mignola. I'm also into Mangas like: Appleseed, Alita B-A, Trigun, Hellsing a french comics titled The Metabarons by A.Jodorowsky & J.Gimenez & Heavy Metal magazine (Métal Hurlant). 

Delivery

The book is already 90% done, 58 pages on 68 are inked. We have set the date to November at first but because of the 1 month campaign extension + waiting 3 month & a half for the money, The decision was made to move the date to February & March 2020, to give us enough time to get the book complete, proofread, lettered, Print filed & printed. Then prepare the packages for backers, sketches & other rewards.  (updated)                       

                                                                             

Risks & Challenges

The book is already 80% done,I just need to finish the campaign so I can close the, be in the comic tiers & finish the book.

If we reach the Epic version it might take an extra month but you will be informed about the progress.

The printing & shipping could also have delays but We're planning on printing locally, giving us a quick printing & less risk. ONE thing's for sure. no matter what.   

 ''YOU WILL GET THE BOOK''.

( No refund possible once we go Indemand ) 

 

SIM's project line up.

My previous self publication, The Art of SIM Anthology.

Collecting all my previous publication in Zidara9 from 2012 to 2016.

Follow me on;

Facebook,

Twitter,

You Tube.

THANK YOU!

Then prepare the packages for backers, sketches & other rewards.  (updated)                                                                                                    Risks & ChallengesThe book is already 80% done,I just need to finish the campaign so I can close the, be in the comic tiers & finish the book.If we reach the Epic version it might take an extra month but you will be informed about the progress.The printing & shipping could also have delays but We're planning on printing locally, giving us a quick printing & less risk. ONE thing's for sure. no matter what.    ''YOU WILL GET THE BOOK''.( No refund possible once we go Indemand )  SIM's project line up.

story:
Hello!!

Welcome! Let me tell you a little about myself. My name is Cara Nicole. I am also known as AZ Powergirl. I cosplay, edit comics, write, and color art professionally. I am also the model for Magic: The Gathering's Emmara Tandris, numerous novels and variant comic book covers.

Because this is a time sensitive project I am limiting it to indigogo supporters. I will not be mass producing this calendar so that we can get it printed and to you ASAP :)

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...

1) Printing and shipping to you.

2) Extra fun bonus prints, banners, Polaroids, etc.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring you this 13 month full color full glossy calendar all I need is for you to tell me what you want, I make it, print it and send it your way! Easy!

Cover by Eurobeat Kasumi <3

There are a lot of benefits for all of us cosplay fans in supporting this project. Nothing ensures the creation of more cosplay in your life as much as promoting it and making it successful. As always, you vote with your wallet and I am asking that you vote for me and get my calendar.

Oh and we have some cool stuff to go along with the calendar itself! Metal prints, digital photosets, AND a TBA super sexy exclusive print! 

 

Risks & Challenges

I have devoted a huge chunk of my life to cosplay and I do put a lot of time and effort into the costumes, the photoshoots at various locations, building the calendar and finding good printing. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge at this time, you can definitely share this on social media like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc...

Also, feel free to take a look at my books and prints at my online store: http://183degree.storenvy.com

AND follow my latest photo shoots at http://patreon.com/azpowergirl

 

UPDATE:

Big reveal! Here is the Exclusive Print Tier sexy print for the Calendar campaign! Never before seen shot at the beach ;) Let me know what you think. <3

story:
About 

My Name is Rev, I am a fantasy and comic artist from Germany. Born in the 90s, I grew up watching cartoons and drawing Pokemon. I currently study design at an university.

Drawing has been my favourite hobby and I discovered, I have a talent for funny comic strips. This brings us here and me trying to put my strips together for a book.

 

This campaign means the world to me, it's my second chance, to realize my big dream of holding my own comic book, but this time it will actually be something I can be proud of.

With every contribution, whether it is monetary or retweets/shares – you show interest and love for my work and you help me realize this dream! It means the world to me! Thank you for your support!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The biggest part of the funding are the printing costs with roughly around 70% of the  total sum. The second biggest amount is calculated fees and costs for this website and Paypal fees. I also want to properly pay a lector, the rest is shipping and packaging costs, as well as a small buffer for unforeseen things.

____________________________________________________________

 

Perks:

Please remember to leave a way to contact you! (Email, telegram etc)

I ship worldwide, but I also offer pickup at Eurofurence in August! If you want to use this option, pick EU Shipping and leave me a comment, that you want to pickup. I will get in touch with you. You also get your shipping costs back or some extra merch.

Everything will be shipped by the end of August.

5€ Tasty Breadcrump

The smallest perk contains a digital vesion of a secret comic strip as well as a digital thank you card, both delivered by email!

10€ Cornflakescruncher

Includes the secret comic and digital thank you card as well as the PDF of the finished book. Also sent via email.

 

20€ Comicwaffle

You'll get a physical, signed copy of the book, a bookmark with a handwritten thank you message as well as the secret comic. Everything will be sent to you via mail, once the books are printed. 

 

35€ Strawberry Tiger

Includes a signed copy of th book with a Thank You card and the bookmark. Also you can choose two prints to go with this! (And yeah, the secret comic again) Everything is sent out after the books are printed.

 

35€ Banana Tiger

This is the alternate version - you want a copy for one of your friends or as a giveaway? With this package you get two signed copies! ( And secret comic + bookmarks again)  Also sent vial mail after printing.

 

50€ Oreo Cat

Now it get's interesting! This package includes your name in the book! It will have a special Thank you page for all the people who contributed and your name will be there, too! Also you get the book as well as all the other gimmicks.

 

100€ Chocolate Bunny

Additional to the signed copy, the thank you card with a handwritten message, the secret book and a bookmark you will not only get your name into the final book but you also get a limited version of the old book AND 4 prints.  Oh and the old book contains a personal greeting and scribble on the last page :D

200€ Cookiemonster

Additional to all the small perks and the physical copy of the book, you will get a personal sketch commission from me! Examples can be found here 

https://twitter.com/Revaivwra/media

This perk also includes 5 prints of your choice and a one of a kind handrawn Thank You card with a surprise motive! There will also be several surprise items, like stickers, more prints and other stuff. Oh and of course, your name also will be in the supporter section of the book!

You can choose between everything being shipped together once the commission is done, or the book and all the printed items get shipped as soon as possible and the commission follows. (Due to workload the commission won't be started until the end of August and will probably finished within a month!)

 

 

450€ Pancake Wolf

 

And the last and largest perk. You get two copies of the new book, as well as the old one. A hand drawn one of a kind thank you card, five different prints, the secret comic  and bookmark aw well as some surprise items. But not only will your name be in the book as the biggest supporter, you will also get featured in a page of the book and get a personal fullcolor commission!  

The commission includes a fullbody traditional picture with a simple background. For examples see here. For what I do and do not draw, please check the FAQ.

Your character being featured in the comic book can range from a secondary character to a complete story, depending on your character and where it fits. Human and nonhuman characters are possible, for more information, please check the FAQ.

____________________________________________________________

Possible Print Motives:

These will be printed in the size A4 ( 210 x 297mm - or a bit bigger than letter sized). You can chose between 6 motives, or choose the mystery print, which might be a surprise motive not shown here!

 

Info: The print selection in the perks is a bit limited, so you can leave a message if you want a different selection than the options allow!

____________________________________________________________

 

What happens if I don't reach my goal?

 

First, I will make sure that everyone who pledged something, will get their perks, so each book that gets ordered and each print bought WILL get printed and shipped. I have planned this campaign to get 200 copies of the book, if I don't reach the complete sum, I will reduce the amount of books and print only 100. But I will make sure that all perks are met!

 

Risks and Challenges:

In the past year I learned a lot about making a book. I have some skilled people who help me, and I am sure that this campaign can be a great success. 

I tried to think of every possible way this can go wrong, and I tried to think ahead and see mistakes before they happen. And I will do my best to make sure that every perk ordered will get their reward!

 

I will make sure to keep all of you updated about the printing and shipping process, as well as anything else around the book.

 

____________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in different ways, not only by ordering something! You can also retweet, share and get the word out about this campaign! Tell your friends, tell your cat, tell your grandma!

 

And if you do want to contribute, but don't have a credit card, you can help via preorders in my Etsy shop :  https://www.etsy.com/de/shop/Geisterwolfskunst

Everything I earn there goes directly into this campaign :3

 

You can also reach me here:

                   

 

 

Any Questions? Check the FAQ or write an email to wolfdoodles@gmx.de
story_txt:
About 
My Name is Rev, I am a fantasy and comic artist from Germany. Born in the 90s, I grew up watching cartoons and drawing Pokemon. I currently study design at an university.
Drawing has been my favourite hobby and I discovered, I have a talent for funny comic strips. This brings us here and me trying to put my strips together for a book.
 
This campaign means the world to me, it's my second chance, to realize my big dream of holding my own comic book, but this time it will actually be something I can be proud of.
With every contribution, whether it is monetary or retweets/shares – you show interest and love for my work and you help me realize this dream! It means the world to me! Thank you for your support!
 

What We Need & What You Get
 
The biggest part of the funding are the printing costs with roughly around 70% of the  total sum. The second biggest amount is calculated fees and costs for this website and Paypal fees. I also want to properly pay a lector, the rest is shipping and packaging costs, as well as a small buffer for unforeseen things.
____________________________________________________________
 
Perks:
Please remember to leave a way to contact you! (Email, telegram etc)
I ship worldwide, but I also offer pickup at Eurofurence in August! If you want to use this option, pick EU Shipping and leave me a comment, that you want to pickup. I will get in touch with you. You also get your shipping costs back or some extra merch.
Everything will be shipped by the end of August.

5€ Tasty Breadcrump
The smallest perk contains a digital vesion of a secret comic strip as well as a digital thank you card, both delivered by email!

10€ Cornflakescruncher
Includes the secret comic and digital thank you card as well as the PDF of the finished book. Also sent via email.
 

20€ Comicwaffle
You'll get a physical, signed copy of the book, a bookmark with a handwritten thank you message as well as the secret comic. Everything will be sent to you via mail, once the books are printed. 
 

35€ Strawberry Tiger
Includes a signed copy of th book with a Thank You card and the bookmark. Also you can choose two prints to go with this! (And yeah, the secret comic again) Everything is sent out after the books are printed.
 

35€ Banana Tiger
This is the alternate version - you want a copy for one of your friends or as a giveaway? With this package you get two signed copies! ( And secret comic + bookmarks again)  Also sent vial mail after printing.
 

50€ Oreo Cat
Now it get's interesting! This package includes your name in the book! It will have a special Thank you page for all the people who contributed and your name will be there, too! Also you get the book as well as all the other gimmicks.
 

100€ Chocolate Bunny
Additional to the signed copy, the thank you card with a handwritten message, the secret book and a bookmark you will not only get your name into the final book but you also get a limited version of the old book AND 4 prints.  Oh and the old book contains a personal greeting and scribble on the last page :D

200€ Cookiemonster
Additional to all the small perks and the physical copy of the book, you will get a personal sketch commission from me! Examples can be found here 
https://twitter.com/Revaivwra/media
This perk also includes 5 prints of your choice and a one of a kind handrawn Thank You card with a surprise motive! There will also be several surprise items, like stickers, more prints and other stuff. Oh and of course, your name also will be in the supporter section of the book!
You can choose between everything being shipped together once the commission is done, or the book and all the printed items get shipped as soon as possible and the commission follows. (Due to workload the commission won't be started until the end of August and will probably finished within a month!)
 
 

450€ Pancake Wolf
 
And the last and largest perk. You get two copies of the new book, as well as the old one. A hand drawn one of a kind thank you card, five different prints, the secret comic  and bookmark aw well as some surprise items. But not only will your name be in the book as the biggest supporter, you will also get featured in a page of the book and get a personal fullcolor commission!  
The commission includes a fullbody traditional picture with a simple background. For examples see here. For what I do and do not draw, please check the FAQ.
Your character being featured in the comic book can range from a secondary character to a complete story, depending on your character and where it fits. Human and nonhuman characters are possible, for more information, please check the FAQ.
____________________________________________________________
Possible Print Motives:

These will be printed in the size A4 ( 210 x 297mm - or a bit bigger than letter sized). You can chose between 6 motives, or choose the mystery print, which might be a surprise motive not shown here!
 
Info: The print selection in the perks is a bit limited, so you can leave a message if you want a different selection than the options allow!
____________________________________________________________
 

What happens if I don't reach my goal?
 
First, I will make sure that everyone who pledged something, will get their perks, so each book that gets ordered and each print bought WILL get printed and shipped. I have planned this campaign to get 200 copies of the book, if I don't reach the complete sum, I will reduce the amount of books and print only 100. But I will make sure that all perks are met!
 

Risks and Challenges:
In the past year I learned a lot about making a book. I have some skilled people who help me, and I am sure that this campaign can be a great success. 
I tried to think of every possible way this can go wrong, and I tried to think ahead and see mistakes before they happen. And I will do my best to make sure that every perk ordered will get their reward!
 
I will make sure to keep all of you updated about the printing and shipping process, as well as anything else around the book.
 

____________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help
You can help in different ways, not only by ordering something! You can also retweet, share and get the word out about this campaign! Tell your friends, tell your cat, tell your grandma!
 
And if you do want to contribute, but don't have a credit card, you can help via preorders in my Etsy shop :  https://www.etsy.com/de/shop/Geisterwolfskunst
Everything I earn there goes directly into this campaign :3
 
You can also reach me here:
                   
 
 

Any Questions? Check the FAQ or write an email to wolfdoodles@gmx.de

story:
"Imprisoned in her mystical sleep for fifteen hundred years, give or take, Morgan Le Fay has been discovered & restored to a shadow of her former glory by a cabal of powerful beings calling themselves the Triple Moon. For no less than thirteen years, Le Fay will serve this group, and at the end of that service she will be given the means by which she can restore her power. Until that time, she will be their trouble shooter, on call 24/7, no job too big or too small. The Triple Moon’s very own private investigator." Paul- Pullbox Reviews

This is a modern take on the classic villain from Arthurian legend brought into the present in an urban setting. Ever wonder what Jessica Jones would be like if she happened to be a powerful sorceress? That's Le Fay in a nutshell.

New to Le Fay? Read 10 pages of issue 1 HERE

Watch Youtube Reviews of Issue 1

Nasser Rabadi 

Illustration by Design

Shawn James

 

Rot10 Glory

Joshua Metzger - Writer/Creator

 Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics) and Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing).

Marcel Dupree - Writer/Creator

Owns and operates Evoluzione Publishing, which produces comics like  Armor-I and Delilah Blast.  He also edited Punch Drunk from Arcana Comics

Miguel Angel Ruiz - Artist

Miguel Angel Ruiz, was born in 1984 in Córdoba, a little city in the south of Spain.

He began his carrer in animation world, studing animation during two years, then was working in three films of spanish productions,three years later he moved to Mexico and worked in his fisrt comics for indy companies, then when he returned to Spain, studied Illustration carrer in Art School of Córdoba, while he was working in Farscape Scorpious for Boom Studios.  When he finished his studies, started to work in Crossed Badlands for Avatar press, Miguel Angel still working in indie comics since that moments, have worked in Arclight comics, Sygn media, Genuine comics etc...Currently  Miguel Angel is working for Evoluzione Publishing making the art of Le Fay, and covers for another titles.

Vittorio Astone - Colorist

 Hi, I'm Vittorio Astone and I'm a professional comic book artist and freelancer concept artist. I've published some short stories with Heavy Metal Magazine and Editoriale Aurea's Lanciostory and now I'm working with Vault Comics on an upcoming comic book series. As a concept artist, I'm currently working as a freelancer for private clients.

story:
After 32 years in business...

Atlas Comics has been building a multi-generational community of pop culture lovers for more than three decades. Like the local tavern or the office water cooler, Atlas is the center of a thriving sub-culture of people who all love the same things: comic books, movies, science fiction, art, history and conversation. The circumstances that are keeping us closed are endangering our community, and we'd like your help to keep it going.

We need an influx of revenue, and we're offering discounts on future in-store purchases as an incentive.

Here's the idea:

We're trying to raise $7000 for operating expenses during this shutdown. We are not asking for gifts, but rather donations that will net you a 20 or 25% discount on future purchases of vintage back issue comics.

Atlas is known for the finest on-site collection of Silver, Bronze and Modern Age comics in Chicago, with over 70,000 issues to browse through daily. New collections and previously archived material arrive regularly. During our hiatus, thousands of classic comics never seen in the shop have been retrieved from storage and added to our inventory.

When Illinois allows a complete resumption of business, we will have a two day soft opening ONLY for those who have donated to this campaign. You can still redeem your donation amount at anytime after, but those first two days will be exclusive to our Indiegogo backers only.

You are our lifeblood!

Atlas could not have lasted all these years without the loyalty and support of our customers and friends. I miss you guys, and life is not quite the same without the conversation, energy and humor of the store. Who knows how long this pandemic will last, or if it might return later. This is a way to ensure our unique community will continue into the future. 

This too, shall pass.

Long ago, those words were written for an ancient Chinese Emperor who asked his court philosopher to craft a saying that would be true under any circumstances. So: this too, shall pass. And when it does, we will be standing. With your help, Atlas will outlast Covid-19. 

Know people who love comics? Send them our way.

Whether you love comics or not, you may know people who do. If so, please spread the word among them. Every connection helps strengthen our community. And, yes, I recognize the morbid oddness of telling you to spread anything.

story:
Hello potential Indiegogo backers, here's some info about the NINETY FOUR - VOLUME 1 collection that we are attempting to fund!

NINETY FOUR - VOLUME 1 is a collection of the exciting original full color 3 issue run of the comic book series, plus extras. This perfect bound trade paperback runs a total of 94 pages. This book is created, written, and drawn by Shelby Robertson. Interior colors supplied by Steven Oaks, Jesse Heagy, and Shelby 'Cobra Colors!' Robertson.

HELP US LAUNCH THE NINETY FOUR - VOLUME 1 COLLECTION!

We need your help and support to launch this great collection of Shelby Robertson's NINETY FOUR series. NINETY FOUR is essentially me having fun with several tropes from the 90's era of comics, balanced with a bit of new school. 90's comics were the era that inspired a very young me artistically and was *luckily* the era that I got my break into the industry. NINETY FOUR features all new characters that project these retro ideas.

This collected edition contains the first 3 issues of the NINETY FOUR comic book series, including the infamous sideways issue, a nod to the popular sideways issue crossover books by two particular industry giants from the early 90's. Within NINETY FOUR - VOLUME 1 you will follow the tales of Ragetality, Slamm, and Clinton. They're 3 time-traveling haphazard assassins whom really can't seem to complete the agenda at hand. This is mostly due to Ragetality's inability to follow basic guidelines. These stories are a perfect introduction to this rag tag group. Also included in this book is a mixed section of original character designs, unused pages, and pin up artwork. This collection is presented in a perfect bound comic book sized format, so will fit nicely with your collection or alongside your other trade paperbacks.

This book is 100% paginated and ready for press, only lacking necessary funding.

Additional perks will be added if specific stretch goals are met, so read through the goals to get an idea of what extra cool stuff we have in mind.

ALL copies of NINETY FOUR - VOLUME 1 perfect bound collected editions SHIP SIGNED by the creator/artist Shelby Robertson.

 

PERKS AND ADD-ONS:

We are offering Foil - Final Encore editions for single issues *1, 2, and 3* of this book. This is specifically for those fans who prefer regular sized 20 to 24 paginated comics rather than collected trade paperbacks. These feature  homage covers respectively, another nod to the era which inspired this series. These are available as a standard perk, but they can also be added individually as add-ons. These single issue editions only contain the original story pages that pertain to that specific individual issue number. The bonus materials section is only going to be found within the full VOLUME 1 collected edition trade paperback. So, keep that in mind when selecting your perks.

There are a VERY LIMITED number of Sketch Covers available that will feature an original head shot/shoulders up/ sketch drawing of one of the NINETY FOUR characters, drawn and inked by series creator/artist Shelby Robertson. Also for the very first time, there's regular blank sketch cover add-ons available for those who are into collecting them for personal custom art.

We are also making a special Line Art edition of NINETY FOUR #1, which has never been offered to the public. This is a limited release book of 25 copies worldwide. It's something uniquely it's own and features black and white artwork throughout. Available as add-on.

 

PERKS FOR THIS CAMPAIGN

NINETY FOUR VOLUME 1 GRAPHIC NOVEL

  • Signed copy of the NINETY FOUR Graphic Novel delivered to your doorstep.

NINETY FOUR LIMITED SKETCH

  • Signed copy of the Graphic Novel PLUS a Limited to 25 copies sketch cover edition of issue #1, featuring a head/chest shot of a NINETY FOUR character, drawn, inked, and signed by Shelby Robertson. This edition of blank sketch cover will only feature original sketches of characters from the NINETY FOUR universe.

ORIGINAL ARTSCAPADE

  • Signed copy of the Graphic Novel PLUS 3 fully penciled Original Artworks *all individually signed by Shelby* which were used for the NINETY FOUR comic book series. This perk contains 1 Splash page and 2 panel work story pages, accompanied by your signed NINETY FOUR trade paperback. All Original Artwork measures 11" x 17". Only 5 slots available for this perk.

FINAL ENCORE SWINGIN' IN FOIL 3 PACK

  • Perk consists of the entire NINETY FOUR story split between 3 individual issues, all feature Exclusive FOIL Covers. Cover art features ASM300 swipes as shown.

BLANK STARE

  • You will receive a Blank Sketch Edition to create your own masterpiece upon. It contains the first 20 pages from the NINETY FOUR series.

DOUBLE VISION

  • You will receive 2 copies of the Blank Sketch Edition comic to draw on.

 

PLEASE READ PERKS AVAILABLE THOROUGHLY to explore all options on how you can help us make this book become a reality!!

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET!

 

  • This is an extremely easy book to fulfill on our end, as it is already fully complete and ready to be sent to the printers. We are confident that we can match and even beat our projected aimed delivery. We are excited for physical copies of this book to be in hand and ideally want your perks in your possession as early as possible. We have set our funding goal to the bare minimum for getting this project to the press for printing. HOWEVER, keep in mind that we are shooting for well above bare minimum to push forward other books that we have on the burners. We fully appreciate everyone who wants to be a part of this campaign! 

 

  • We ship all comic books bagged and boarded securely in a Gemini II sturdy comic book mailer. Anyone who is getting original art will receive their full package safely packed in a 12"x18"x3" U-Line heavy corrugated box. We do not roll original artwork or art prints, all ship boxed, flat, and protected. We believe in shipping items to you in a way that we wished others shipped collectibles to us!

 

CAMPAIGN STRETCH GOALS:

 

  •     1. Goal 1,600 USD - UNLOCKED FREE All New Exclusive RAGETALITY trading card added to every physical book order.
  •     2. Goal 2,200 USD - UNLOCKED FREE Ragetality sticker added to every physical book order.
  •     3. Goal 3,300 USD - UNLOCKED FREE Mini Print.
  •     4. Goal  4,000 USD - UNLOCKED FREE All New Exclusive SLAMM and CLINTON trading cards added to every physical book order.
  •     5. Goal 5,500 USD - UNLOCKED Ragetality War One-Shot ASHCAN Preview.
  •     6. Goal 6,600 USD - LOCKED ALL trading card extras upgraded to Foil for FREE.
  •     7. Goal 8,800 USD - LOCKED Pin-Up section added to Ragetality War ASHCAN Preview.
  •     8. Goal 9,500 USD - LOCKED FREE Foil sticker added to every physical book order.
  •     9. Goal 10,600 USD - LOCKED Enamel Pin.
  •     10. Goal 12,500 USD - LOCKED NINETY FOUR Volume 2 B/W ASHCAN Preview added to every physical book order.
  •     11. Goal 14,000 USD - LOCKED NINETY FOUR Volume 2 ASHCAN Preview goes full color.

LIMITED OF 25 SKETCH EDITION SAMPLE

 

 

INTERIORS

INTERIORS

 

 

EXCLUSIVE FOIL EDITIONS

 

 

NINETY FOUR #1 LINE ART EDITION COMIC BOOK ADD-ON

 

 

 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

With the possibility of COVID-19 affecting printing and shipping industries, this can introduce unpredictable delay issues that we cannot foresee. However, all work on this project is 100% completed and we intend to ship all issues by MARCH 2021. We are aiming for the earliest possible fulfillment and shipping. This depends entirely on how fast the printer can finish making the books and get all physical copies into our hands following this campaign. We fulfilled the fully funded Shelby Robertson Sketchbook INDIEGOGO campaign in OCTOBER, even though it had a projected ship date of mid-DECEMBER. We're pushing to build our reputation for early and on time delivery to all backers for our campaigns.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We understand that some of you are not able to support this new NINETY FOUR Volume 1 collection by contributing money. Not a problem! We encourage you to share our campaign link through your social media pages, blogs, livestreams, and word of mouth. We appreciate all forms of support on our books and appreciate you for taking the time to do so!! Together we can help do our part to keep the comic book market innovative and creative!
