INTERIORS
 
 

EXCLUSIVE FOIL EDITIONS
 
 

NINETY FOUR #1 LINE ART EDITION COMIC BOOK ADD-ON
 
 

 





 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
With the possibility of COVID-19 affecting printing and shipping industries, this can introduce unpredictable delay issues that we cannot foresee. However, all work on this project is 100% completed and we intend to ship all issues by MARCH 2021. We are aiming for the earliest possible fulfillment and shipping. This depends entirely on how fast the printer can finish making the books and get all physical copies into our hands following this campaign. We fulfilled the fully funded Shelby Robertson Sketchbook INDIEGOGO campaign in OCTOBER, even though it had a projected ship date of mid-DECEMBER. We're pushing to build our reputation for early and on time delivery to all backers for our campaigns.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
We understand that some of you are not able to support this new NINETY FOUR Volume 1 collection by contributing money. Not a problem! We encourage you to share our campaign link through your social media pages, blogs, livestreams, and word of mouth. We appreciate all forms of support on our books and appreciate you for taking the time to do so!! Together we can help do our part to keep the comic book market innovative and creative!

story:
Welcome (or welcome back) to Pictures of You!

We're here to raise funds to print Pictures of You Book Three, Bishop Street. For those of you here not familiar with Pictures of You, let me tell you a bit about the comic, and what your money will help support.

Peter Morris finds a box of old photographs, and a flood of memory from the greatest time of his life and the best friends he's ever lost. This is the stage for the graphic novel series Pictures of You.


Since its launch online in Feb 2007, Pictures of You has grown a small but devoted audience for an emotional and character-driven ensemble comic about a young circle of friends and the journey that leads through the greatest years of their lives to their disintegration.

With a subtle mix of humour and drama, the comic follows main character Peter and friends through the hedonism of sex, drugs, and rock n roll, punctuated by sexual and personal identity, domestic violence, substance abuse, unwanted pregnancies, unrequited love, ill-requited love, scholastic failure, artistic success, and much more. It has been hailed as one of the most realistically-written comics with a wide cast of believable characters, evoking a genuine care and concern for them among the audience.



Pictures of You is an ongoing, 10-volume Mature Readers series, and will wrap up its fifth book online in December of 2014, its sixth book launching early in 2015. During its run, the story's broad range and universal relatability has found an audience across ages and genders, with readers as (unadvisedly) young as 13 to senior citizens and all in between, and from countries all over the world.

You can find more about the comic at its home: picturesofyoucomic.com


Book Three, Bishop Street

In this third and largest volume of Pictures of You, the characters move out of the college dorms into the fateful apartment on Bishop Street, soon to become the central point of both an unending party and dramatic turns within the group. Big shifts take place in the group dynamics, with animosities giving way to trust, and tight friendships are strained to breaking, new romance blooms and standing romance falls apart, Plus, plenty of sex, drugs, and rock n roll. Trigger warnings all around, this shit gets real.

For the print version of Bishop Street, as with previous books, we've retouched and cleaned up the art as well as a complete re-lettering to make the comic easier to read. Also, have I mentioned that Bishop Street is 400 pages of beloved comics? Not convinced? Well, you don't have to take my word for it...


Praise for Pictures of You


Perks, Rewards, Whatever You Call Them!

We're offering comics. Big heavy graphic novels. And some art.

Along with PDF options of both Book Three and all the first 3 books, you can grab the massive 400-page paperback of Bishop Street, or if you're new to Pictures of You, you can get paperbacks of the first 3 books. In addition, you can see yourself in the pages of Pictures of You (in the upcoming Book Six) or get a colour Artist Sketch Card along with the book.


COVER ART NOT FINAL

As a special option, you can get a version of Bishop Street with a hand-drawn and coloured illustration on the cover, that's one-of-a-kind cover art by Gibson Twist (colour by the fabulous Rori!)

All CANADIAN & INTERNATIONAL backers over $20 will get special material with their books, including a tattoo-design patch and One-Inch Punch guitar pick (and more!) Why only internationally? To offset the cost of shipping, which is kind of a motherflicker, as my way of saying thanks.

We've kept the number of options light to make for easier, faster delivery to all our backers, but we're always open to new ideas! Have something specific in mind? Drop us a line at gibson_twist@yahoo.com and we'll see what we can do.


Risks & Challenges

During our first crowdfunding for Pictures of You Book One, we faced many unexpected problems after the project had been funded successfully. The biggest of these was a shortfall in the amount we had budgeted not only for printing and product costs, but especially in our postage budget. This led to many of our deliveries being delayed, and errors with the post office led to some being delayed even further.

Despite this enormous setback, we have gone into our own pockets in attempt to fulfill all of the rewards from that campaign. It was an expensive learning process for us, but we took the lesson and put it into effect. In the interim, we have held several smaller crowdfunding efforts and have streamlined and corrected our shipping process and refined our budgets. We have also streamlined the variety of rewards we're offering in this campaign, and as a result are now able to print and deliver our books faster and more efficiently.

story:
- ENGLISH VERSION - 



Who am I? 

My name is Silvia Ballardini, best known as Silly (or Silly Lunastorta) and I am a nerdy comic artist and illustrator from Italy. I'm into comics since I was a child and that is the reason why I attended an art high school in my city (Ravenna) and then got an undergraduate degree at Academy of Fine Arts of Bologna. I'm currently working as a freelance illustrator, running my little shop on Etsy and looking forward to having an experience abroad, in Edinburgh. My sources of inspiration are fantasy and steampunk genres, japanese animation and culture, manga and comics, victorian fashion and nature, tv series and fairy tales. 

Nina Who?

Nina is a 23-years-old geeky and indolent girl living an unconfortable period: she's just graduated and is currently unemployed, uncertain if pursue the normal life her family want her to or fight her laziness and follow her aspirations: she dreams of becoming a musical theatre actress, because she wants a part in her favourite plays alongside her favourite actors. In fact, she uses to sing in her head.  Nina doesn't get along very well with the real world, so she finds some comfort in her fantasies and her teddy bear. She has a bunch of imaginary friends who are, in some way, the many voices of her counsciosness. 



What is Nina's geek-self?

Childhood, awkwardness, imagination, fear...

... those are the main subjects of "Nina's geek-self", which is a funny comic strips collection about Nina and her imaginary friends. 

... maybe it's time for Nina to face the frightening real world.

If you are a daydreamer and a loner, if your mind is always full of worries and you still have the trauma of the secondary school period... if you dislike people but the person you dislike the most is yourself... then you may like this book! 

[ you can find few of the comic strips in the gallery, if you're curious :) ]



Some technical informations.

"Nina's geek-self" is a collection of many nerdy comic strips, all with the same characters and the same subjects. Hopefully, it's going to be the first volume of a series.  NB. I'm going to ask for help to a native speaker for the translation.

Dimensions: 17x24 cm 

Pages: 40, full color

Paper (inner pages): matte paper, density 100-110 gr/m2  

Paper (cover): matte paper, density 200-250g gr/m2

Binding: Saddle stitch. 




Why am I asking for your help?

I'm asking for funds because I'd really like to print the book in two languages, English and Italian, because in that way I will be able to promote "Nina's geek-self" both in my own country and in the country I'm going to move (UK). 

The funds I get from this campaign will be used for the printing costs of 200 volumes (100 in English and 100 in Italian language) as long as a series of gadgets, which are bookmarks, stickers, postcards and posters. I decided to keep the money only if I reach the goal. If I don't, your money will be automatically refunded. In the lucky case I reach bigger results than I expected, I will use the extra money for promotion purposes, like rent an exhibit space at illustration and comics conventions, which will hopefully help my art to gain some audience and feedback. "Nina's geek-self" book and merchandise will also be promoted on the web and sold on my Etsy Shop. I'd also like to distribuite the volume on Amazon as e-book.

If the campaign will be successful the first thing I'm going to do is print "Nina's geek-self" bookmarks, stickers, posters and postcards and make them avaiabile on my Etsy Shop. The contributors who chosed to have them as reward will receive the gadgets by August 2015. Printing times for the book itself will probably be a bit longer, but I'll do my best to make them availabile on my Etsy Shop and for the funders as soon as possible, approximately by the end of September 2015! The e-book will be avaiabile by the same date.

Hopefully, as I said before, by the next year I will also be able to promote the book at comic and illustration conventions in Italy and in UK.

*** please remember to select the perks if you want the gadgets! ***




Other ways to help.

Any kind of help will be immensely appreciated. If you're not able to donate you can help me sharing this campaign on other social networks like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, etc, using the Indiegogo share tools! Spreading the word could be a really powerful weapon and I thank you in advance for this!



_____________________________________________________________________________


- VERSIONE ITALIANA -


Chi sono?

Mi chiamo Silvia Ballardini, meglio conosciuta come Silly (o Silly Lunastorta) e sono un'aspirante illustratrice e disegnatrice di fumetti italiana. Sono cresciuta a suon di fumetti, disegni e cartoni animati e forse è proprio questa la ragione che mi ha convinta ad iscrivermi prima al liceo artistico della mia città, Ravenna, e poi all'Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna, dove ho conseguito un diploma in pittura. 

Attualmente lavoro come illustratrice e fumettista freelance, vendo le mie creazioni su Etsy e mi sto organizzando per fare un'esperienza all'estero. Le mie principali fonti di ispirazione sono i generi fantasy e steampunk, l'animazione e la cultura giapponese, i manga e i fumetti, la moda vittoriana, la natura, le favole e le serie tv.


Chi è Nina?

Nina è una ragazza di 23 anni, indolente e un po' nerd, che sta vivendo un periodo piuttosto scomodo: si è appena diplomata ed è attualmente disoccupata e indecisa se conformarsi alla vita che vorrebbe la sua famiglia oppure vincere la sua pigrizia e seguire la sua aspirazione, ovvero diventare un'attrice di teatro. E' una grande appassionata di musical - infatti spesso canta nella sua testa - e per questo vorrebbe una parte nei suoi spettacoli preferiti, accanto ai suoi attori preferiti.  

Nina non va molto d'accordo col mondo reale, così spesso trova conforto nelle sue fantasie e nel suo orsacchiotto di peluche. Nina ha diversi amici immaginari che sono, in un certo senso, le tante voci della sua coscienza. 


Cos'è "Nina's geek-self"?

Infanzia, insicurezza, immaginazione, paura...

... queste sono le tematiche principali di "Nina's geek-self", che è una raccolta di vignette buffe che vedono Nina e i suoi amici immaginari come protagonisti. 

... che sia il momento per Nina di affrontare il mondo reale?

Se sei un sognatore (soprattutto ad occhi aperti) e un solitario, se la tua mente è sempre piena di ansie e il trauma delle scuole medie ti ha segnato a vita... se non ti piace la gente, ma la persona che ti piace meno di tutte è te stesso... allora potrebbe piacerti questo libro!

[ potete trovare qualche vignetta nella gallery, se siete curiosi! ]


Informazioni tecniche.

"Nina's geek-self" sarà una raccolta di vignette buffe che hanno in comune gli stessi protagonisti e le stesse tematiche. Se avrò fortuna sarà il primo volume di una serie. 

Dimensioni: 17x24 cm
Pagine: 40, a colori
Carta (pagine interne): grammatura 100-110g, patinata opaca
Carta (copertina) grammatura 200-250g, patinata opaca
Rilegatura: punto metallico


Perché sto chiedendo il vostro aiuto?

Ho deciso di provare ad avviare questa raccolta fondi perché mi piacerebbe stampare il libro in due lingue, italiano e inglese, in modo che possa promuoverlo sia nel mio paese che all'estero.
I fondi verranno usati per la stampa di 200 volumi (100 in inglese e 100 in italiano) e una serie di gadget quali segnalibri, adesivi, cartoline e poster.
Se la campagna non raggiunge i risultati sperati vi saranno automaticamente rimborsate le vostre donazioni. Invece, nel caso contrario e fortunato in cui i risultati della raccolta fondi siano superiori alle aspettative, userò i fondi anche per la promozione del libro - per esempio per noleggiare uno stand alle fiere di illustrazione e fumetto, cosa che potrebbe aiutare i miei lavori a guadagnare maggiore audience.
Libro e gadget di "Nina's geek-self" saranno anche diffusi sul web e venduti sul mio Etsy Shop. Mi piacerebbe rendere il volume disponibile anche su Amazon come e-book.

Se la campagna avrà successo la prima cosa che farò sarà stampare i segnalibri, le cartoline, gli adesivi e i poster e renderli disponibili sul mio Etsy Shop. I contribuenti che li hanno scelti come ricompensa riceveranno i loro gadget entro la fine di Agosto 2015. I tempi di stampa per il libro probabilmente saranno un po' più lunghi, ma conto di fare il possibile poiché sia disponibile sul mio Etsy Shop e per i contribuenti entro la fine di Settembre 2015! L'e-book sarà disponibile entro la stessa data.

Incrociando le dita, come già detto in precedenza, entro la fine del prossimo anno sarò anche in grado di promuovere il libro a fiere del fumetto e dell'illustrazione sia in Italia che nel Regno Unito.

*** ricordatevi di selezionare i "perks" se volete i gadget! ***


Altri modi per aiutare.

Ogni genere di aiuto sarà immensamente apprezzato. Se non vi è possibile donare potreste aiutarmi condividendo questa campagna su social network come Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, eccetera, tramite i pulsanti di condivisione. La diffusione è un'arma potentissima!

story:
The Fight Continues!

--

All Hayley held in the aftermath of her stinging defeat against the Doctor was a number. With no hesitation, she punches it into the phone booth and makes the call, bringing her face to face with Maxwell, the owner of the FERAL circuit. His curiosity piqued, Maxwell gives Hayley an ID number and an official place amongst the FERALS. With that, the first steps in Hayley's now personal vendetta against Brandt have now been taken, but before then she must first scramble up the ranks and prove she's worthy.

In her path laid several obstacles, and whilst meeting with Maxwell she is introduced to one of them, the sadistic Tiziano Vespri, a man with similar grudges against Brandt but has no intention of letting the out of towner take that glory from him. Whether Hayley is capable of overcoming Tiziano's legendary ferocity is solely dependent on how she handles her first, and, given the stakes, possibly her last official match against one of the circuits top tier fighters - Casey...

--

Early January I was knee deep in drawing my first comic strip, something that countless friends have urged me to do. Inspired by the gritty style of modern underground fighting movies, it is a story of a drifter named Hayley Rosa, a girl who believes that with her fighting ability she can take anything she wants. When arriving in Alta city on her so far undefeated tour, she is brought crashing to earth by a local doctor and extremely talented martial artist, Brandt. She vows to take him down at his own game by joining the Feral Circuit, the prestigious fighting syndicate he is a part of. With every challenging step she takes, Hayley changes with the realisation that she is small game, making her desperate and dangerous. Eventually the circuit re-shapes her completely, but into what will depend entirely on the decisions she makes not as a fighter, but as a person...

Once May came around, 100 of the 30+ page Feral comics were printed, some shipped and the rest taken to Australia's Furdu event. The reception I got from this pilot comic was incredible. I got so much positive feedback from friends and strangers alike, as well as demand for the comic still continuing almost 3-4 months after its initial printing! Even Furry Down Under's guest artist, the stunningly talented Stucat (check the art he did for the convention here) purchased a copy after a quick flick through, which was simply an honour in my eyes.


He even went on to humble me further with this statement - "Dr Dubs makes some pretty choice art, and even better that he has made a comic so you get to see more of his work in a continuous stream of pages. Feral has an interesting cast of characters from different fighting disciplines and a different reason for smashing one another. The fight scenes are sweet, it has that visceral feeling of someones face being crushed. The only stink thing is that there is only the first issue, and I want to see who's next on the roster!"

With that, I have both confidence and absolute will to bring the next few chapters to the public, and eventually the entire story. I will also be improving upon the first chapter for the full publication that will be made available through Gashu-group.net! The deadline will be May 2014, and will be continuously updated. As well as this, the improved first chapter will be available to view online once completed, so those who have not bought the initial publication will get an idea of the scope and style, as well as get an insight on exactly what Hayley is up against...

Also making an appearance in a fight against Hayley is the taker of the $600 perk from the last campaign, the talented furry musician Kaz Dragon (above on the right, also click here to buy his brilliant album 'windmills'), who performed alongside Foxamoore at Furdu 2013. As well as this, he has agreed to create some awesome tracks for a small promo CD, also featuring another of Furdu's charity concert performers, Darky (above on the left, who will also be making a guest appearance in the comic). With his impressive Silat expertise, Kaz will be no walk in the park for Hayley, so here's hoping you're as excited to see it as I am to illustrate it!

Bigger Drive = Much Higher Rewards!

This time around, I'm attempting to get about $6500 in funds. A few reasons include:

  • Additional merch, including t-shirts, postcards and possibly a music CD with original tracks composed by Kaz Dragon, Darky and more! (TBA)

  • Personal art as collaboration pieces with the utterly talented Neko-Maya that will be used as perks and as collectable prints (click here for examples). Her colouring ability is outstanding, and intensifies my lineart greatly, making them excellent additions to your collection. 
  • All the other bits and bobs, including the postage for perk items and whatnot.

Over-funding!!!

Considering there may be a possibility of the funding being exceeded, I would like to propose a few distinct and, frankly, absolutely awesome things to happen in the event that certain thresholds are reached...

  • $7000 - If the final overall number goes over $7000, I'll contribute 10% of the final amount to a charity chosen by popular vote (TBA after the deadline has been reached).
  • $8000 - So you know how Neko-Maya is awesome at colouring things in? She is willing to apply her magic to the opening pages of each chapter, making the comic jump from plain awesome to really rather stunning...
  • $11000 - Complete colour work by Neko-Maya, and if subsequent sales go well, maybe have her on board to colour the rest of the books as they are made.
  • $13000 - Did you know that I animate as well? Well if the funding amount it doubled, I'll be bringing in a couple of friends to create a small animated movie of Feral! 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you're strapped for cash? Honestly, I don't blame you, these are some tough times. Still, money isn't the only thing you can contribute, since a moment to like this page on Facebook, share on Twitter, pass this campaign around your friends or even just a cheer onwards will benefit me no end. No matter how, your support is greatly appreciated!

  • Post links on Facebook, Twitter, Blogspot, Myspace, FA, DA, whatever the hell you use, just let people know it exists
  • Keep checking back for updates and previews on http://www.feral-comic.com/. 
  • Don't forget to check out the other awesome artists who've shown their support for this project!
story_txt:
The Fight Continues!
--
All Hayley held in the aftermath of her stinging defeat against the Doctor was a number. With no hesitation, she punches it into the phone booth and makes the call, bringing her face to face with Maxwell, the owner of the FERAL circuit. His curiosity piqued, Maxwell gives Hayley an ID number and an official place amongst the FERALS. With that, the first steps in Hayley's now personal vendetta against Brandt have now been taken, but before then she must first scramble up the ranks and prove she's worthy.
In her path laid several obstacles, and whilst meeting with Maxwell she is introduced to one of them, the sadistic Tiziano Vespri, a man with similar grudges against Brandt but has no intention of letting the out of towner take that glory from him. Whether Hayley is capable of overcoming Tiziano's legendary ferocity is solely dependent on how she handles her first, and, given the stakes, possibly her last official match against one of the circuits top tier fighters - Casey...

Still, money isn't the only thing you can contribute, since a moment to like this page on Facebook, share on Twitter, pass this campaign around your friends or even just a cheer onwards will benefit me no end. No matter how, your support is greatly appreciated!

Post links on Facebook, Twitter, Blogspot, Myspace, FA, DA, whatever the hell you use, just let people know it exists

story: UMMM UGH
story_txt: UMMM UGH

story:
SUPPORT MONSTER MAGIC MAGAZINE

Read All About it :

This project is a new magazine that captures the fun, exciting and sometimes creepy world of fantasy and horror. This magazine will feature the films, books, games that we all love and the people who create them. It will also include upcoming events such as conventions, contests, haunted houses and much more! In addition, there will be interviews and bios on the people who make all this possible. We believe this magazine will be successful because there are very few magazines on these subjects and none that cover this much material. Also, this magazine will create exposure for new Indy projects that otherwise may go unseen. We believe that everyone needs to have the chance to have their projects viewed and this is a great platform for people to discover new talent. We want to give readers the experience of a convention without leaving their house give our contributors the kind of exposure they need to be a part of something bigger for years to come and in this way you can be a part of it to.

Most magazines do well based on how much they sell at retail stores and that sets a limit on the exposure that each artist, actor, author, model, film director,  game designer or business offering a service receives when they purchase an ad in a magazine.  That exposure is also based on the placement of the ad, How much information is included and how well that person is known depicts whether or not readers want to read the article at first glance. So to change this, Monster Magic Magazine intends to give away digital copies  to both horror and comic convention attendees through contests and by distributing the issues to convention owners or vendors. 

 This will take some time and funding but with your help we can get our magazine out to the more people everyday and give the creators of many types of independent projects the exposure they deserve. At the same time, the readers will get to read and experience a truly amazing magazine!

How the Magazine will be distributed:

We will be self publishing our magazine on line until we can capture the attention of a prominent publishing company who we feel will be very interested in the style and theme of our project. The ultimate goal is to have the magazine printed and on magazine stands all over the world.

                  In order to complete our goal we need the following :

  • Email & Social Media Marketing Costs : $2,000-$4,000
  • Travel Expenses and Hotel Accommodations : $1,500-$3,000
  • 500+ Magazines printed : $1,500 - $2,000
  • Editor, Publicist, Writers , Graphic Artist & Staff : $7,000 - $10,000

Our over all profit may be small after expenses but the reward of what we can contribute will be doing something large for the fantasy and horror industry and to see the smiles on our supporters faces, that makes it all worth it!!!


      What if our goal is not reached?

                If our goal is not reached, YOU STILL GET ALL YOUR PERKS!

               We will still do our best to produce this amazing magazine 

               and honor all the perks. In the event that this isn't possible,

               we will gladly refund your money. We respect our supporters!


   Our Supporters & Recent Submissions include:

                 Listen to them on soundcloud.com/zombielifepodcast

                 Visit their official website at www.zombielifepodcast.com

                               

                               WE HAVE CONTRIBUTING FILM MAKERS!

                           Below are some of the great film makers who

                       have submitted their productions to us recently!

   

                         

   

 

   For more info on Zombie Casserole go to http://www.forzombies.net/

        See the cast and more at http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3195672/

      The creators of Zombie Casserole had people to write to zombies :

 
 

   

 

     

                     ZCON THE MOVIE

        ZCON WAS SUCCESSFULLY FUNDED ON                     INDIEGOGO AND THEY STOPPED 

BY 

                 TO SUBMIT THEIR FILM TO US! 

            HAVE A LOOK BEHIND THE SCENES:

                  Find out more about ZCon at www.zconthemovie.com


                                   Here's a few other great supporters who

                                   have 

submitted and contacted us below :


                                 

                 Need custom made prosthetics, props and fx supplies?

                                        With over 13 years of experience 

               www.MichelMulkeyFX.com is your one stop horror shop!



                    Check out this amazing service at www.NerdBlock.com

                    

                  

                               WE HAVE CONTRIBUTING AUTHORS!

                          Here are some amazing must read books

                               that were recently submitted to us!

                               Some of them may become a series

                                  or a feature film one day, in fact!

                            Some of them are already in the works!

                           

                                       The Host Files by Apryl Baker

                                          Now Available on Amazon

                           

                                     Eddie Rotten's FrequenZ: Alpha 

                                          Now Available on Amazon


             What else will be inside of Monster Magic Magazine? 

                    DON'T BE SCARED TO FIND OUT! JUST READ BELOW };)


               Here is a great list of categories of what's in store :

  • Aliens and UFOS
  • Alternative
  • Anime
  • Beauty tips!
  • Best Sellers (Books and Authors)
  • Blogs

           and much much more! };)     


          PLEASE CONTACT US AND TELL US ABOUT YOU! (READ BELOW)

                                A great sculpt that we'd love to feature,

                        but the ghostly person didn't leave their name :'(


             

                                          SEE OUR FACEBOOK FAN PAGE

                                               FOLLOW US ON TWITTER

                                      

                                A Special Message From Troy Omen CEO :

We have had thousands of great supporters recently all waiting for our magazine to come out. We want to take a second to say thank you to everyone who supports indie projects from the people who are in the spotlight and the people who are behind the scenes making it possible for the authors and writers ideas to come to life and allowing us to share them with the world, We commend you and wish you great success in life.


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

        Other Ways You Can Help Us

  • Share our links and contests on Facebook & Twitter :
  • Like and share our video on Youtube!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ANu7WqEkeZY

 Check out our Facebook post here ->http://youtu.be/ANu7WqEkeZY

Check out our Twitter Post ->http://www.twitlonger.com/show/n_1s20hpd

                                  You can also use the tools on Indiegogo!

      Thanks for the support                everyone and for your                      contributions!

By ordering a perk you agree that Monster Magic Magazine can promote the content that you submit within the magazine as a whole on their official website, on social networks, blogs and press release material as well as at conventions all over the world. By submitting, you confirm that the images/photos you submit belong to you. If you submit content it must be of a fantasy,mystery or horror or dark themed in nature. We reserve the right to screen content and reject any material that we deem inappropriate for the magazine including but not limited to full frontal nudity, hate speech or character bashing. Play nice. If you agree to the above statements choose the perks that fit your needs. Thank you.

We reserve the right to screen content and reject any material that we deem inappropriate for the magazine including but not limited to full frontal nudity, hate speech or character bashing. Play nice. If you agree to the above statements choose the perks that fit your needs. Thank you.

story:
Colleen DerKamp used to be a normal girl, one day, her a strange fate befell on her. Subjected to a terrible ritual against her will, she becomes the new "Host of Darkness." With the help of the enigmatic Lucian Copper, she escapes the Cult of Guff, and now on the run, she's alone to face her new fate. 

Enter, Nathan Rowe, a disgraced homicide detective now working a private investigator, tasked with protecting Colleen from the Cult that chases after her and the dark powers that consume her soul.

Will he able to succeed in his mission or are they all destined to become lost souls to the Host of Darkness? 

Risk and challenges:

I am a one-man team doing all the work: writing, pencils, inks and colors plus editing and graphic design for the entire book. The entire work is digital, which speeds up the creative process, but as always there are hurdles (malfunctioning hard-drives, corrupted files and power outages). There are other factors that might delay the release of each chapter such as disease and injury.

But I will always try to deliver the promised rewards on time and let backers know of any possible delays. 

Follow me on social media:

twitter: https://twitter.com/atelieredge

Instagram: https://instagram.com/atelieredge

story:
Hello Indiegogo Friends !

My name is Kaan and I'm a 32 years old illustrator and comic book artist living in France. I've been making art my whole life, making comics and illustrations professionally in different styles (Science Fiction, Fantasy, Cartoon, Superhero,…) for the past 10 years.

I’m working with my beloved one and professional partner Solène, who is colorist.

The world is changing and the way of book publishing too. Crowdfunding is a wonderful concept which allows with freedom, independency and equitability people from all over the world to support the projects they love and to give the possibility to creators to develop the projects they always dreamed to share with others.

After learning the existence of Indiegogo, and with the coming birth of our first child in august which inspire us artistically, we decided to create this artbook project and share it with you. Your generous and enthusiastic contribution can make this dream come true. Additionally, if you allow us to reach this goal, there will be a sequel to The Book of Drimz and we have plenty of other comic book and art projects that we would like also to create and share with you on Indiegogo.

The Book of Drimz will be a 48 pages artbook featuring highly detailed black and white and color illustrations and sketches, all drawn by me and colored by Solene. These artworks will explore a large variety of themes including : Science Fiction, Heroic Fantasy, Faeries, Gothic, Pin-Up, Western, Mythology, Exotism, Mysticism, Lovecraftian worlds, Pirates, Weird Creatures, Post Apocalypse, Dinosaurs, etc…

A special section, at the end of the book, will feature your personal Drimz (this will be explained in more details in the What you Get ? section below).

You can visit the gallery to see a selection of illustrations which have been already realized in order to promote this project. 

- Digital Copies (PDF) : Unlimited

- Paper Copies : 25 collector copies

- Size : 16,82 x 26 cm (6,62 x 10,25 inches) 

 - Pages :  48

- Contents : from 60 to 70 artworks

 - Cover : Full-color

- Format : Paperback

- Binding : Saddle Stitch

Anything you donate will help us create this unique Book of Drimz !

The 5000 $ required will be used to cover the costs of :

- The artworks production (which includes the penciling, the inking and the coloring of highly detailed illustrations)

- The book design (cover + interior pages layout)

- The printing of the book

- The shipping of the book from the printing house to our home.

- The shipping of the printed copies to the corresponding donors all around the world.

- The creation of a High Resolution PDF file for the corresponding donors.

- The creation of a special blog dedicated to the artbook where everyone will follow the creation process and evolution of the project during and after this campaign.

- Indiegogo fees.

Apprentice of Drimz ($5) : Your name and localization (for example : Akira Suzuki, JAPAN) will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice).

Initiate of Drimz ($15) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + You will receive a hand signed PDF copy of The Book of Drimz.

Magus of Drimz ($30) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + you will receive a hand signed PDF copy of The Book of Drimz ! + An original quick hand drawn art integrated in the PDF.

Master of Drimz ($50) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + You will receive one of the 25 signed collector printed copies of The Book of Drimz.

Grandmaster of Drimz ($75) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + you will receive one of the 25 signed collector printed copies of The Book of Drimz + An original quick hand drawn art.

Archmage of Drimz ($150) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + you will receive a hand signed PDF copy of The Book of Drimz + One of your personal Drimz will figure in the Artbook with your name next to it.

What’s a Drimz ? It’s an illustration I will draw based on a theme or a description you will give me (for example : A warrior riding a giant spider in a desert). The drawing will be black & white, full page, you will choose its title and you will be credited on its page like this : “Based on a original idea from … (your name + location)”

King Wizard of Drimz ($200) : Your name and localization will be credited in the Thank You chapter of the artbook. You will be also credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with your name, localization and your picture (or an avatar of your choice) + You will receive one of the 25 signed collector printed copies of The Book of Drimz + One of your personal Drimz will figure in the Artbook with your name next to it.

IMPORTANT ! PLEASE READ THIS! :  If we can’t reach our goal, the Apprentice of Drimz, Initiate of Drimz, Magus of Drimz, Master of Drimz and Grandmaster of Drimz will nevertheless have their name credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with their name, localization and picture (or an avatar of their choice). I will draw one special “thank you” illustration for thanking all of you Indiegogo friends which I’ll send you a hand signed digital copy.

The Archmage of Drimz and King Wizard of Drimz will have their name credited in the Thank You section of the Book of Drimz blog with their name, localization and picture (or an avatar of their choice) + the digital hand signed copy of the special “thank you” illustration + the personal Drimz they have pay for (I will send them a digital copy of it and, if they want, the original paper art).

If you can't afford to contribute, you can still help us to make this Book of Drimz come true !

Please share our campaign, spread the word about our project by passing on our link to your friends and anyone who might be interested in supporting the creation of this artbook.

Thank you so much Indiegogo friends for your help, support and goodwill !  

Our very best regards to all of you !

Kaan & Solène

story:
Short Summary

HEAVEN: Where you can live on after you die, for a price. A graphic novel set in two worlds; a man-made Heaven and Earth in the not too distant future, HEAVEN is the story of the last great creation by mankind; one that some from the religious right are seeking to destroy.

Heaven is an upcoming new 64 page graphic novel created and written by Anthony and Darko Kotorac and illustrated by fan favourite Norm Breyfogle. 

What We Need & What You Get

PLEASE GO TO OUR NEW UPDATED CROWDFUNDING PAGE FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SUPPORT THIS PROJECT:

http://igg.me/p/482289/x/3952623

story:
Who Are We?

In a Nutshell:

Small Batch Comics is a brand new, nonprofit publishing imprint that will focus solely on releasing the work of first time comic book creators.

We recoup our printing/distribution costs – the rest of the back-end goes right to the creators. There is no middle-man to slave your wages to & there is no profit margin for us.

It’s all about living within our means.

It’s all about helping creators, create.

Creators maintain 100% ownership of their work.

We only release DRM FREE digital content and all releases are protected under Creative Commons licensing

 

From our Press release:

A new nonprofit comic book publishing imprint opens its doors to distribute the work of first time creators:

Straight from the ever-expanding comic book proletariat, comes a brand new opportunity for independent comic creators: Small Batch Comics. Created as a home for new comic creators to showcase their work, Small Batch Comics now joins the ongoing movement in the comic culture to help push creator-owned content straight from unknown contemporary artists, into the hands of readers.

“I strongly believe that creator-owned titles are the renaissance the medium desperately needs right now in order to survive and truly evolve,” said Small Batch Comics’ founder, Jonathan Duran. “Now that technology has made interaction, collaboration and world-wide discourse so manageable, we should inevitably expect comic books as a medium to benefit from this instantly accessible pool of people, information and tools.”

It could be said that Small Batch Comics is the first Socialist collective in the medium; a publisher with a political, ethical and communal stake in the medium itself. Originally, with the creation of r/ComicBookCollabs, Small Batch’s main goal was to cultivate a community which focused on creating new comics via an online classified section for first time, burgeoning creators of all stripes. By combining a social networking backbone and more traditional, independent publishing, Small Batch Comics has made it easier than ever for first time creators to jump into the game. 2012 has often been referred to as ‘the year of the creator,’ and Small Batch plans to do their part to see that conjecture become a reality by helping amateur, undiscovered talent publish their work.

Small Batch Comics will offer an outlet for creators which includes a print and digital distribution method with full editorial services, all of which feed into the goal of helping first time creators create. “It has been said time and again; the way you break into comics is by making comics,” observes Duran, “The very specific phrasing, of having to ‘break in’, is vile to me; the fact that you have to break in to anything means that someone is actively trying to keep you out – art should not work this way. This is an opportunity for independent creative minds to articulate whatever they’d like, without filter; to say things that are volatile, poetic and subversive. By utilizing the resources freely available to us all we will usurp traditional publishing methods and create truly independent comics with authenticity, honesty and conscience - and in turn, take an active part in democratizing the medium and pushing it more into the hands of the masses.”

Small Batch Comics allows creators to retain 100% ownership of their projects and properties. All Small Batch comics will be released under Creative Commons Licenses. Small Batch Comics is a nonprofit organization (Business Entity Number: 6642227).

 

What We Need & What You Get

This Indiegogo campaign is to ensure distribution and creator recompense.

We set a goal of $3,000.00 on this campaign. This money will go to the following places:

  1. To pay for the print costs (and any ancillary costs) associated with creating physical copies of the books.
  1. To adequately promote and engage in a small-scale marketing campaign for the anthology release to ensure that these first time creators are more widely read.
  1. The remainder of any funds collected will be evenly distributed to the creators themselves. Since they’re making no money off of this project it’d be real nice to give them some compensation for all their hard work.

You’ll notice the conspicuous absence of a #4 wherein we, the publishers get to stuff our own pockets with your money. That’s because we’re not going to do that. We, the publishers, are making absolutely no money off of this project. Small Batch Comics is a nonprofit Organization (Business Entity Number: 6642227). The money goes right into the project and right to the creators – just like it should be. We do our part out of a belief in an ideology, not because we want to make a few bucks off of the backs of the people putting their backs into the creation of the work itself.

 

Whoa, Whoa, Whoa… Ideology? WTF Are You On About?

That’s right, we’re the dreamers. You see, we believe there is not only a very real economic inequity which currently blights the face of society, but also a creative disparity – meaning that often times, no matter what the medium, there is a high barrier of entry and a walled off garden of silence standing between small, amateur creators and an audience. Of course, there is a valid argument that this is a good thing – and certainly, every page scribbled up by every fourteen year old should not go to press (and it will not, we still vet submissions and selectively choose the best submissions to become real projects, after all) – but in theory, all should be equal. There should be every chance for the first time creator to have the attention of someone willing to do the backend work for them. So that’s where we come in. Our sole focus is on the person trying to get something made for the first time, our attention is focused on the little people. We want to make it as easy as possible for people to create their first comic work. We started what amounts to a classified website in order to help people find collaborators, through Reddit.com/r/comicbookcollabs and some of the people working on this first anthology found their dance partners through this venue. It is tools and resources such as these we hope to further cultivate and make freely available to the community at large.

And this is precisely what will set us apart from traditional publishers with huge amounts of capital behind them - we are the 99% comic book label - we make our own way and we can be successful at it if we simply use a bit of elbow grease and admit satisfaction within our means. We have so many tools freely available to use, to see this concept come to life. The open-source, freeware world is our companion and it is an invaluable resource that helps us to create things which will wrest some control away from the monopolizing business model that currently chokes this medium of autonomy. Just as the music industry imploded under the excess of its own obscene waste and overindulgence, we too can help build a new portion of the industry up around us. In music, the capable artists, with interesting things to say, decided to throw caution to the wind and strike out on their own to independently release their material in their own unique ways - it has proven viable and it can be repeated in the world of comics - Tenacity and passion should not be discounted and can give emotionless, out of touch avarice a run for its life any old day of the week as far as we’re concerned.

 

Let's Get Back To That Part About What YOU Get:

Well, we’re starting things off on a pretty small scale, so beyond our winning personalities and engaging stories we don’t really have much to give… How about we start with the following perks though?

Level #1 - Come on, try a little bit ($10.00-$24.99)

* A drm-free, digital version of our first anthology release - tons of public thanks and our genuine love, which springs eternal

 

Level #2 - Hold it in your hands ($25.00-$49.99)

All of the above plus:

* A print version of our first , limited-edition release

* Your name printed in our book on a "Thanks" page, listed under "concerned citizens"

 

Level #3 – Trusted Side Kicks ($50.00-$99.99)

All of the above plus:

* An additional print copy of our first, limited edition release (total 2)

*Your name will be listed on the "Thanks" page in our book, listed under "Trusted Side Kicks"

* A SBC sticker and button pack. Subversive slogans to adorn the world with!

* One "issue token" - good for a free print copy of a future Small Batch book of your choice

 

Level #4 – Super Hero ($100.00-$499.99)

All of the above plus:

* Go ahead and double that print quantity from above -you'll have a total of 4 printed copies of our first, limited-edition release

* Your name and a related url of your choosing will be listed on the "thanks" page in our book, listed under "Super Heroes"

* Double that "issue token" (total of 2)

 

Level #5 – The Resistance ($500.00-$999.99)

All of the above plus:

* Ten print copies of our first release

*Your name and url listed on the "thanks" page under "The Resistance"

* A personalized, unique piece of original art created by one of the artists on the book

 

Level #6 – Revolutionary ($1,000.00-$2,999.99)

All of the above plus:

* We'll give you 2 pages in our first release to put anything you want on - as long as you own the rights to publish it. (please note: we reserve the right to refuse you this perk if it turns out you are insane. For example no racist, hate-inducing religious or political propaganda will be tolerated!)

* A LIFETIME subscription to ALL of our releases in both print and digital versions

 

Level #7 – Brothers in Arms ($3,000.00)

All of the above plus:

*YOU ARE NOW A COMIC BOOK PUBLISHER. You've just bought into the company as a business partner and are officially part of the Small Batch publishing collective from this moment forward! Let's release some comics.

 

 

The End Game

What does it all mean? Well, simply put, this project is all about making it easier for people like you (unless you’re a famous comic creator already) to get their work out there in the wild, albeit on a smaller scale. This is the minor leagues, where people can cut their teeth, learn more about the process of creating a comic book and hopefully, meet and collaborate with some amazing people who they can form long-term bonds with and continue to collaborate with on grander things.

 

I’m Broke – What Else Can I Do to Help?

Well, first off, we’re sorry you’re broke… just remember some of the greatest artists throughout history died in extreme poverty… that’s not necessarily supposed to make you feel better, it’s just supposed to remind you that one day you will die and your pain will be over.

Kidding (sort of)!

If you want to help in a non-monetary fashion, then please, SPREAD THE WORD. Post about us, interview us (press@smallbatchcomics.com), tweet, blog and harangue anyone you can so that by the end of this campaign everyone is aware of this tiny speck on their glasses that’s starting to obscure their vision. This is how things begin, in small, subtle ways; the spreading of information. We sincerely hope that the community wil not only take an active part in spreading the words and concepts above, but also, believe they have value – by resisting the cynical urge to scoff and instead thoughtfully embrace any sort of peaceful insurrection and corporate disobedience.

 

BUT ALSO - you know the best way you could help us out?

By submitting a pitch to us! By giving us some great content to publish!

Seriously - we still have room for content in the first Anthology release! The best way to help us is by making good work and allowing us to publish it for you  - the better work we release the more help we've just received!

We love all genres and styles - send us your projects and become an integral part of this campaign's success for free!

 

 

 Thank you all! Let’s make some comics!

 

 

Here are some samples the first book we will be releasing; the anthology collection titled "Batch #1" - We are still adding stories to this project so we wil continually update this project with new material as creators join up!

(all work seen below is pulled from work-in-progress samples)

 Stories included in the anthology so far:

"A Twelve Minute Revolution in Just Reading"

6 pages
Written by Darren Hupke
Art by Vincent Tang

An unknown assassin enters a crazed Nazi scientist's lab late at night and the dying Nazi fights for his life while trying to discover the identity of his killer.

 


 

 

"GODDAMMIT!"

8 pages

Written and Drawn by: Hardstein

 Professor Todd Gamut dies suddenly, only to find himself in Afterlife Number One. Knowing he could die again, and unaware of what may lie in the after-afterlife, it’s a fight for survival, as he tries to establish a new life in the wake of his death.

 

 

"Engine Whispers"

8 pages

Written by Dylan Faraday

Art by Alex Dunn

A story about a space mechanic who does more than tune-ups…

 

 

"Erzsebet"

Written and Drawn by Daniel de Sosa

Comedic fantasy epic about two minor demon chicks who try to summon in the beast of Apocalypse, screw up the spell badly, and accidentally bring in the Beast of Utopia and World Peace instead.

Straight from the ever-expanding comic book proletariat, comes a brand new opportunity for independent comic creators: Small Batch Comics. Created as a home for new comic creators to showcase their work, Small Batch Comics now joins the ongoing movement in the comic culture to help push creator-owned content straight from unknown contemporary artists, into the hands of readers.
“I strongly believe that creator-owned titles are the renaissance the medium desperately needs right now in order to survive and truly evolve,” said Small Batch Comics’ founder, Jonathan Duran. “Now that technology has made interaction, collaboration and world-wide discourse so manageable, we should inevitably expect comic books as a medium to benefit from this instantly accessible pool of people, information and tools.”
It could be said that Small Batch Comics is the first Socialist collective in the medium; a publisher with a political, ethical and communal stake in the medium itself. Originally, with the creation of r/ComicBookCollabs, Small Batch’s main goal was to cultivate a community which focused on creating new comics via an online classified section for first time, burgeoning creators of all stripes. By combining a social networking backbone and more traditional, independent publishing, Small Batch Comics has made it easier than ever for first time creators to jump into the game. 2012 has often been referred to as ‘the year of the creator,’ and Small Batch plans to do their part to see that conjecture become a reality by helping amateur, undiscovered talent publish their work.
Small Batch Comics will offer an outlet for creators which includes a print and digital distribution method with full editorial services, all of which feed into the goal of helping first time creators create. “It has been said time and again; the way you break into comics is by making comics,” observes Duran, “The very specific phrasing, of having to ‘break in’, is vile to me; the fact that you have to break in to anything means that someone is actively trying to keep you out – art should not work this way. This is an opportunity for independent creative minds to articulate whatever they’d like, without filter; to say things that are volatile, poetic and subversive. By utilizing the resources freely available to us all we will usurp traditional publishing methods and create truly independent comics with authenticity, honesty and conscience - and in turn, take an active part in democratizing the medium and pushing it more into the hands of the masses.”
Small Batch Comics allows creators to retain 100% ownership of their projects and properties. All Small Batch comics will be released under Creative Commons Licenses. Small Batch Comics is a nonprofit organization (Business Entity Number: 6642227).
 
What We Need & What You Get
This Indiegogo campaign is to ensure distribution and creator recompense.
We set a goal of $3,000.00 on this campaign. This money will go to the following places:

To pay for the print costs (and any ancillary costs) associated with creating physical copies of the books.

To adequately promote and engage in a small-scale marketing campaign for the anthology release to ensure that these first time creators are more widely read.

The remainder of any funds collected will be evenly distributed to the creators themselves. Since they’re making no money off of this project it’d be real nice to give them some compensation for all their hard work.
You’ll notice the conspicuous absence of a #4 wherein we, the publishers get to stuff our own pockets with your money. That’s because we’re not going to do that. We, the publishers, are making absolutely no money off of this project. Small Batch Comics is a nonprofit Organization (Business Entity Number: 6642227). The money goes right into the project and right to the creators – just like it should be. We do our part out of a belief in an ideology, not because we want to make a few bucks off of the backs of the people putting their backs into the creation of the work itself.
 
Whoa, Whoa, Whoa… Ideology? WTF Are You On About?
That’s right, we’re the dreamers. You see, we believe there is not only a very real economic inequity which currently blights the face of society, but also a creative disparity – meaning that often times, no matter what the medium, there is a high barrier of entry and a walled off garden of silence standing between small, amateur creators and an audience. Of course, there is a valid argument that this is a good thing – and certainly, every page scribbled up by every fourteen year old should not go to press (and it will not, we still vet submissions and selectively choose the best submissions to become real projects, after all) – but in theory, all should be equal. There should be every chance for the first time creator to have the attention of someone willing to do the backend work for them. So that’s where we come in. Our sole focus is on the person trying to get something made for the first time, our attention is focused on the little people. We want to make it as easy as possible for people to create their first comic work. We started what amounts to a classified website in order to help people find collaborators, through Reddit.com/r/comicbookcollabs and some of the people working on this first anthology found their dance partners through this venue. It is tools and resources such as these we hope to further cultivate and make freely available to the community at large.
And this is precisely what will set us apart from traditional publishers with huge amounts of capital behind them - we are the 99% comic book label - we make our own way and we can be successful at it if we simply use a bit of elbow grease and admit satisfaction within our means. We have so many tools freely available to use, to see this concept come to life. The open-source, freeware world is our companion and it is an invaluable resource that helps us to create things which will wrest some control away from the monopolizing business model that currently chokes this medium of autonomy. Just as the music industry imploded under the excess of its own obscene waste and overindulgence, we too can help build a new portion of the industry up around us. In music, the capable artists, with interesting things to say, decided to throw caution to the wind and strike out on their own to independently release their material in their own unique ways - it has proven viable and it can be repeated in the world of comics - Tenacity and passion should not be discounted and can give emotionless, out of touch avarice a run for its life any old day of the week as far as we’re concerned.
 
Let's Get Back To That Part About What YOU Get:
Well, we’re starting things off on a pretty small scale, so beyond our winning personalities and engaging stories we don’t really have much to give… How about we start with the following perks though?
Level #1 - Come on, try a little bit ($10.00-$24.99)
* A drm-free, digital version of our first anthology release - tons of public thanks and our genuine love, which springs eternal
 
Level #2 - Hold it in your hands ($25.00-$49.99)
All of the above plus:
* A print version of our first , limited-edition release
* Your name printed in our book on a "Thanks" page, listed under "concerned citizens"
 
Level #3 – Trusted Side Kicks ($50.00-$99.99)
All of the above plus:
* An additional print copy of our first, limited edition release (total 2)
*Your name will be listed on the "Thanks" page in our book, listed under "Trusted Side Kicks"
* A SBC sticker and button pack. Subversive slogans to adorn the world with!
* One "issue token" - good for a free print copy of a future Small Batch book of your choice
 
Level #4 – Super Hero ($100.00-$499.99)
All of the above plus:
* Go ahead and double that print quantity from above -you'll have a total of 4 printed copies of our first, limited-edition release
* Your name and a related url of your choosing will be listed on the "thanks" page in our book, listed under "Super Heroes"
* Double that "issue token" (total of 2)
 
Level #5 – The Resistance ($500.00-$999.99)
All of the above plus:
* Ten print copies of our first release
*Your name and url listed on the "thanks" page under "The Resistance"
* A personalized, unique piece of original art created by one of the artists on the book
 
Level #6 – Revolutionary ($1,000.00-$2,999.99)
All of the above plus:
* We'll give you 2 pages in our first release to put anything you want on - as long as you own the rights to publish it. (please note: we reserve the right to refuse you this perk if it turns out you are insane. For example no racist, hate-inducing religious or political propaganda will be tolerated!)
* A LIFETIME subscription to ALL of our releases in both print and digital versions
  
Level #7 – Brothers in Arms ($3,000.00)
All of the above plus:
*YOU ARE NOW A COMIC BOOK PUBLISHER. You've just bought into the company as a business partner and are officially part of the Small Batch publishing collective from this moment forward! Let's release some comics.
 
 
The End Game
What does it all mean? Well, simply put, this project is all about making it easier for people like you (unless you’re a famous comic creator already) to get their work out there in the wild, albeit on a smaller scale. This is the minor leagues, where people can cut their teeth, learn more about the process of creating a comic book and hopefully, meet and collaborate with some amazing people who they can form long-term bonds with and continue to collaborate with on grander things.
 
I’m Broke – What Else Can I Do to Help?

Well, first off, we’re sorry you’re broke… just remember some of the greatest artists throughout history died in extreme poverty… that’s not necessarily supposed to make you feel better, it’s just supposed to remind you that one day you will die and your pain will be over.
Kidding (sort of)!
If you want to help in a non-monetary fashion, then please, SPREAD THE WORD. Post about us, interview us (press@smallbatchcomics.com), tweet, blog and harangue anyone you can so that by the end of this campaign everyone is aware of this tiny speck on their glasses that’s starting to obscure their vision. This is how things begin, in small, subtle ways; the spreading of information. We sincerely hope that the community wil not only take an active part in spreading the words and concepts above, but also, believe they have value – by resisting the cynical urge to scoff and instead thoughtfully embrace any sort of peaceful insurrection and corporate disobedience.
 
BUT ALSO - you know the best way you could help us out?
By submitting a pitch to us! By giving us some great content to publish!
Seriously - we still have room for content in the first Anthology release! The best way to help us is by making good work and allowing us to publish it for you  - the better work we release the more help we've just received!
We love all genres and styles - send us your projects and become an integral part of this campaign's success for free!
 
 
 Thank you all! Let’s make some comics!
 
 
Here are some samples the first book we will be releasing; the anthology collection titled "Batch #1" - We are still adding stories to this project so we wil continually update this project with new material as creators join up!
(all work seen below is pulled from work-in-progress samples)
 Stories included in the anthology so far:
"A Twelve Minute Revolution in Just Reading"6 pagesWritten by Darren HupkeArt by Vincent TangAn unknown assassin enters a crazed Nazi scientist's lab late at night and the dying Nazi fights for his life while trying to discover the identity of his killer.
 

 
 
"GODDAMMIT!"
8 pages
Written and Drawn by: Hardstein
 Professor Todd Gamut dies suddenly, only to find himself in Afterlife Number One. Knowing he could die again, and unaware of what may lie in the after-afterlife, it’s a fight for survival, as he tries to establish a new life in the wake of his death.
 

 
"Engine Whispers"
8 pages
Written by Dylan Faraday
Art by Alex Dunn
A story about a space mechanic who does more than tune-ups…
 

 
"Erzsebet"
Written and Drawn by Daniel de Sosa
Comedic fantasy epic about two minor demon chicks who try to summon in the beast of Apocalypse, screw up the spell badly, and accidentally bring in the Beast of Utopia and World Peace instead.

story:
COMEDY MENU

I’ve always loved and laughed watching those great Johnny Carson and David Letterman cooking segments and that’s where the inspiration began .

Comedy Menu blends comedy and cuisine together into a truly original series where, in the end, top-name comics must eat their own work and respected chefs must suffer fools - all near an open flame. Simple. Delicious. Hilarious.

I’m excited and driven to offer up 7 fully-produced episodes featuring top comic guest-stars. The budget considers the cost of everything from sauté pans to paying the talent and crew. My background in comedy is extensive and my 40 plus years' experience in and knowledge of producing a live show has well prepared me for Comedy Menu. I know a lot of famous comics who would love to get in the kitchen with the brilliant comic Kira Soltanovich (who wouldn’t?) and cook up something funny for us! I’m so excited about this very commercial, fresh, funny idea!

Wouldn’t you love to see Sarah Silverman or Louie CK attempting to prepare Haggis Tartar on The Food Network or Comedy Central? People tell me, “Yes!”

Related Professional Experience:

Contributing Monologue Writer for Late Night with David Letterman (3 years, Worldwide Pants)

Comic/Booker/Producer of live shows at the Hollywood Improv (21 years - Currently)

Writer/Collaborator of Standup Material with or for everyone from Sam Kinison to Sidney Poitier (30 years - Currently)

Pierre Cossette Productions – Co-Creator/Writer of sit-com “Womb Mates” with Wendy Jo Sperber. (Cossette-NBC development contract)

Los Angeles Times – Wrote comedy column in the Style section with bi-line; “Chris Pina’s Daily Essential List” (3 years)

Staff Writer for The Game Show Network’s “National Lampoon’s Funny Money” (2 seasons)

Host-Producer of “Rick Overton & Friends” (special appearances by Robin Williams, Hal Sparks, Ken Jeong & many more “friends”) at the Hollywood Improv. (8 years - Currently)

Wrote/Voiced/ Directed “Mascots” for Endemol’s Web Division (1 season)

Stand-up Comic – Since 1978, paid performer at nearly every venue in California. The Improv, The Comedy Store (with Sam Kinison), Laugh Factory, Comedy & Magic Club, Flappers, Cobb’s, The Punchline, Throckmorton Theatre, Fake Gallery, etc

Producer/Performer/Host of the acclaimed “Mind The Gap” live show with Laraine Newman, Kelly Carlin, Rick Overton, Dylan Brody, Chris Bonno, Gary Shapiro and Rick Shapiro. Stand-up, Spoken Word and Cool Music!

Actor/Writer for 5 Los Angeles theatrical hits: “The Green Room” (Lead only), “Camp!”, “The National Void”, “Buried on the Back Page” and the award-winning satirical musical, “A Cardigan Christmas Show”.

Improvisation – Second City Alum, Off The Wall, The Fugitives, Rick Overton & Friends.

Television/Theatrical/Film Actor – Working SAG member since 1970. Last job on camera: Microsoft Office international TV, on-camera ad (You Tube “Chris Pina, Microsoft”) (2013-2014)

There’s so much more, but you get the idea.

Please contribute any amount you can to this sure-to-be hit. The great thing about COMEDY MENU is that it’s live at a comedy club and it hasn’t been done before. Also, I’ll get the best comics in the biz! Folks, this is the show that keeps my creative juices flowing and makes me wake up with a purpose… and a hunger. Please help me get this very cool show up! Bon Appetit!

http://youtu.be/QP3Uw--0mHU
